author: {'steamid': '76561198347107320', 'num_games_owned': 3094, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 4286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4286, 'last_played': 1572095342}
review:
◆感谢汉化组！民间全语音汉化补丁[url=https://weibo.com/ttarticle/p/show?id=2309404330613380376839#_0]点我[/url]；
◆推荐给不排斥百合的所有日常系VN爱好者；
◆含有中量剧透（多为引用原剧对白），请诸位酌情食用。

[h1]可以跳过的一点废话[/h1]
[spoiler] 
[strike]快到LGBTQ+周末了，该把之前写了一半的两个心头好游戏拿出来卖安利了[/strike]
对不起等我写完的时候已经到了万圣打折 三百六十度空翻跪地切腹谢罪.jpg[/spoiler]
我有个近乡情怯式的毛病，就是[strike]爱你在心口难开[/strike]越喜欢的游戏越不敢动笔，[spoiler]比如文档开了两年还没写完一半的Witness [/spoiler]，一怕这点诠才末学在精雕细琢的神作面前只够描述个皮毛，二怕带着粉丝滤镜吹捧过头，反而让玩家期待过高，三当然是逃不掉的剧透问题，尤其是像VN/AVG这样的叙事主导型游戏，些微的剧透都可能影响游戏体验，但往往它最触动人心的精华部分又很难在不剧透的前提下充分展现出来，实在是一个进退两难的问题。
所幸比起稍后要推的G篇的<红弦俱乐部>，L篇的<屋顶上的百合灵>受到剧透的影响并不太大，它是个即使知道了剧情也能看得津津有味的故事。

[h1]正文[/h1]
总的来说，我觉得这是一部很成熟的VN[spoiler]（并不是指R18）[/spoiler]，“成熟”是指制作组完全明白自己想要什么样的作品，对它的优势、风格、目标群体有明确定位和熟练把控。说写校园轻百合就真的是写最普通平凡的女子高中生生活，这些鸡毛蒜皮的琐事和少女情怀，正因为它普通才显得鲜活而生动。[b]它并未优秀到超群绝伦，但也绝不是千人一面，这是一种微妙的恰如其分的好。[/b]剧情、对白、音乐、立绘、配音，不会有任何一部分让你感觉到重心偏颇或喧宾夺主的不自然。
我想即使不是白河豚，也很容易被这种轻松、舒缓、甜蜜而和谐的氛围所带动，个人觉得它作为百合入门作来说再合适不过了。

[b]是的在正文之前我还有点[spoiler]废[/spoiler]话要说[/b]
因为说到LG主题就忍不住想讨论人类五大灵魂拷问之一：

[b]爱（在这里体现为同性之爱）是什么？[/b]

这当然是一个没有标准答案的问题，那问得再详细一点，爱是一种单一的纯粹的排他的情感吗？还是复合的混杂着无数干扰因素的情绪呢？
如果是单一的，那么刨除掉这些因素之后纯粹的爱还剩下什么？
如果是复合的，那么爱是 喜悦、骄傲、陪伴、迁就、占有欲？尊重、理解、情欲、习惯、责任心？怜悯、嫉妒、宽容、信任、满足感？
如果一个人说自己感受到“爱情”，他/她所真正感受到的是这些情绪的排列组合吗？
但亲人、朋友、搭档、同侪之间也同样存在这些感情，究竟哪些该被划分为友情，哪些又该被归因于爱呢？
尤其对于同性的亲朋好友之间，在这情绪的大杂烩里，所谓的“爱情”又占有多少分量？是否足以对彼此的关系做出改变？

当然，我问这些并不是准备说“在这个游戏里你可以找到答案”这样的鬼话，毕竟[b]这个故事的整体基调轻松甜蜜，所谓的思考、纠结、矛盾也无非都是些小打小闹[/b]，而且像这类“永恒的问题”也实在不是一两个故事可以解答得了的。
只是<百合灵>确实给玩家展示了一些典型：一见钟情的前后辈、顾虑重重的师生恋、有时无法互相理解的情侣、从亲人发展为恋人青梅竹马等等……没有插满tag的标准性格，没有五花八门的狗血剧情，每个人都是平凡人，都有缺点，会犯错、冲动、任性、失态，说些不过脑子的糊涂话，但每个人也在学习、成长、相互包容和磨合。
[quote=一条鱼。（此处的爱为泛指）]
（……）
好在那里，坏也在那里。你若要爱他，便要跨过那些错误去爱他。
这就是为什么爱很难。你得容忍对方和愚蠢，容忍对方的刻薄，指出对方的错，理解对方的辩白，指望对方因为爱你而去改正。
这就是为什么爱是一种非常高超的情感技能。它那么难，我们又不是出生就能学会。所以我们只能在爱的关系里学习去爱。很多人学会了，很多人学的磕磕绊绊，很多人在学的过程中犯了错，却还是不想放弃，所以你得连着错的那部分一并原谅。原谅自己的，也原谅对方的。
[/quote]

[h1]真正的正文[/h1]
在谈剧情之前先简单表扬一下美术，担任本作立绘的Peg（ぺぐ）老师作画清新细腻，线条干净，上色简单，人体基本不僵硬，特别适合校园美少女！（P站id=5020，顺便说一句她主页有不少官方糖）而且本作的人设相当细腻，无论是根据自身性格设计的每位角色独有站姿、在领口袖口和毛衣处稍有不同的夏服冬服运动服，还是为数不多但完全贴合剧本描述的特殊动作（比如拿着笔记本的美夕和她身后半侧着身子去看的茉莉），都能看出一种“平平无奇”下的用心。尤其是不少衣服甚至全篇只出场一两次但依然画得很认真（比如比奈的常规校服），以及如果仔细注意的话，阳香在校服衬衫里的T恤至少出现过五个不同花色，广播室三人组夏季合宿的常服T恤颜色是一直在轮换的（女孩子当然是要每天换衣服啦！）
更别说Peg老师完全把握住了西式制服的美！还借着两位幽灵的身份画了水手服！
[spoiler]嗷嗷嗷！赞美JK！[/spoiler]

咳咳，说回剧情，虽然有着“主角能看见幽灵”这样的灵异设定，但<百合灵>的整体剧情仍然十分【寻常】。开头已经说过，我说的寻常是夸奖，可以理解为“好清纯不做作”2333
除了霓虹特色的校园活动之外，本作嬉笑怒骂的日常高中生活描绘实在有很多能让人会心一笑产生共鸣的地方。
剧透↓[spoiler]
“学校里进狗啦！”
结奈的调虎离山计真是充满画面感；

-“为什么连远见同学也要追过来？！”
-“不要问我为什么，解释不清楚！” 
-“不要在学校里奔跑！”
鸡飞狗跳又莫名其妙的走廊追击战；

“如果我是昏睡病，沙纱是耍帅病，羽美你就是没朋友会死病”
谁都有那么一两个烦人又舍不得绝交的朋友吧（笑

“是谁把如此美好的小可爱生育出来的！是你吗！岳母大人！”
“如果不知道哪里的神跟我说‘这是我给你的礼物唷’的话，我就信奉你！绝对！”
哈哈哈哈哈哈是我的心声无误；

“老实说，那个时候很开心。但是，对于已经清醒过来的现在来说，只想把那段时期从人生中抹去。……啊啊，好想人生倒带。只要能遇见那个时候的我，我一定痛揍她一顿让她清醒过来啊！”
在中二时期写了很多关于占卜、死亡、魔法阵一类的非主流文学还起了黑历史玛丽苏名字的沙纱，可能是大部分少女梦的集合体了；

“要怎么做，才能无悔地说句‘太好了’呢？”[/spoiler]

特别害羞的、被稍微表扬一下或者把事情搞砸了就会满脸通红的阿野、虽然有点粗神经但意外地坚持自我的阳香、因为太在意外部评价而不懂得拒绝别人的相原前辈、只知道埋头努力却没能搞定团队关系的结奈、天台的传说、为了赌气的互相爆料、干坏事遇到老师的撒腿就跑、女生间流传的各种稀奇古怪的占卜祈愿法……表现手法上稍微做了点夸张，但事件本身太普通太常见也太真实了，这种鸡飞狗跳的鲜活魅力却唯有靠最普通最常见的无数零零散散的小事才能拼凑成型，这甚至是很多gal不屑于做的事，但往往就是这样，真实的寻常的东西才最打动人。

[h1]Girls’ Love 以下全程剧透 [/h1]
爱令人矛盾，令人勇往直前又瞻前顾后、全神贯注又心猿意马、善解人意又斤斤计较，令人变得奇怪、变得不安、变得不像自己，但不可否认，也会令人变得更好。
<百合灵>里的七对情侣各有特色，[strike]简直可以编一份《恋爱中的傻样·大全》[/strike]，有笨拙的小心翼翼的试探、有被回应后的不知所措、有胡思乱想的纠结和苦恼、也有自以为是的单方面闷气，各种恋爱中人的小毛病小脾气，以一种并不令人讨厌的、轻松愉悦的、美化过的形式展露出来。
[spoiler]
比如说交往五年的茉莉和美夕：
为了避免交往的事被父母知道而受到阻挠，善于思考规划的美夕约定彼此在外低调行事：[b] “走出家门，自己养活自己，活出让别人挑不出毛病的生活，在那一天来临之前，我们都只能算是孩子，从世间的眼光来看就是如此” [/b]，但大大咧咧茉莉却会因为长期没有亲密接触而产生不安感，忍不住在学校对美夕做点接吻以上的事，生气的时候还会拿相识的同性好友作例子说些“比起你还是她更好”的浑话。同样地，美夕也会因为茉莉太受欢迎而被嫉妒支配地说“是因为你总是不知不觉中做出让人误会的事”。
[b] “为什么只有我要这么努力地为各种事情担心呢？但这是很重要的事，经过认真考虑才做下的约定。……为什么只有我在为我们的以后认真打算？”
“我都知道，我理解，但你不能也理解一下我吗？” [/b]
吵架了等对方先服软结果不小心变成冷战——这可能是所有情侣都会经历的事，但游戏比现实更快乐的地方就在于，十几个章节之后双方一定能达成和解：
[b] “我们都想把自己的想法强加于对方，这样是不对的。……我想和美夕走得更远，一直一直走下去。” [/b]
还有，[strike]不以分手为目的的吵架只是在秀恩爱而已吧你们[/strike]

又比如说戏份最多的两对官配：
纱知X惠（百合灵）& 结奈X比奈（主角与她的小青梅）
惠这个角色塑造得很有灵性，天真可爱又自私任性，会因为无聊去扮演“厕所的花子”进行恶作剧，会自得其乐地鼓励来天台的阳香：[b] “虽然我的声音传达不出去，导致对话根本无法成型，但是无所谓啦，懂得享受单方面对话的乐趣，才是优秀的幽灵！” “你在说什么呢，告白这种事，稍微犯一点傻才叫刚刚好呢！可以毫不羞耻地做笨蛋才会做的事，是坠入爱河的人拥有的特权。” [/b]（即使这些话阳香都听不见），会死皮赖脸地在结奈的本子上用血画小兔子，也会为了自己和纱知姐的初体验而强人所难地催促结奈。想要什么东西的时候就会很任性地要求“我要这个！你给我去弄来！”，但你又能感觉到她其实并没有坏心，时不时也会对你关怀有加。
纱知与惠的爱情有点儿戏剧性，纱知生前是个阴沉内向的姑娘，八十年前死于一场意外，由于对没能说出口的暗恋念念不忘，最终成了一名地缚灵，从此开始模仿她所憧憬的那位开朗可靠的暗恋对象的为人处事和一言一行，养成了一副看似稳重优雅的性格，而惠呢本身体弱多病，因为见到了纱知的灵体对她一见钟情，不顾身体地勤来学校，最终导致病情恶化，死后由于对纱知的执念也成为了地缚灵。
这样的两位幽灵，在一起几十年如胶似漆，却各自在心底隐藏着不安，一个认为对方爱的只是自己的假面，不敢向她展现面具底下懦弱的自我，另一个则纠结对方是不是因为对自己的死心怀愧疚和怜悯才同意交往，实际上并未怀有等量的爱意。
但带着假象的爱就不是爱了吗？带着怜悯和同情的爱就是不是爱了吗？
[b] “因为喜欢你而说谎的我，因为喜欢我而沉默的你。虽然坦白了，我们的关系也没有变呢，怀着同样的感情而隐藏着的秘密，都已经传递给对方了吧。” [/b]

在故事的最后部分，结奈被告白的自我纠结阶段，纱知给出了她的最终答案：“同样是‘喜欢’，但每个人的概念都不一样，大家都是这样的。……（80年前）我没有像现在的结奈这么认真地考虑过，我回避了自己的心意。…………（对于结奈）我觉得很羡慕，因为你有从一开就去面对它的勇气。……我遇见结奈后，见过了各种各样的人，她们都怀着不同的心事，她们都很珍惜自己的这份感情，告白的人也好，被告白的人也好，都是这样的。都直率地面对了自己心中，喜欢对方的感情。我也一样。我喜欢惠，这份心意，只有我有。所以呢，结奈，我明白的，喜欢那个人的心情——所谓的恋爱呢，那是——只有自己才有的。……恋爱，是为了自己而生的哦。”

结奈呢，为六对情侣的恋情忙前忙后，却在自己的感情问题上陷入迷惘：
“我不知道。因为，我真的不知道。”
“我……是这么看待比奈的吗？至今，有对比奈动过心吗？还是被比奈告别之后，才产生了类似的感觉？……（从小一起长大）我的这份‘喜欢’和比奈对我的‘喜欢’是相称的吗……我的感觉，和比奈的感觉，有谁能证明不是错觉呢？”
……
“我在害怕，害怕着商量后从园生老师那里得到的回答。害怕也许她会说‘这不是错觉’，但同样也害怕着她说‘可能是误解’”
……
“因为一直在一起，喜欢也是当然的吧。但那说不定是作为妹妹、作为家人的喜欢，或者也说不定，是作为朋友的喜欢。”
“如果答应了之后发现我的喜欢和比奈的不一样，她也会难过的吧？还有我们的父母也是，比奈也是…会带来困扰的吧…”

“那么，把这些你所烦恼的事全部扔掉呢？父母的阻碍、外人的评价、对方的心情这些通通不去考虑之后的答案呢？我想比奈并不是一定要和你交往，只是在期待一个你心底的真实的答案。” 
直女阿野的这句话大概适用于故事里的所有告白，同性间的感情受到外部的负面影响不在少数，像这样的高中生间懵懂的爱慕真的能支撑她们走完人生吗？谁也不知道，但不管怎么说它至少会成为回忆里美好的璀璨的片段，对于故事中这些可爱的花季少女来说，也许即使是前途未卜的恋情，只要自己的心意被传达到、被认真考虑和答复了，就是无比幸运的事。

故事里的结奈在思索了一个月后告诉比奈：
[b] “我想要去回应那坦率又坚定的眼神。想要成为配得上你的自己。想要成为自信的、能和你这样走下去的自己。” [/b]
而故事外的我们则和结奈一起，看着最终达成心愿而往生的百合灵，也看着甜蜜恩爱的一对对年轻的百合恋人们：
“这是没有悲伤也没有难过的分别，这只是为她们启程的送别。”
“再见了，总有一天能再见的。”
[/spoiler]

I have played many visual novels in my time and this one ranks among the best. The story is amazing but it is a little slow at the start but once the ball got rolling I did not want to stop playing. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes a good story.

review:

点击关注我们发现更多好游戏 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9619592-Blacklist_//]黑名组[/url] 点击加入我们 [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Blacklistgroup_/]黑名单[/url][/quote]

[h1]前言[/h1]

《屋上的百合灵》是由Liar-soft开发，还是我们著名的黄油大厂MangaGamer发行，作品最早于2012年就面世了，本作是全语音支持的正式版。感谢[url=https://weibo.com/ttarticle/p/show?id=2309404330613380376839#_0/]白衣汉化组[/url]让我玩到了完美的汉化版，下面就来简单的说一说本作为什么会被称之为“百合神作”的原因吧。

[h1]剧情[/h1]

主人公——远见 结奈重复着一如既往独自的午后屋顶时光，享受着平静日常的她今日注定不会再平静下去，她在屋顶居然见到了[b]幽灵！[/b]——一对学园内的地缚灵，为什么说是一对呢，因为她们搞百合啊，没见过吧，百合幽灵简称——百合灵！结奈因为未知的原因所以能看到她们，两只可爱又呆萌的幽灵向结奈倾诉了愿望，她们希望结奈帮助她们实现和恋人之间的初体验这种事，那么这种事该如何解决呢，对于这种事都非常困惑的她们给出了办法，那就是帮助这座学园里有百合倾向的女生们促成好事。帮助她们并且排除障碍，促成一对对的百合情侣，主人公的作用就在这里了，而主人公自己深藏的心意能否在撮合别人的过程中表达出去呢？百合灵们又是否能完成愿望好好升天呢？学园里的互怀心事的姑娘们能否修成正果呢？让我们拭目以待吧。

这部作品是2012年的，真的是令我意想不到，我除了这部作品根本没听说过其他在剧情上相似的作品，一般都是描写主人公自己的恋爱，把主人公自己设定为最优先的目标，其余的一切都是衬托主角自己的故事，而这部作品是让你当一个“爱情丘比特”，让你享受帮助别人，撮合别人的快乐，没错，帮助他人确实非常快乐，尤其是这些性格鲜明又塑造饱满的一众妹子，看着她们之间的小剧场真的令我有种看到了活生生的她们在现实中进行磕磕绊绊的百合恋情，除了享受还是享受，当然其中带给我最多的还是感动。

我明白为什么一个大男孩喜欢百合作品了，只有女孩子之间的恋爱才是真的洗涤心灵啊！

[h1]画面&音乐[/h1]

本作可是有年头的老作品了，但在画面上的水准和现在普遍的gal相比也毫不逊色，为什么这么说，因为我个人觉得现在很多的视觉小说类型尤其是gal会着重的美化立绘和场景，但其他的一些东西往往都会“避重就轻”，现在的玩家普遍都挑立绘和画面，之后再挑剧本和其他一些东西，而本作不光画面、音乐、剧本等等合在一起就已经能打败一大票的新游戏了，往往你在体验本作的时候会感觉一切都很合适，很搭配，很自然，立绘和场景可能分辨率低，以你列文虎克的功力可能会看到瑕疵，但你也一定会发出感叹，这他娘的画面就该如此，多一分不多，少一分不少，经典老旧的东西就该要这样，它会令你就像听一首震撼心灵的曲子，余音绕梁三日不绝。

没错啊，光有精美的画面那也只是一层华美的空壳，苍白的剧本无力的角色塑造这些加在一起你能靠画面来吃一辈子吗？不能，而《屋上的百合灵》就能，就算这甜美可爱的画风赶不上时代，就算这欢快动听又悠扬缭绕的音乐在你听来也和周董念经一样的乏味，就算我们听了耳朵都差点怀孕的声优们也令你觉得不过如此，但《百合灵》的剧本一定会把你这对百合无感的糙汉子给改变成喜欢百合纯爱播撒百合种子的园丁。

啊没错，我已经入教了，就在体验过这部作品之后，百合真好啊（感叹）

[h1]总结[/h1]

有很多东西都没有说出来，因为主要还是要让你自己体验，你自己得出的感受才是真实的东西，我只能告诉你这部作品原价买也不亏，体验一次后还远远的没有体验完，值得细细品味再重复重复反复反复体验的作品，如果说这部作品不算神作那我也不知道什么样的作品该称之为神作了，至少，它确实在我心目中是神作。

[h1]Story & Writings[/h1]

☐ Poor

[h1]Game time / Length (Following VNDB)[/h1]
☐ Very short (0 - 2 hours)

This was my first Yuri from MG aside from Sono Hanabira. Kindred spirit has a very Excellent Story and Characters where the writing and Drama is also over the top from what you could expect from Yuri Story. Though likewise it falls on the Sprite,OST, and engine that support it,

author: {'steamid': '76561198000774400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1569514935}
review:
Very enjoyable VN.
The art style is very much on the "classic" side. Looks hand drawn and not as saturated as
modern digital anime looks these days.
But that style totally works here.
Steam for some reason does not track my time, it seems. But should be around 40 hrs.
So it's rather long. But I never felt bored.
Had to force myself to stop each evening.

The voice acting is top notch.
But only like hmmm, 30% or so of this novel is actually voiced.
Most of it in the last third of the novel.
I don't understand why they decided to not voice over a lot of scenes, because those
didn't seem to be less important than others.
So I consider this a minus.

The story is very sweet. All of the characters are likable. Some more, some less though.
But in the end, I felt for every couple.

The lewd scenes are all pushed pretty far back towards the finale, which kinda makes sense here.
And you only get "ecchi" level of lewdness. The most you will see are nipples. But the primary areas are
tactically hidden under blankets or behind other body parts.
Well. I didn't watch this one for the sex scenes tbh.
The different story routes of the couples are just sweet and touching.
Every couple has it's own unique set of challenges to overcome.
And the last couple that appears can be surprising, if you don't watch the into scenes too closely.
(My suggestion: Don't!)

Another little complaint: Some of the small "cherry" scenes only offer redundant conversations from another persons perspective with virtually no additional info for the reader.
So those should have be cut. Luckily, you can skip those in one click if you want.
Oh, and don't just skip all of them. Because some of them actually have important scenes
and one lewd one is also hidden there...

So overall a more soft, more grounded VN.
(even when there is an unrealistic number of female couples. But yeah.)

Absolutely worth it and (if it matters to you), I think this one is 100% enjoyable by both genders.
There is no mindless fan service or other silly stuff.
(not judging, just telling you)

review:

Absolutely worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007936791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1966, 'last_played': 1563703993}
review:
This game made my VN Favourites List, so if you're interested in others like it, check out my Curator page here:

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35651135/] Val's Visual Novels, Anime & Hentai [/url]

[u][h1]Style[/h1][/u]
[u]Art[/u]
Simple but well designed characters that have their each distinctive look, something that's often overlooked but kinda important so they can be easily recognised. Art is well done and suits the theme.

[u]Eroge Content[/u]
Yep, no patch needed, its tastefully and appropriately done according to the story, nothing over the top, so if you're looking for pure fap material this might not be it.

[u][h1]Music and sound[/h1][/u]
Excellently done VA which goes with the above mentioned great character design, making the characters memorable and distinctive. Music was also well done, and the OST might be worth a look if you're a music fan.

[u][h1]Story[/h1][/u]
[u]Basics[/u]
A story about first loves and the ups and downs of friendship and highschool life. 

[u]Characters[/u]
The focus of this VN, the characters all have their own stories and lives, which interact and weave together to form unique stories of their own. Multiple couples, each with their own charms and issues, and they're also friends with their own adventures and stories. It's all really well put together, full credit to the writers. 

[u]Plot[/u]
Highschool life, discovering yourself, and discovering love and friendship. We're not breaking new ground here, but it's one of the best done examples of the genre. 

[u][h1]Gameplay[/h1][/u]
Everyone gets their own plots and subplots, because there are both couples and friendships, and it's all interestingly done and paced with a calendar type interface. Some hidden scenes to unlock as well. 

[u]Replayability[/u]
There are some hidden scenes, as well as multiple plots and couples, all with side stories, so a lot to explore here. 

[u][h1]Summary[/h1][/u]
The stories here are about yuri relationships, but even if you're straight, there's nothing alien about trying to figure out your feelings for that person you first fell hard for. Kindred Spirits explores yuri relationships, but beyond that it also looks at adorable friendships and first loves, as well as the trials of a highschool life well lived. Definitely one of the best done VNs out there, and worth a look even if you're not big on the yuri.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046483845', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1587548592}
review:
This is possibly one of the best yuri visual novels I've read so far, and I'd love to see more from LiarSoft. There are numerous reason to recommend "Kindred spirits on the roof".
1) The characters: multi-dimensional characters. It is very difficult to elaborate on this without spoilers. Each character is shown is more than one kind of situation and they all reveal more than one side of themselves. They also display varying amounts of growth. As for character development, not everyone gets the same amount of it, but maybe one or two get somewhat neglected. Overall however, no major issues.
2) The visuals: baring the facial features, the characters don't fit into standard anime-style tropes. No spiky hair in weird colours, no aquarium-sized eyes, no exaggerated body proportions.Some CGs lack a bit of depth and appear a little flat, but are still quite pleasant to look at, particularly the colours, but the characters and backgrounds as well.
3) The sound: It gets a little repetitive over time, which given the length of the game can diminish the enjoyment some, but the tunes are overall pleasant, so it's not something to go to war over. Also, it makes Youka's song stand out all the more.
4) The most important, the writing: The situations in which the characters find themselves vary between relaxing, sweet, lively, hectic, dramatic and sometimes even a bit dangerous (by the standards of a slice-of-life visual novel). The focus does remain on the relationship building though, as it's the core element of this game. Each relationship gets sufficient spotlight and they all get their time to develop. None of them feels particularly rushed or dragged out. The multiple POV approach might not be everyone's cup of tea, but it's done pretty well. 

Closing note: If you like yuri, you'll love this visual novel. If not, this one might change your mind!
The verdict: 9.2/10 (One couple doesn't have a kiss CG, that's - 0.5 points)

author: {'steamid': '76561198114795906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1627520349}
review:
I think this game did a pretty decent job of tackling various perspectives on what it's like to be gay, from not giving a crap that you're different to "the world isn't always happy-go-lucky and we need to be really careful about ourselves," without acting like Lesbian Romance Is So Pure And Carefree or focusing on Being Gay Is So Awful Angsty Angst.

I think good attention and development were given to most of the couples, though I myself was biased to only two of them. I think the porn wasn't necessary. I appreciate the message of "lesbian love is normal love, that includes up to sexual relations," but I feel like an implication and a fade to black would have sufficed just fine. Not to mention they were pretty drawn out and I got bored fast, especially when there's like three sex scenes in a row. Anime girl squealing slaughters my ears too, so that wasn't very pleasant.

The amount of extra scenes is a little crazy. I have to admit I didn't finish them. It's just too much, and at that point it doesn't feel like I'm working towards anything. The main story, though, was very good. I liked the calendar system a lot, and I enjoyed seeing the relationships develop through all the hurdles and setbacks. Makes me wish I could have a girlfriend. It's definitely the best yuri VN I've played, and one of the best yuri stories I've read/seen in general, and I can only hope that in the future we can get more of this quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025196562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3705, 'last_played': 1670638599}
review:
The game is really cute and gay!! All the couples are adorable and the overarching story is really good. ^^

The music is good if not particularly memorable, the art style is adorable, and I love the way the game allows you to easily relive any scene from a menu instead of having to keep dozens of save files like in other visual novels.

Warning: There is a student/teacher romance, so avoid if that bothers you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084959621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3173, 'last_played': 1547166524}
review:
Excellent game, what can I say more?

Okay, if you insist: it's a yuri romance with supernatural elements featuring a colourful cast of distinct and surprisingly complicated characters who form six different and interesting pairings. The story is coherent and well-paced; romance bits are very cute without being sappy, comedy bits is very decent without being silly and ummm... erotic bits are tasteful and... yeah, I'm gonna stop right here. Personally I found the ending really touching (don't judge or judge -  I don't care).
Voice actors did great job, as expected. Artsyle is captivating. 

I really struggle to find any flaw here, other than that I want more, even though the game is decently long. I can wholeheartedly recommend Kindreds Spirits on the Roof to any fan of yuri/romance genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007804765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3479, 'last_played': 1576327420}
review:
A fantastic visual novel if you like yuri.  There are very few choices, but you do control when you watch the various parings stories and side stories.  It has numerous really nice pairings and very nice art and writing.

It is worth the asking price, which might seem high compared to most visual novels- but it is MUCH longer than most of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1561106015}
review:
[h1] 游戏介绍	[/h1]
《Kindred Spirits on the Roof（屋上的百合灵）》是一款由Liar-soft开发，MangaGamer发行的校园恋爱百合系AVG游戏。游戏的场景发生在商科九星女子学园，主角远见结奈在午休时刻在学校的屋顶遇到了一对百合幽灵，得知她们是原来这座学校的学生，并且带有着强烈的念想，于是游戏也将以此作为契机，为了帮助这对百合幽灵，便开始了学校的百合乐园计划。

[h1] 游戏手绘般的画风显得极为贴切	[/h1]
虽然这款游戏已经老早发布了，但是画风在现在看来很贴切，虽然不是那么的华丽丽，但是这种以手绘向大家展示的形式却是很契合的，将百合的主题突出的淋漓精致，而且给玩家一种温暖舒心的视觉体验，每一个角色的立绘的设计也是尤为漂亮，可以说没有我不爱的，可见游戏的在制作时的美工甚是不错。

[h1] 游戏的CV对白很是出色	[/h1]
这款游戏的CV也是很强大的，主要体现在妹子之间的对白上面，声线十分的优美，听着听着感觉就要怀孕了一般，感染力十足，也正是由于声优们的尽情演出，也让剧情的表现力大大的提高，而且让我们在妹子间的话语之中更能感受到百合无限好的这一特质，所以这部游戏听对白可以说是很不错的享受，温柔的感觉将会将你缓缓围绕。

[h1] 对游戏的剧情一些看法	[/h1]
自从游戏开始了百合幻想乡计划，游戏将以远见结奈旁观者形象，开始帮助各种情侣结对，一旦成功，我们就可以看到那对情侣的百合故事。游戏比较注重于将妹子之间的相知，相遇，相爱的着整个过程的心理描写，所以我们就可以更好的体验到人物之间的内心的变化和感受，并且更加真切的感受到过程的栩栩如生。游戏的主题是百合，但是在现实之中百合却是不被广泛认同的，进而CP组们如果要达到开花结果的程度，那么必然各路的CP组都会遇到他们的难题，难题我认为并不是一种绊脚石，而是一块历练石，CP组们也会因为这些石头而变得更加的成熟，以至于能够更好的加深彼此之间的感情，也刚好说明了困难能够让人在磨砺中变得更成熟的道理。然后就得说一下游戏视角的巧妙性，主角仅仅只是作为一名旁观者从旁边暗中帮助CP们结为情侣，当我们用女主成功的完成任务之后，我们也会感受到一种无上的荣誉感，然后以CP的视角进行故事好像就是给予玩家成功之后的一种奖励一样，这样类似于做任务给奖励的形式我感觉十分符合大多数游戏的经典操作，这样也会极大的鼓励玩家继续进行下去，来开启更多的剧情。

[h1] 游戏的优点	[/h1]
+手绘风十足的人物画面设计
+游戏CV的温柔般对白
+游戏主角视角的绝妙性
+CP组们的细腻的心理描写

[h1] 游戏总评	[/h1]
总体来说，这款游戏还是很不错的，如果你对百合系列不感冒的话，不妨快来尝试一番。
评分：8/10

[quote=汉化游戏]
游玩百态，将游玩心得用汉语化作玩家的指明灯，(๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧

author: {'steamid': '76561198074970246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1560930181}
review:
I've played, read, and watched a few yuri stories in the past (Highway Blossoms, Girl Friends, Citrus anime, and this game). It isn't my favorite genre, and this game doesn't exactly break that mold except for having supernatural elements involved, but I'd say it's the best one I've played. In terms of story, there's the main story and five subplots that all connect to the main. They're character driven, so if you don't like a certain character, you're probably not gonna love their story. Of the five subplots, I'd say one was great, two were good, and the other two were all right but kinda dragged down by one of the two partners involved. The main branch of Kindred Spirits is very good.

This visual novel is pretty kinetic. There's a few choices to make, but none of them affect the story outside a bit of dialogue here and there. The art is good, nothing amazing, but stylized as you'd expect for a yuri story (i.e., soft and rounded). All of the tracks in this are pretty catchy, and there's one song that only plays twice that is awesome (both for what it means in the story and the song itself). Parts of the game can seem repetitive since you go back to certain days to fill in the blanks by looking at the perspective of a different character.

Overall, if you're a fan of yuri, definitely get this game. It tells six stories all at once and does a great job at tying them together. If you can afford it, shell out the cash for the Full Chorus DLC as well. If you're not a fan of yuri but like romance stories, I'd say maybe buy this, but you'll probably only like the main story and a couple of the subplots. For those who don't like romance stories whatsoever, this visual novel is not for you. It's a wholesome story with a fun cast and good characters, definitely one of the best yuri games you'll get on Steam or anywhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130402546', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1560572646}
review:
A very nice, well written, refreshing Slice of life VN about romance between girls in high school.

What I loved the most is the charming characters, the different dynamics for each characters and how each had a different wat of dealing with their romantic feelings for one another. I especially loved the personal story and growth we see for Yuna (Or MC, respectively) as the story progresses.

The mechanics of this game is rather nice. It follows a journal system where we get a mark/sticker/icon for a date where something significant happens that follows the plot. The main story follows mainly Yuna's POV and sometimes her new ghost friends (Sachi and Megumi). Once we complete all "main story" plot points for a month we then get to see the POV of the other characters for that month afterwards, mostly from the respective couples focused on that month. It makes this game more engaging despite the story being linear. And while it does have choices those choices are only used to unlock more extra plot points after you complete the game. 

Do I recommend this game? Yes I do. Especially if you love slice of life, with some awkward high school romance and lovely characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306371063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1630239031}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof was most definitely an enjoyable experience. If you're just looking for a fun way to pass the time (like I was when I bought this), KSotR certainly won't disappoint. I was pleasantly surprised by the rich content and it was easy to get attached to the characters and their story. 

Although, there seem to be some issues with the control options. For the scenes in the first two months or so, the 'skip' option doesn't work. But other than that (and a few lags here and there), it was a relatively smooth playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007371702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1562700854}
review: This is my favorite Yuri visual novel so far. The length of the game is long compare to other visual novels I have played so far, took me about 23 hours to unlock all stories and the bonus stories. The story is rich and heart warming and it's very funny at the same time (I enjoy seeing the stories between Youka and Aki). Each couple's story was well written. The music and the voice acting are awesome. The translation was done very well, and the artworks are very beautiful. Highly recommend for anyone who enjoy reading or watching yuri manga/anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096988155', 'num_games_owned': 1329, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2972, 'last_played': 1556716292}
review:
This was one of the best visual novels I’ve ever read. Awesome characters, heart-warming story, cute art, good voice acting and good translation. Everything about this game is good.

If you are here only for some yuri action, I suggest you to look somewhere else because it’ll take some time to get to those scenes. But if you are here for some good yuri story, look no further.

Overall, this was an unforgettable VN for me. I’m really sad that I've finished the game but I’m pretty sure that I will be playing this again some time in the future.

Ano best girl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112176438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2072, 'last_played': 1555964403}
review:
i am a big yuri fan, but really new to the VN scene.  i was looking for something new to go trough, and found this. the plot follows a high school student named toomi yuna, who one day comes across two ghosts on top of the school roof top. the ghosts then ask her to help them build a "yuritopia" by helping out girls around the school by making their love come true. 

the premise itself is really interesting and the story has alot of interesting characters with interesting personalities. you also get the story from every character involved, and you see how they evolve over time.  the drama is not too much , its just enough to not be overbearing and cringy. while this is a "pure" yuri VN, there are some scenes that has mild nudity. 
the only gripes i have with the game is how it end. the end feels abit rushed, and i would have loved to see a continuation after the aftermath of the main story. other than that i highly recommend this to everyone who is a big yuri fan .

author: {'steamid': '76561198343922589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1557550779}
review:
YAAAASSS!!! A YURITOPIA THAT WILL GIVE YOU CUTE FUZZY FEELS!!! 

As my introduction into the VN realm, Kindred Spirits on the Roof's "calendar" format wasn't that hard to jump into. Or... at least I didn't think it was. The pacing could be seen as a little chopping, considering that you often jump back a few days when subplots are opened. If I hadn't played for a while, sometimes I had to backtrack and skim the last interaction the pairing had as a refresher.

The only thing I have negative to say about Kindred Spirits is that it would often freeze on me. Not sure why. My computer was way over the minimum specs needed to play. But the game would freeze on me after, maybe, 30 minutes of game-play. I was able to find a round-about way to play it by opening it through the in-Stream game Properties menu, instead of the desktop icon that I usually use to launch my games. Not that big of a deal, though, it did affect my "screen-time hours". I've played this game for about 30+ hours, instead of the 6+ that it's suggesting.

Otherwise, I think that this is a really cute, fluffy wlw game. I bought it on sale, so the 40+ hours or whatever I've spent on it (not counting the extra scenes that were opened when I finished the game because I haven't gotten to those yet), is totally worth it. Some of the couples weren't really my cup of tea/thought were dull, so I pretty much skimmed over the dialogue of their scenes. But overall, the story plot was decent, engaging enough. 

Wasn't a fan of a few of the pairings, and because of my Western upbringing, there were a few moments that felt kinda yicky to me due because of the fetishizing of some of the characters due to their physical traits. SPOILERS: [spoiler]Kiri's fetishization of Tsukuyo's small and "kawaii" stature was cringe-worthy to me, to say the least. Don't get me wrong, I love me some smol and tol pairings. But, it felt like one of the biggest reasons Kiri was into Tsukuyu was because Tsukuyu was short and petite. And I don't really want to get into the way that Yuna and Hina got together. It felt borderline incest-ey because they'd been portrayed like sisters for the first half of the VN. Yuna felt like a motherly big sister, and Hina treated her like such. Made me cringe when I got to those parts.[/spoiler]

Totes recommend this game. If anything, to support the Yuri game genre. We needs more lady-love in the saturated male-centric game world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032934679', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1571118693}
review: A yuri themed visual novel that's super wholesome and cute. Even the sex scenes are very tastefully done and don't feel forced. My favorite part of the story is the slow-eventual build up to each pair of girls hooking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045206214', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1680681224}
review:
I like when a visual novel has a long story to tell, and this one has many of them and that adds +1.

The fact that it has so many couples  was making me feel exhausted but I'm not gonna lie, I truly enjoyed all of the couples stories, it never ceased to amaze me how their relationship was developing. That adds +1.

I was also surprised by the fact it has voice acting but not through all the novel though. The thing that adds +1 to this point is that it has a DLC with more scenes and a full voice acting that I'm planning to get later.

I truly enjoyed the Kindred Spirits and some of their characters, as I said before having many couples was exhausting and some of them really tired me and I was just thinking "I need to finish it to advance with the main story, what a pain" but more couples extends the story and the outcomes where kind of unexpected to me that left me in awe.

I would say I give 9/10 since I needed to have a Hina perspective from all this. 

3 out of 5 points so I'll definetely play it the Full Chorus Version to unlock them all. 

Thanks for this amazing journey. "See you later" *cries in gay*

author: {'steamid': '76561198337307776', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1707223805}

顺便鬼委员长和忠犬乐手真的好嗑，人设比运动组还涩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198309777392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1467087640}
review:
***HEAVY SPOILERS AHEAD***


As a gay dude who likes anime, I often stray into yuri territory because yaoi is - almost always - absolutely repugnant garbage. This time, so is the yuri.
There is a really fantastic, gay, VN in here somewhere, with interesting, cute, and fleshed out characters. However, the couple whose entire dynamic seems to be relentless sexual assault and sexual-pressuring is exactly the reason why this sub-genre is viewed so negatively. What's more, the game seems to want to frame this routine assault as "well both girls are wrong in their  own ways!" when in reality one girl is being sexually assaulted bordering on partner-rape on one occasion, and the game seems totally fine with portraying this dynamic as a quirk of the characters. Excise this one couple, and the game is wonderful, but as it stands it represents a disturbing and mishandled take on sexuality between gay women.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264978259', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1518356961}
review:
(Side note : I played it outside of Steam, since about an hour after I start the game, it lags. But I finished it in 40 hours.)

[b]Sweet and pure[/b] - even the H-scenes. That's how good this VN is.
Yes, it's yuri, and [i]yes[/i], it has some (mild) adult content, but do not stop yourself from buying/playing it because of it ! As generic as it may sound - cute anime girls in an all-girls school holding hands while being surrounded by lilies, the story itself is very amusing and interesting. There's love, fun, drama, and introspection (yes) involved. All of that, in a cute and "soft" setting - you'll understand what I mean by "soft".
Be it the music (very cute, in the japanese sense), the artwork (lots of CGs !), the voice acting (very convincing !), everything is there to make you feel good. And that's how you should approach this game. Don't worry, be happy. That's basically it.

Oh, and the planner is a nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298266618', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1547922580}
review:
If what you're looking for is extra-fluffy yuri visual novel goodness with a side of drama, then is this the VN for you. Kindred Spirits on the Roof, also known as Okujou no Yurirei-san, is an excellently written, as well as translated, visual novel with great character development and a satisfying payoff in the ending, that I would personally highly recommend.

  First off, the story is pretty good. The base premise is fairly interesting and creates a whole slew of pretty hilarious and also lots of really sweet moments when reading, what with the protagonist, Toomi Yuna, being the 'yuri cupid' of the story. The drama that occurs between the characters is definitely one of the strong points of the VN, and the occasional friction between the cast members makes you really feel for them. Conflicts between the characters and their resolutions are all very reasonable, and god they are seriously well-written.

  The characters, their development, and their writing are for sure the best aspect of KSotR, at least in my opinion. Every single main couple has their own unique little chemistry going on, and the dialogue is super fun to read, not to mention fluffy. This being a fairly long visual novel, taking me over 40 hours to finish the main story and all the extra scenes, allows the characters to develop at a natural pace, and it's really nice to see the interactions between specific characters changing over time. As a high schooler myself, some these characters are also reaaaally relatable. Especially Futano Sasa.

  As for the art and sound, the artstyle for the VN fits perfectly, and the CGs look awesome. The illustrations in this VN are really good at expressing the characters' personalities, the character designs are great(ly cute), and the background art's nice as well, the BGs do a great job at setting the scene. Speaking of which, the music in Kindred Spirits also does a great job at setting the mood of the scene. The soundtrack only includes 15 different tracks, but that's not really a bad thing. They really grow on you, and they're one of the reasons why the slice of life type scenes in this game are so relaxing. The music is cute and fitting as well.

  TL;DR, the writing for the story and characters are really good. You get ultra-fluffy yuri romance and intense yuri drama, a lot of the dialogue is absolutely hilarious too, and really, every character has a ton of depth to them. The art is great and so is the music, and really, if you're a VN person or like yuri, I'd definitely recommend this game. Thanks for reading this review, by the way. Have great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147463474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1586812754}
review: Kindred Spirits on the Roof is, without a doubt, the greatest visual novel of all time. Even stories like Umineko and Steins;Gate pale in comparison to this masterpiece. I personally believe that this story belongs in the upper echelons of literature with works such as The Great Gatsby. The only problem with this game is that the music isn't the greatest, but I find that muting the music and listening to whatever you desire as you play is a great fix. All in all, I give this game an 11/10. Which feels too low of a rating (naturally, as mere numbers could never convey the sheer magnificence of this work), but I couldn't come up with any references to the game to use as the rating instead so that'll have to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214415600', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1648, 'last_played': 1543397808}
review:
What can I say about this game that will truly capture just how amazing it is? Long have I been wanting a detailed, imaginative yuri visual novel with multiple hours of playtime and a realistic take on romance between women. This is exactly that. As a queer girl, I find that games centered around lesbians and yuri often only focus on the sexual aspects, never accurately representing the emotional, loving parts of the relationship. While this game certainly delivers on some risqué scenes, it really takes your breath away with the cute and heartwarming encounters between characters; particularly of those between love interests.

First off, the soundtrack is really nice to listen to. I wouldn't call it mindblowingly amazing or anything, but the few songs that you do hear are really nice and fit the casual, relaxed tone of the game. There are a few sound effects too, which fit in well with the environment, although I thought some of them like the cicadas could be a bit too loud and distracting. The voice actors are amazing! I must commend all of these lovely ladies for putting their hearts and souls into their performances - no matter the situation, they seemed to nail their lines, and all of their voices were very unique and recognizable from each other. And don't even get me started on the artwork, absolutely stunning. It's not top of the line stuff to be sure, but I LOVE the simplicity of each CG and character sprite, while still being adorable and drawn with so much care. I'd fall in love with any of these girls, honestly lol.

There weren't too many bad things about this game. I would say that it is actually worth its normal price, as I got nearly 30 hours of playtime out of the game fully completed, and there is also extra content at the end (although I am the type of person to listen to every single voice line and read at a moderate pace, so take that as you will). Some scenes did seem a bit dragged on more than they needed to be, and [spoiler]it kind of annoyed me that these HIGH SCHOOL AGE girls seemed to know NOTHING about sex, and that the erotic scenes had them moaning like crazy over a freaking boob squeeze[/spoiler], but overall my complaints are few and far between. The characters were lovable, and their personalities were so different and brought out the best in each other. Their humor and quirks had me smirking and laughing many times throughout the game. One or two scenes even got me a bit teary-eyed. The worst thing about Kindred Spirits on the Roof was that it had to end, but I will keep the memories of it with me for a long time to come.
[spoiler]P.S. SasaUmi and AkiYouka 4ever! (HinaYuna too)[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198817597644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 683, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1568546767}
review:
To begin my review, I have to say that the 'story' is very good. It shows a faithful text adventure plot as the structure of 'main story - side story - epilogue'. Because of this, the playtime is quite long. If you do not skip the voiced sections it will take about 30 ~ 40 hours until the ending, and then it will take about 50 hours until you finish. However, it is a little disappointing that only major events support voices. Nonetheless, their voices are good enough. This game offers a satisfying amount of story with voices and music to match. Everything is in harmony.

The game 'music' is great. It's good music that makes the game atmosphere feel pleasant. But the songs are few unfortunately compared to other text adventure games. The number of songs you have available in the gallery is fifteen excluding the hidden tracks. So even though it's not a lot of music, I'm sure you'll still be satisfied with the OST.

Game 'convenience' was better than I thought. In particular, the gallery has a fairly intuitive interface because it is right next to the story scene. However, it may be a little awkward that the save & load does not appear on the Planer screen. In other words, it is difficult for the player to identify the diverging point until the story has proceeded. And there are some pause problems in the game but it won't bother you too much. Because the story of this game is quite good, I think players can overcome it enough to reach the end of the game. The translation isn't bad at all but if you do understand Japanese, you will probably enjoy the game more.

The conclusion is that 'Kindred Spirits on the Roof' is a very suitable game for entering the genre of text adventures. I highly recommend it. It would be even better if we could continue to see these kinds of games in the future. 

[Steam] Nayanco Curator ヽ(=^･ω･^=)丿
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33855818/

author: {'steamid': '76561198339545040', 'num_games_owned': 8422, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 2833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2833, 'last_played': 1540624327}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof - романическая визуальная новелла про однополую девчачью любовь - это первое, что Вам нужно знать о ней, и если после прочтения этой фразы уже стало не интересно, то и читать дальше нет смысла.

Игра является кинетической новеллой, где в итоге все линии сводятся в одну концовку. Сюжет игры разворачивается в очень классической атмосфере для многих аниме и визуальных новелл - старшей школе японского образца. В игре 16 героев, каждый из них обладает собственной уникальной личностью, следить за взаимодействием персонажей на протяжении игры всей игры - одно удовольствие, конечно же, если Вам, опять же, по вкусу жанр юри. Повествование интересно, но не не блещет мегаострыми поворотами, просто спокойная романтическая сюжетка между разными персонажами. Лично у меня на прохождение заняло около 46 часов в сумме, правда я не парился особо выходя из игры чтобы сбегать в туалет и все такое.

Рисовка на самом деле на любителя, напоминает больше какие-то аниме мультфильмы в стиле 90-х годов прошло века. Бывает намного красивее, все же мне нравятся более красочные новеллы с яркой рисовкой, огромными глазами, няшными неко-ушками или что-то вроде того, хотя это дело субъективное, но не суть - персонажи здесь проработаны и прорисованы неплохо, голоса озвучены, актеры сыграли хорошо, отлично передавая эмоции и атмосферу в нужный момент. 

Романтической составляющей и постельных сцен здесь тоже хватает, но тоже все банально на уровне - первый секс, ахи-вздохи, "что же мы творим", "я не хочу, но не могу остановиться", и все такое ;)

В заключение скажу, что новеллу я бы охарактеризовал как крепкий середнячок, с одной стороны здесь есть все - увлекательный сюжет, приятная рисовка, качественная озвучка, но как будто чего-то не хватает, до шедевра все же далеко. Да и ничего нового в жанр игра не привносит - старая добрая школьная ВН о романтике и любви. Это не плохо и не хорошо, это средне.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273406100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1537556439}
review:
Les points forts:
- des personnages super attachants et bien développés
- lesdits personnages ont des rapports les uns avec les autres, et pas seulement avec les membres de leur propre route
- des sprites & CGs magnifiques
- une histoire bien ficelée et mignonne
- une durée de vie hors-pair (25h pour moi, et je lis vite!)
- un système de jeu un peu différent qui fait qu'on peut voir les routes dans l'ordre qu'on veut, non chronologiquement
- un personnage principal qui a une vrai personalité

Les points faibles:
- La musique peut être très agaçante et/ou innappropriée pour certaines scènes
- jeu kinétique (les choix n'ont pas d'importance. C'est pas vraiment un point faible mais ça peut en déplaire à certains.)
- 2/3 routes commencent par un coup de foudre et certains (moi) peuvent ne pas aimer
- no spoiler mais Sachi a beaucoup de tension pour une révélation au final qui... euh... éxiste? Qui casse pas trois pattes à un canard.

Honnêtement c'est un super bon jeu si vous parlez anglais, je le reccomende fortement!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073326174', 'num_games_owned': 1785, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'last_played': 1547877650}
review:
1ª análise de VN então vamos lah...
Ganhei essa VN do [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006413390]woosk[/url] na época que a Steam meteu o loko querendo censurar anigames e VNs e devo mt a ele por tê-la antes do que eu esperava por isso logo fui ler ao menos a história principal como uma forma de retribuição,como sempre qd menos percebi jah nem vi mais o tempo passar assim como sempre foi ao ler VNs e senti mt falta disso teh pq ñ consigo mais ter o tempo que eu tinha antes x.x
[strike]Único problema dessa VN eh a resolução que nem dah pra mudar(e qd em fullscreen sobrepõe a tela de modo que nem Ctrl+Alt+Del adianta para mudar de janela) e a incompatibilidade da engine da VN com o Steam Achievements que ñ permitiu a VN ter nem conquistas(tanto que o Steam Overlay tb ñ funfa aqui),e qt a mim único problema que deu foi na ED que ñ rodou o video sendo que ele abre corretamente na pasta da VN e.e[/strike](atualizando aqui,a VN ganhou uma build nv que resolveu ao menos teh aonde vi o problema da fullscreen e dos videos de OP e ED porém os saves da build antiga ñ funfam nessa nv build e ñ irei voltar pra antiga msm inda ñ tendo a expansão Full Chorus,resumindo eu realmente terei que reler td assim que eu tiver ela)
Para análises de VNs irei colocar tópicos diferentes do que coloco nas análises de games ._.

[h1]Sinopse[/h1]
Td começa com Toomi Yuna que vivia isolada no terraço de um colégio feminino chamado Shouka Kokonotsuboshi Joshi Gakuen(aka Shirojo) e era assim teh que 2 espíritos intitulados como Yurireis(ou Kindred Spirits como ficou na adaptação da Mangagamer) vieram insistemente propor a ela ser cupido oculto de casais de garotas e assim formar a chamada Yuritopia,e a partir disso td começa a mudar drasticamente na vida dela ^^

[h1]Conjunto[/h1]
CGs lindas msm com a resolução travada nos 800x600,músicas lindas que grudam como chiclete na cabeça,história que ensina mt do universo yuri além de ser bem construída e sem pontas soltas,chars bem carismáticas e nenhuma desperta ranço algum que seja,orange scenes que apelam mais pro romance do que pro sexual e atuação de voz que infelizmente ñ tah presente em tdas situações da VN(algo que soh foi corrigido na expansão [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/995610/Kindred_Spirits_on_the_Roof_Full_Chorus]Full Chorus[/url],fazendo assim eu e mts que jah leram do jeito que está reler td de nv) TT_TT

[h1]Leitura[/h1]
Tem nd mt interativo visto que as decisões tomadas por Yuna-san afetam em nd o decorrer da VN porém nem dah pra afirmar que eh uma kinect novel,eu diria que tah mais pra uma VN pure love por ñ ter bad endings nem nd do tipo ._.
As cenas e momentos da VN são separadas em dias de abril teh novembro e podem ser lidas a qqer momento conforme o andamento da VN,e conforme vai-se lendo a VN o title screen acaba por ter leves alterações,eu pessoalmente curto td essa atenção inclusive em detalhes tão pequenos como esse ^^
E ñ tem como colocar cores diferentes para txts jah lidos assim como ocorreu com SHUFFLE!,Da Capo e outras VNs que a MG jah lançou ._.

[h1]Extras[/h1]
Após a história principal são desbloqueadas as Extra Scenes(tem tb as que são desbloqueadas selecionando tal decisão em certos dias) que complementam a história principal e 4 Drama CDs que por incrível que pareça a MG lançou td sem faltar nd(teh hj ela tah devendo mt coisa de SHUFFLE! e Da Capo) e com vídeos legendados em inglês para ter ao menos uma noção do que se eh falado neles jah que a maioria inclusive os americanos ñ sabem JP,esses Drama CDs se passam após a VN então pra quem curtiu bastante recomendo adquirir eles tb(inda preciso ouví-los então análise deles irei fazer assim que eu conseguir) ^^

Resumindo essa foi uma das melhores VNs yuri que jah li,e irei reler td com gosto assim que a expansão Full Chorus for lançada(atualizando,jah foi lançada então agora soh preciso tê-la) ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198009447946', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1531629608}
review:
A truly heartwarming yuri romance VN. All of the characters are reallly well developed (Nena is the best, though), and I found myself getting very wrapped up in their stories as the game progressed. The  main story does a really nice job at developing them, and taking some of the characters in surprising directions. Yuna makes for a great protagonist, and I found that her story really resonated with me in some big ways. The art is also a major plus; I really felt like all of the CGs had their own personality to them.

And completing all of the extra scenes after the credits roll is essential in my mind. Not only do they flesh out the characrters even more and give some great scenes with characters who didn't really interact much in the main game, but the final scenes unlocked serve as a really great epilogue that ties everything together. It's only been a few hours since I finished the game and I already feel like I miss the cast so much. You won't regret the time you spend on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998887445', 'num_games_owned': 1095, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 4089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1654621808}
review:
I bought this on a whim during the Steam Summer Sale, thinking it might be something to while away a couple of hours when i was bored.
Instead, I bashed through it in a day, unable to stop playing for any amount of time. Heck, I nearly gave it a standing f***ing ovation when the credits rolled.
An unexpectedly good VN with interesting, realistic characters who feel like real people, both in looks (human rather than photoshopped supermodels) and personality (you won't find anyone here who sits in a trope), and a story which, whilst not intense, is certainly sufficient to make you want to keep going.
The soundtrack, whilst (very) limited (~10 songs are used for the actual novel content), but there are two hidden gems among the music tracks (A A AI is way too catchy).
I think the only issue I have is a moral one with the whole encouragement of teacher-student romance, which isn't something I can particularly support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105115612', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1647031675}
review:
I've been wanting to buy Kindred Spirits since it was announced because it was about girls loving girls. The art was beautiful, the song was catchy, and I loved the trailer. I expected it to be good, of course, but I never expected it to be as good as it actually is.

Kindred Spirits on the Roof follows Yuna, an extremely considerate girl who, due to some circumstances, started avoiding people. This changes completely, however, after she starts seeing two ghosts - or, as they prefer being called, kindred spirits - on the rooftop of her school. Since she's the only one capable of seeing them, they quickly ask for her help to pass on: They want her to help the girls in her school who love others girls to be able to confess their love and start a relationship! - A yuritopia. So, Yuna embarks on this not so easy task. 

This game is so good it's actually pretty hard to point out all good things in it. I mean, I can't just say "everything", can I? But, yes, it's pretty much that. There are plenty of characters and romance for you to see developing, and ALL the characters are completely unique. Their personalities and hobbies are different, and you feel like they are all real people. Something that really caught my attention was also that, besides seeing Yuna version of things, you also get the opportunity to see these other girls sides on things. This make such a big difference - and also make you fall in love with absolutely all of them. 

Kindred Spirits has only a few choices - which don't matter, they only unlock some secret scenes. What does it mean, then? That it is basically a kinectic visual novel. Now, this is something that might've put me off if I knew it before playing the game, but man, they do a kinectic visual novel WELL. Since the story is super interesting, you get caught in it fast, and the calendar let's you follow different girls in different days, in the order you want, which makes it feels like you're actually making choices and actively playing. I basically pay no mind that this is a kinectic visual novel. I don't even REALIZE it is. This is how great this game is. 

The romance is also the forte in the game. We have many couples and each of them have different chemistry, way to deal with things and all that. It feels very real to see their love blossoming. Of course, I have some couples that I love way more than others - how could I not? - but, in general, I pretty much love all of them. The game makes a good job on making some mysterious stuff for you to slowly find out during the storyline, which makes you crave for more and makes it hard to close the game. 

Simply put, Kindred Spirits is a really, really good game. Romance and light novel fans will love it, and everyone who likes a good story will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121044692', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1531202876}
review:
Definitely one of my favorite yuri VNs. Would recommend if you're into that stuff, much better than other yuri VNs like A Kiss For The Petals series that I've read. I really liked the character design and the variety of couple types explored. The plot is pretty silly but it fits in with the personality of the characters and the overall tone. I will say that some plot threads felt tedious and unnecessary but the overall flow of the story was fine and perfectly enjoyable. The trepidations of the main character, Yuna, get a little annoying after a while but I understand why she would have the struggles that she does with her sexuality, it just gets a little repetitive. 

I have mixed feelings about the functionality of the 'planner' set up, which isn't something I've seen in other VNs. I like that you can easily rewatch scenes or jump around to specific characters that you're interested in but it is a bit annoying to be pulled back to the planner after each and every scene, kind of makes the overall experience feel kind of disjointed. I do like the concept but I think the execution could've been a bit smoother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093884718', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1532851752}
review: Going up there as one of my favourite visual novels, period. Even if you don't like slice-of-life stories I highly recommend purchasing (on MangaGamer) because it's just really freaking fun. Gayness isn't a gimmick like a lot of yuri games, and actually confronts awkward feelings and struggles with realizing that you're a girl who likes girls. Every character is very unique in their approach to this realization, and I genuinely loved each one. Though it may seem pricey, the game has a LOT of content and is 25+ hours long. Definitely worth every dollar!:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124624922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1916, 'last_played': 1594549025}
review: I'm not the type to really play Visual Novels. But this was the sweetest Yuri Story Line I have ever encountered in a long time. I love every character in this game and felt very connected with them. The conflict they go through is well done, letting you see each characters persepective on the matter. Although it's not much of a game since you can't really affect the story itself. So if you are okay with that then give this a go, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305894787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1530211585}
review:
[h1]ENREDO[/h1]

[b]Kindred Spirits on the Roof[/b] é uma [i]Visual Novel[/i] de enredo simples, mas que cumpre tudo que propõe e mais um pouco. A narrativa é conduzida de forma agradável, os textos não são pesados e a leitura flui bem. No começo parece uma historinha clichê, mas por meio da convivência da protagonista com personagens tão divergentes, é possível perceber que os temas presentes são tratados de forma madura e crível, dentro dos limites e personalidades de cada personagem envolvido. Não há "furos" relevantes e é possível dizer que há uma estabilidade elogiável e longe de ser monótona. Não apenas temos o ponto de vista da protagonista: durante cenas à parte, estamos lendo sob o olhar dos casais de meninas que estão sendo ajudados a encontrar seus sentimentos e verdades da vida. E se chegou aqui procurando cenas de sexo fetichizadas, sinto informar que deverá continuar procurando. O jogo trata a sexualidade de forma romântica e atrativa para quem queira apreciar uma leitura mais poética do ato. Por fim, pontuo positivamente essa abordagem mais lírica dos temas em combinação com a leveza da narrativa presente, tendo em vista a ambientação proposta. 

[h1]AMBIENTAÇÃO: VISUAL, DUBLAGEM E TRILHA SONORA[/h1]

O traço é simples, mas agradável aos olhos. Planos de fundo bem trabalhados nas [i]CGs[/i], sem contrastar com a qualidade das personagens expostas nas cenas. O visual individual de cada uma das meninas do jogo é único e parece "casar" bem com as personalidades apresentadas. As expressões emocionais de cada uma são um charme à parte. As vozes em si são agradáveis. Não entendo uma palavra de japonês, mas me parece que as dubladoras tiveram êxito na missão de passar emoção em seus respectivos papéis, levando em conta as cenas e as entonações empregadas. Embora a trilha sonora seja meio repetitiva, não desgosto. Muito pelo contrário: o jogo tem músicas excelentes, vale a pena adquirir a trilha sonora para escutar separadamente caso tenha oportunidade.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]

A história é linear, ou seja, as escolhas tem pouco ou nenhum impacto para o final. É uma experiência menos interativa do que o que se espera para uma [i]Visual Novel[/i] com cerca de 40 horas de duração. Não creio que seja um problema tão grande para o público consumidor de [i]Novels[/i] no geral, tendo em vista que uma leitura agradável é o mínimo que se espera de um jogo do gênero e, nesse ponto, como já comentado sobre o enredo, o jogo não deixa a desejar. Contextualizando um pouco, o jogo se passa respeitando um calendário pré-definido. As cenas serão lidas por "dia". Um ponto interessante acerca disso é que se pode escolher a ordem em que as cenas de casal serão lidas assim que se passa pela rota principal daquele mês. No geral, é uma experiência diferente do que estaríamos acostumados, mas longe de ser ruim.

[h1]CONSIDERAÇÕES FINAIS[/h1]

[b]Kindred Spirits on the Roof[/b] é uma leitura que vale muito a pena. É possível notar o cuidado e capricho com que o jogo foi produzido. O visual é bom e a trilha sonora e a dublagem completam um ambiente delicado e encantador. Pontuo positivamente a abordagem da temática [i]yuri[/i]: é uma história focada nos sentimentos das personagens acima das relações físicas. Recomendo a todos os entusiastas de histórias do gênero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217610137', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1563963385}
review:
就算现在还没刷完剧情，就算已经被剧透一脸。但我还是要大喊：我永远喜欢百合灵！！！！QAQ
这是第一部让我大喊又拍桌又鼓掌的游戏了！
——————分割线————————
刚才写了一大堆的评论突然没了！QAQ只好重新再来一遍了。
总之，随着剧情的结束，从早上甚至可以说从几年前开始困扰我的问题也渐渐有了答案。我们此生大概需要在内心坚定着，坚定地相信着自己喜欢的心情，即使有过迷茫与挫折，甚至还有些许勇气不足。但如果能够好好传达自己的想法，一定会得到回应的吧。故事中的她们都得到了自己所渴望的结局，都拥有了那个可以称之为依靠称之为信念的可爱的恋人。这就是这个世界上最棒的事情了！所以，一直像yuna一样封闭的自己也该拿出些决心与勇气还有恒心去面对那个心中最独一无二最闪闪发光最棒的喜欢的人了啊。看着游戏中的她们的喜悦，和她曾经经历的一切也都在心头萦绕。果然还是最喜欢她了，如果这份心情能传达过去就好了。

所以，这款游戏最棒的地方，大概就是会伴随着她们同喜同忧，却在陪伴的同时寻找到了自己的勇气和对美好、对喜欢的人、对恋人最美好的憧憬和想要将这份心情好好传达出去的心情吧。
真的很高兴认识她们，很荣幸见证她们的故事。

author: {'steamid': '76561198396821481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1529818795}
review:
1. 界面做得很糟糕。没有skip键，没有历史台词。你甚至不需要存档，从日历表里就可以进入每一天的不同剧情里，况且存档的界面做得实在是太失败了根本看不出来进行到哪一句台词了。
2. 剧情显得有些无力。许多对cp的进展实在是太快以至于我逐渐握不住方向盘。很多女孩子莫名的就喜欢上了另一个女孩子，喜欢上的过程交代的实在是太敷衍，看得我一头雾水。
3. 音乐、声优的表现都十分不错。美中不足的是许多部分是没有声优的，只有在重点处（咳咳）才会有。

尽管缺点不少但是我还是想推荐一把骗子社的这部百合作。女孩子之间的恋爱实在是太美好了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198034816478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1524988519}
review:
This is a kinetic novel, not a visual novel. There's no choices to be made, and it plays out more like an audio book or a voice-acted manga than a game.
That said, while I'm not usually a huge fan of kinetic novels, I absolutely love this one. While there are a few bits of it that I find questionable (such as the ethics of a teacher dating one of her students), the concept is cute and silly, wholesome, and high quality. It's a little bit pricy but it's quite long, and quite worth the money.
If you're snuggling on the couch with your girlfriend (presumably most of the people who bought this game are girls who like girls), it's fun to toss on a scene, watch it, and squeeze each other with glee as you watch the protagonist deny to herself how much she's loving uniting all these adorable lesbian couples. The only drawback is that the voice acting is all in Japanese, so if you don't understand it, you won't be able to follow what's going on while you're smooching, which is too bad because it's so romantic and sweet.
If all kinetic novels made my gay little heart glow with this much delight, along with my aching cheeks from smiling and my throat dry from all the squealing and "awww!" moments, I'd probably play them more.

rainbow unicorns in flannel smooching on the couch/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1527016185}
review:
This game had many ups and downs mainly because not everyone is going to like repeating scenes which you see coming just from different perspective. If you commit to this game you are done for good. You will need to get through all couples and days involving them, and few choices… frankly I doubt they affect game to much.

That’s all what I see annoying in that game though. It is very good romance and an classic of yuri subgenre. Well done, showing up all the shapes of love. Each couple had different style, problems also taste for the love. This game was an incredible fun to discover at start with a little dull moments in middle and a real satisfying ending. If you like mild stories you will be at home. It kind of got me into relaxing mood, with a few moments worth waiting for on game calendar.

Voice actors did really good job. I don’t mind that only few special scenes were voiced it was enough for me to like every character of that game, which is pretty rare for me. Ahhh but Koba Youka!!! She is taking first place as an comedy king. I am jealous such a waifu rock’in material (no offense to Yuna with her apron). Megumi and Sachi had best voicing I feel. They really pulled up their sleeves doing "certain” scenes. What else I think that’s all I still wanna write something to recommend you trying it but all I can say just go for it feel the rocky soundtrack and just go for it.

"Loving someone, that feeling It's yours and yours alone"

review:
If you like yuri at all, you owe it to yourself to enjoy this gem of a VN.
At the end you won't want to let them all go, as they're each a distinct personality over the course of the game, and damn it if you don't get a bit attached.

I haven't listened to the audio CD's yet, as the game also has extra scenes you can unlock after you finish the story, to see characters interacting with each other outside of the MC's view.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060060647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3492, 'last_played': 1547689797}
review:
[h1]For Yuritopia!![/h1]

Pros:
[list]
[*] This is a great story about an uber-mature girl, Yuna, helping two "kindred spirits" (girl ghosts in love with each other) to play yuri cupid at their school.  This story has a few minor choices included which do not affect the final outcome at all, but the overall story is told both from multiple points of view (various characters) and also non-linearly, jumping around from date to date as new content is progressively unlocked.  The game uses a calendar system so it's not confusing at all where you're at in the story.
[*] All the characters are unique and well-developed.
[*] Lots of content, easily 50+ hours.
[*] Good soundtrack that somehow doesn't get tiring to listen to even after 50+ hours.
[*] Lots of [i]Awwww![/i] moments.
[*] Oh and some adult moments too, though the game is PG-rated until [spoiler]the in-game month of August[/spoiler].
[*] Lots of Japanese culture references.  By the end of this story you should know your -san from your -chan and your senpai from your sensei.
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Measly 800x600 resolution.  What year is this, 1995?  The artwork was still well-done though.
[*] Seriously, does everyone in Japan have a stuttering problem?  You'd think so from this VN.  Everyone seems to be easily surprised, unnerved, caught off-guard, or startled too.
[*] Ok not really a con per se, but I really didn't like Miyu & Matsuri [spoiler]for their clearly inappropriate treatment of Hina[/spoiler].  I guess not all the characters can be likable.
[*] Parts of this VN (maybe a quarter?) are voice-acted, but the majority of it is not.  While the parts selected to be voice-acted seemed like the parts that [i]should[/i] be if you're not going to do the whole thing, it would've been better if they had either done the whole thing, or nothing.  (Rumor has it there will be complete voice-acting in the future, so this point may go away.)
[/list]

Overall, this was a really fun VN, and the cons listed above were minor annoyances at best.  I picked up this title on sale but I would say it's still worth it even at full price.  Pick up this VN and treat yourself to some happy yuri feelz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321561496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1672674180}
review:
今天才发现
【白衣X大忙人X百合会】的全语音版汉化补丁做完了！
直接在微博上搜白衣汉化姬就能找到了，
微博里发布的文章里也有下载链接和教程。
十分感谢所有的汉化人员！

虽然离第一次玩过去了挺长一段时间了，
但百合灵一直都是我最喜欢的百合游戏，
我个人感觉是非常值得花时间去细细品味的。
剧情量很大，糖份也很足。
对于角色的刻画很丰满，心理描写也很细腻
每一对角色都是不一样的感觉。
不过像部分差评（中英都有）所说的，剧情基本上都是日常片段。
所以对日常不感冒的玩家会觉得无聊。
确实，没有超展开，剧情也基本上能预料到。
还有一点就是画风，看到过一条英文评论说立绘像六岁小孩儿画的www
一千个人眼中就有一千个哈姆雷特嘛，
个人感觉画风还是很顺眼的，配上日常剧情就显得游戏整体都很清新。
不过现在汉化也有了，还是有希望更多的人能够感受到百合灵的乐趣与魅力。

author: {'steamid': '76561198422933000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1521866258}
review:
Tl;dr
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a yuri visual novel. It is the best visual novel that I’ve ever read. If you’re into yuri or just looking for a good romantic visual novel, I highly recommend this game.

Full Review 
(Note: Spoilers and some of these points are my opinions)

Story- The story revolves around the game’s protagonist finding out about and meeting two female ghosts or kindred spirits in a relationship on the roof of Kokonotsuboshi Girls' Academy, an all girls school. The Kindred Spirits, seeing that they have finally been heard and acknowledged, ask the protagonist to help them become one in body because they don’t know how to do “it.” But, neither does the main protagonist know how to do it. So, to learn how to do it, the three of them attempt to get girls who have hidden feelings for other girls in their school together to make a “yuritopia” and observe them do it. This is the main gist of the story and this makes for a really interesting and creative plot in my opinion. I also love the pacing of the story, although a bit slow and repetitive at times. The story is really memorable and heartwarming, and I doubt that I will forget this story.

Characters- In my opinion, each of the characters are unique and it was really fun and enjoyable to see the changes in their person and in their relationship with other people.

Gameplay/Controls- It’s a visual novel so it’s just your standard press a button to advance the story. However, I really appreciate the ease of the controls and the variety of controls as well. It’s really easy to use the scroll wheel (down to progress, and up to replay text) and there are so many customizable options for a visual novel. You have an option to the change how transparent the text box is, remove the text box, skip to a certain point, replay voice acting for a certain line, and more. I also appreciate the use of a planner or calendar to advance to the next part of the story. Because of this planner, it is easy to review artworks or cg that you have already seen for a particular month. It also allows you to replay to certain points in the story with ease. You can also access the music and play different tracks in the planner.

Graphics and Art Style- The game has an unchangeable standard 800x600 resolution but personally, this issue doesn’t really bother me. The game still has beautiful art direction and the art is what attracted me to buy this game in the first place.

Music- There are a only a few songs that are played in the game but I don’t really mind that since the music in the game is very catchy and most of them are upbeat. I’d find myself playing the songs in my head or even saying or singing them. There are also other songs that fit the mood of the scenes in the game very well. Like I said earlier, you have the options to all of the the music played in the game in the planner.

Voice Acting- This game has good voice actors. Each of them suit their characters really well and I didn’t dislike any voice for each of the characters. Not all parts of the game are voice acted but I think there's no problem there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045885540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1456604373}

review:
To be clear, I've finished this VN. But apperantly, according to steam I haven't played this game yet. In any case, here is my review (I did finish it in 5 - 10+ hours):

1st review on steam. Holly crap it's woth the money. Even though I'm kinda conservative (the VN is focused on lesbian relations), I must admit this VN got a lot to offer considering young love. I have kinda tried to challange my wievs on the world recently (homosexuality etc), and all thsese VNs really are a good stepping stone. Let me say this: The ending was fantastic. So far, this is 1 out of 3 games in my life that actually made me shed a tear or two (the others being "Lost Odyssey" and "To the Moon").

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1500346261}
review:
This is another game I bought a physical copy of, and received a free Steam key. Though it appears there is little difference between the Steam version and the "full" version. Any... scenes are rather tasteful and not that explicit (which apparently means no views below the belt). I'm not sure I understand well, either.

Anyway, the story is nice and well-written. It is about a bunch of yuri relationships, which are brought to the protagonist's attention by a pair of "kindred spirits". They need to watch these couples so they can have a perfect first time... and move on to the next world.

There are a lot of pitfalls along the way, and after each section of the main storyline, the stories of the couples also get some attention. Finally, after the end of the main storyline (which includes the protagonist discovering her own love), there are a bunch of extra stories involving one of the characters (or more) that are unlocked based on the few choices you have made in the storyline (and perhaps it is best to go back and make sure you cover ALL the choices).

The visual novel is well-done, and I can recommend it. Just remember that there is some romantic material... and some graphics with... the upper half exposed...

author: {'steamid': '76561198309212180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2199, 'last_played': 1571712786}
review:
A decently cute yuri visual novel. It's a nice read with light fare. There's not much conflict or excessive drama in this, which isn't a problem at all. Honestly, I can't stand melodramas that just squeeze in conflict for the sake of drama. So, Kindred Spirits was like a breath of fresh air, in a sense. There really isn't much for gameplay. The pacing can be a bit slow in some parts, but I think it felt a little needed for the development of the 7 couples. The soundtrack was limited and weak but served its purpose in the best way it could. 

Overall, I think this was a unique experience. If you are into lighthearted, cozy, and cute love stories with a little dash of drama, then this might be the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990720627', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1519772922}
review:
I got this game as part of an Indiegala bundle, for grins and giggles.  

If you like lez stories and your idea of a game is just hitting the space bar to move through a story, then this is the game for you!

Otherwise, it's a waste of money.  I read faster than most and the space bar was slowing me down.  There's no decisions to make, it's just occasional changes of still shot art and reams of dialog to space through.  This is not a game, but a graphic novel in which the developers saved money they could've spent on art.  They change scenes about every 50-70 lines of dialogue.  This didn't provide enough change of scenery for me, and I was sort of hoping this was an actual game, where decisions I made mattered, or some such.

Anyway...in my opinion, too costly for something I can get better, and free, off the internet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014987559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3211, 'last_played': 1519275983}
review:
One of the best depictions of female romantic relationships I've seen in otome/VN's especially Japanese ones. Good fluff and drama to boot without getting weird like yuri stuff often does! In fact, it was nice, vanilla fluff and I loved that! The characters aren't all tropes, there's some overlapping and complexity in them, and the artwork is suuuuper cute! Linear, though, no alternate endings. Partially voice acted, and EXTRA PLUS POINTS FOR ALL THE ALTO-VOICED WOMEN OH MY GOOOOOOD

Honestly, I loved this. It's deceptively longer than I thought (though I did leave the game idle and come back to it often). There IS some NSFW art and voice acting, it's not super scandalous, but partial nudity and obviously sexual situations for sure and it's on screen as you read through, so it's not just momentary.  

The couples are cute, and quite normal (no outrageous drama) and I think that's why I loved it. A lot of yuri themed media from Japan is full of discomfort and boundary crossing and crazy dramatic plotlines that just make me mad. I was craving some regular fluff. I loved that a lot of the characters were flawed in pretty human ways and they didn't always change or improve, they just were themselves.

This fed my gay heart <3
