author: {'steamid': '76561198087786566', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1657832514}
review:
Una de las mejores novelas visuales que lei. Excelente de principio a fin. Personajes muy bien pensados cuyas personalidades, trasfondos y dilemas, sumadas a la impecable forma de narrar, logran dibujar constantemente una sonrisa en el espectador, quien se va a llevar mas que una bonita historia a la hora de completar el juego.
Muy completo y satisfactorio, la obra no hace mas que aportar lo que el espectador espera e incluso mas. totalmente justificado el precio.
Todo amante del yuri no puede dejar pasar esta historia. y no.... para alivio de muchos (yo incluido) no hay personajes masculinos

author: {'steamid': '76561198312203632', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1579843554}
review:
第一次玩百合游戏玩得这么难受......我竟然变成了邪教徒，还是主角CP的邪教徒......每看一句对话心里都扎着痛，违心感满溢......而我又是那些一决定喜欢什么就很难改变的人...........实在是难受得玩不下去关了游戏.......至少现在进度里每对情侣都已互相传达并接受了对方的爱意，停在这里也是可以被原谅的吧......

不过，还是会祝妳们幸福的，衷心地......

author: {'steamid': '76561198398812594', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1660191537}
review:
百合灵这个作品无疑对我来说是玩过的最好的百合游戏，虽然制作上不是特别的精良，cg也不是很多，音乐有些重复，但是至少人物每个都很讨人喜欢，很可爱，而且剧情也算比较丰富了，讲述了女生之间纯洁的友情和爱情。
       剧情上避免剧透，提醒一下要入手的人，选项不影响主线剧情，建议选项都存档，这个游戏全cg的话，是要通过所有的剧情的，而选项影响的是除主线之外剧情的出现，所以要全cg通关的人，需要在选项存档，多试试。
       然后就是最重要的!!!因为剧情会不会 突然雷，或者很毒，猝不及防而犹豫的人大可放心，里面角色全为女性，全是糖，放心的享受就好了。
       百合就是信仰

author: {'steamid': '76561198045284160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1526066393}
review:
One of the greatest and most wholesome VN or any piece of media I've ever seen

1,000,000/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014473091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3757, 'last_played': 1575941449}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a fun read. 

The story is about playing yuri cupid to girls around an all girls school. There no males to be seen or heard from whatsoever. Characters in the game even use the word "yuritopia". This game knows exactly what it is about. All of the couples are unique and cute together in their own way, with a total of sixteen characters divided into seven couples and two supporting characters. While the plot does have conflicts, everything ends well with a nice bow over it and is a bit more slice of life than drama. Overall a fun read if you’re a fan of yuri or just silly, cute romance stories in general.

Something else I feel I should mention. This game has gained a bit of attention for being the first Steam game with “sex” scenes. However, you should NOT use that as a reason to buy and play this game. The “sex” scenes aren’t really what one would normally consider a sex scene, they are not very in depth and are there for the purpose of being romantic, NOT sexual. Some of them don’t really go beyond heavy making out. If you think you’re getting an “adult” game, you will be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068385110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3690, 'last_played': 1554664568}

Yuritopia!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049433342', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1553360418}
review:
I don't usually play VN's, but this one caught my eye. I wasn't expecting much when I bought it, but what I got out of it was a good 30 hours of surprisingly complex character development, adorableness, and quite a few "squee soo cute" moments. It's a bit pricy, but considering how much I got out of it, I'd say it's totally worth it. 

There were a few s❤x  scenes, but nothing that didn't feel deserved and natural in the flow of the character's relationships. They definitely weren't the focus of the game, more of just a culmination of hours of watching the character's develop their relationships. If you're looking for something s❤xy, then you'll be disappointed, but if you come into this looking for an adorable and surprisingly complex (despite the tropes) VN about various girls falling in love you'll be pleasantly surprised.

(I cut out most of the negatives from below as the recent port to RenPy and the new DLC resolved pretty much everything.)

The soundtrack could have used more variety.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198193116258', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1514820887}
review:
【轻松可爱没有负担的多线校园百合故事】←一句话总结

没有胃药，全是甜甜的糖，充满温暖的气氛，大家都有好的结局，都互相了解并且互相适合，是非常理想化的女高中生恋爱故事了。像二位百合灵被困在校园这块地方一样，也让身心被困在这个狭小却充实的的幻想里吧。[spoiler] 小月代那里说出那句“不能觉得自己很奇怪哦，慢慢地成长为大人然后慢慢地察觉到吧”的时候我看着屏幕哭了出来，我也说不清楚是为什么。虽然我看到这句话很感动，不过按照剧情来说这句话只是一句官话而已，最后两个人都认为这份感情不是错觉，那就不是错觉了。但是我觉得错觉才是现实。在困惑之中成长，等想明白怎么回事事情早就已经过去了，然后新的事情就会带来新的疑惑，这样的话永远都是一个不行的人吧。但是剧情里的大家都很快地抛弃杂念向喜欢的人传达了想法，只能觉得真不错啊真不错啊。[/spoiler]

遗憾的是配音不全，只有一些重要的情节里有配音，并且文本只有英文的；并且看别的盆友测评说阿野线是被删的，这显得比较诚意不足。（我也想要阿野线！还想要音七线啊啊啊啊啊！！！）bgm也有些单一。值得赞赏的是日历模式，读完每个月的主线以后可以随意点开这个月任意的情侣故事，读完情侣故事以后再进行下个月的主线，这让玩家可以有个清楚一点的条理。游戏内也有选项提供，不过都很次要，看来对剧情没有影响，只是增加一点点参与感吧。
感谢百合会的汉化，在蒸汽动力上找到了帖子下载的。不过打了汉化之后就不是从steam这里打开了，所以我显示的游戏时间是我另外挂的……
其实因为百合游戏相对来说很少，能找到看到有人推荐的看起来还行的就直接买来玩了。其实我买之前没有仔细了解，也不清楚原来这是什么开车里程碑啥的，所以出现h情节的时候我有一种仿佛吃完火锅又被人塞了很多甜点的感觉，就感觉还不错。不管是感情的描写还是h的描写都挺到位的（虽然娇喘配音还要按照字幕分开来放觉得迷之尬啊！），确实是女学生会产生的想法，并且还有一些让我觉得“啊原来是这样，也会这样想啊”的惊喜。[spoiler] 我也想知道女孩子之间是怎么h的[/spoiler]甚至还学到了什么[spoiler]原来不把手指伸进去也是可以的[/spoiler]，原来是这样，非常感谢了[strike] 但是有个屁用啊[/strike]

剧情中有很多对的情侣的故事，并且不错地塑造出了各自的萌点。主线通关以后还有许多额外的小故事，增加了非cp角色之间的互动和补充主线，在人物塑造上还是下了一点功夫的。角色的会产生情感的来由都能简洁有力地交代清楚。大家都能得到好的结局的原因大概是她们都有着一种，坦率地面对感情并且能够从容地表达出来的素质，令人赞叹。[spoiler]一名现实死宅的赞赏[/spoiler]想具体讲述对各个cp的感受未免会有大量剧透，并且对只是想看看这游戏好不好玩要不要买的盆友没有太大意义[spoiler] 实际上是懒得写吧！[/spoiler]如果是玩过的盆友欢迎扩个列和我叨一叨啊w 总之对喜欢百合故事的盆友来说还算是一个不容错过的游戏。


还有我认为[strike] 这个故事告诉我们只有纸片人老婆的死宅以后死了都不能升天的[/strike]

买了广播剧还没有仔细听，希望能补充一点阿野抛瓦给我……

author: {'steamid': '76561198059589835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2135, 'last_played': 1524402012}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999398741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1514647991}
review:
If you like yuri it won't let you down.

That said it has a lot of drawbacks:

- It is repetitive ad-nauseam. Aside from recapping recent events constantly you get to experience some scenes twice from another perspective that doesn't really add anything. I just clicked through them without any regrets.
- The story is bland for every single couple.
- The music starts to get annoying after the 1st hour. You're in for at least 20 hours so don't mind turning it off.
- Only 800*600 resolution.
- Art is lacking but that is pretty common when dealing with this genre. I swear there is less drawing than in your typical manga chapter.

Not that I didn't enjoy it but I expected much more after all the hyping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071521680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1515345098}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060727321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2392, 'last_played': 1652733891}
review: Ésta visual novel es sin lugar a dudas una maravilla. Es totalmente increíble cómo superó mis expectativas una y otra vez, aún cuando creía que había llegado a su tope. Pero más increíbe todavía es que hayan conseguido que las parejas "base" o "estereotipadas" del yuri hayan sido totalemente reinventadas. Creo que el mayor logro del juego ha sido eso, ser originales en un contexto estereotipado, clásico de este tipo de historias (obviamente no todo son estereotipos, tiene bastantes puntos de originalidad como tal). Y otra cosa increíble es que no ves venir lo que te dice el sentido común en este tipo de historias. Respecto al apartado gráfico y sonoro, no hay absolútamente nada de que quejarse. El contenido extra es impecable... No estoy siendo objetivo, pero es que con esta visual novel me es imposible, me atrevo hasta de calificarla como perfecta. Recomiendo este juego tanto para los que les gusta el yuri, como para los que no le llama la atención desde un principio. Considero que los autores de ésta han hecho algo totalmente increíble. Para el poco yuri decente que se puede encontrar en esta plataforma... me atrevería a decir que es el mejor de todos. Por lo que vi, sin ningún tipo de censura. Vale más de lo que cuesta. Y, como dije, ¡totalmente recomendable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031180999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1510876218}
review:
Man I wish I could forget all about this game and play it again. That's a really nice SoL-Yuri VN that is about 35 or 40 hours long but you may have to play outside Steam to get a bug-free session, it also explain my short play time.

Basically, you follow the school life of a cool yet cute MC cursed by some lesbian ghosts which is "forced" to help other lesbians (or not) to make out.

The game is kinda weak on the soundtracks and is not fully voiced (for now, apparently a full-voiced update is comming soon), but god the art is really *really* nice and the story, is very well written and not full of drama and clichés you may found tipically on shojo or shojo-ai mangas. 

All in all, Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a bit long comfy yuri VN that I'm sure you'll like if you're into the yuri genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970296271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1548868036}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a fairly long (30+ hours) and high quality shoujo-ai visual novel. It's all about the romance and connecting with that other special person instead of focusing on more "titillating" aspects of new relationships.

Art style is akin to a clean and pleasant manga here. Everyone has distinct looks as well, which is a plus in a sea of almost identical moe characters of today.

Soundtrack is competent, but its easily the least remarkable thing here. It works as a background for all the romantic mayhem constantly going on here.

Character cast is large, but for once almost everyone gets a decent slice of the story instead of being reduced to comedic window dressing the whole time.

Novel is also voiced very competently and you should have fun listening to the main characters going off with all sorts of puns and "yuri conspiracy plots" as they try to lead as many potential lovers together as they can. There's also 4 after story stories in voiced form available in Steam should you like to know how the characters fare after their school year.

Recommended for anyone who wants a little bit different romance and comedy story. It has a dash of supernatural, melancholy and drama just to spice up things, but I'd say general disposition of this novel is very sunny and hopeful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009986252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 4216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1667017382}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a game that will leave you with a good feeling in your heart.

Don't worry about the price tag either because there is a ton of content to this game. It took me 32 hours to finish (SPOILER:)  [spoiler]completely and get the "Full Clear" message, and even if you don't go for 100% completion the main story is still the large majority of those hours[/spoiler].

While I could leverage some criticism at the game, its flaws are few and easily excused and it's easy to see the game had a high level of effort, talent, and enthusiasm put into it. These folks really cared about what they were making and it shows. The writing is excellent, the voicework is top notch, the music is catchy, background and character art and UI design are all well done, and really the whole experience is a cut above most of this game's contemporaries.

Kindred Spirits has quickly become my favorite yuri visual novel game, and is really a contender for the most well put together visual novel that I have ever played to be honest. It's right up there with the best of them.

I think the most important thing that this game does "right" that so many others fail to understand the importance of is (SPOILER:)  [spoiler]everyone gets a happy ending. This is so important and so needed because, while more and more VNs these days feature same sex romantic couples, which is fantastic to see, it's still very uncommon for a game to have some/all lesbian content and have it all end up with happy endings. So commonly do you see ones with really messed up scenes or just depressing results to their romances and it makes it hard to even enjoy playing games like that. Not so with Kindred Spirits, and that's so very important. We need more games like this one that leave you feeling good. We need more movies and TV shows with happy endings for same sex couples too for that matter[/spoiler].

There was one part in the game that actually did bother me personally. It was maybe 6 or 8 hours in to the game so not very far, and the way that the events played out seemed to run contrary to the tone and precedent of the game up until that point. Words were said by one of the characters to another that I felt were not healthy or "okay" at all, and actually rather cruel. Specifically I am speaking of (SPOILER:) [spoiler]the start of Kiri and Tsukuyo-sensei's relationship when Kiri confesses and Tsukuyo-sensei dismissed Kiri's feelings, telling her they were just a "misunderstanding" and a phase that younger girls often go through[/spoiler]. Thankfully though, as the game progressed, this issue that I had with it was actually addressed as part of the story, much to my pleasant surprise, and handled well enough overall that I felt okay about it after that turning point. I was impressed that the staff and writers went so far as to examine a scenario like that, and just knowing that they took that on only added to my respect for the game that Kindred Spirits became.

Another thing worth noting is that this game does feature some adult content scenes without even requiring a separate uncensor patch file to be downloaded. I think that's good progress on Valve's part for finally allowing this kind of content on Steam directly without having to have workarounds like we've seen up till now.

If you're concerned about the adult content, I was really surprised and pleased to see it was very tastefully handled and innocent. A lot of 18+ content games don't really know how to show loving relationships or innocence very well, and I believe it takes a skilled writer to be able to pull off tenderness in a lovemaking scene. Kindred Spirits succeeds wonderfully at this. If you were worried about the content being too graphic or vulgar, you've got nothing to fear here. The relationships take time to build before the intimacy happens, (SPOILER:) [spoiler]and the game's story takes place over the course of 8 months[/spoiler], so if you're going into this game expecting things to move quickly you'll be disappointed. I don't mean that in a bad way though. The character development and pacing is great, and by the time the scenes of intimacy come about, you really feel like you know the characters and the intricacies of their relationships well.

I know that no matter how good it is, Kindred Spirits on the Roof will be considered a "niche" title, because for some reason a lot of us humans are still not comfortable with the idea of women loving women even when represented as an artform, and on top of that, many people aren't even comfortable enough with their own bodies or sexuality to be okay with seeing sexual content in the games that they play.

If you ask me, it's unfortunate really that as a culture we're more okay with depictions of shocking violence, pain, and distress, than we are with sexuality and feeling good, but I digress. Chances are good most folks who fall into these categories aren't sitting here reading this review in the first place.

If you are the kind of person who is open minded enough to not let the fact that this game contains some scenes of an intimate and loving sexual nature between two women bother you, and you enjoy visual novel games, Kindred Spirits on the Roof is one VN you will really be able to appreciate, and its heartwarming story and characters will stay with you for a good while, and leave you feeling glad that you took the chance on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057573412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1653369155}
review:
I have played every scene from this game and I must say:

[i] This is my favorite visual novel. [/i]

But to make this brief, I'll give you my pros and cons:

Pros:

[*] Art. Oh my god the art is beautiful. Cute and sweet and fits this story so well.

[*] Many different stories. If there is a couple you are 100% for, I can guarentee that another one will be just your cup of tea.

[*] Great writing. The stories are sweet and so full of love. Nothing feels that forced, and all of the relationships are very genuine.

[*] Sound design. The SFX and music fit the mood and are so pleasing. The music doesn't get annoying.

[*] Voice acting. The whole thing isn't voiced, just certain scenes. That way the scenes voice acted are so much more poignant that way.

[*] A REAL STORY. The attention to detail in this VN is just so amazing.

Cons:

[*] Not many choices. If you like choice heavy games, this might not be for you. The choices you do make unlock extra scenes from the girl's POV's later.

[*] Cultural differences. Some Western cultures have different customs and beliefs which could result in a bit of confusion. Ex. There is a romance between a student and a teacher. The female age of consent in Japan is 16, so both of them are within the age of consent. It makes 100% sense if that makes you uncomfortable, but you need to understand that before playing.


All around, this game is stellar and I will replay it many times!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198345759962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5833, 'last_played': 1512036058}
review:
Simplemente me encanto este juego, es mas profundo de lo que párese. Es un juego yuri con varias parejas. La protagonista le es encomendada la misión por dos fantasmas, de ayudar a algunas chicas para que puedan emparejarse. 

Lo que me encanto de este juego es como se daban las relaciones, al principio comienza lento y se muestra un poco sobre la vida de las chicas y sus personalidades. Las relaciones se dan de manera natural, y poco a poco ves como avanzan, lo que hace disfrutar aun mas cuando suceden eventos importantes al punto de no querer despegarte del juego.  Te encariñas bastante con los personajes y también vez como se forman lasos de amistad entre ellas y como se apoyan entre amigas.  

Otro punto a favor es la forma en la que esta organizado el juego, es un calendario donde eliges el dia para jugar, con eso tienes presente de mejor manera las fechas y sabes cuando parar o continuar el juego, lo cual me parece bastante importante en una VN ya que puedes perder el hilo de la historia.  Calve recalcar que las elecciones libres  de los días, son las de las chicas a las que ayudas. 

Puntos en contra diria que le falta mas sountracks, las pocas canciones que tienen me gustan su opening y ending y la cancion sorpresa de la rockera son geniales. Pero aparte de esas son solo 12 sountracks que suenan mientras lees, nunca me molesto esto ya que disfrutaba de la historia y las canciones eran adecuadas pero si me hubiera gustado que hubiera tenido mas. 

Una vez de pasas el juego, te premian dando escenas extras de las personjes a través de todo el año y una vez terminas eso, sabes que aun hay mas con lo de los CD dramas, que claramente tendré que comprar. 

El juego me divirtió y me entretuvo bastante, también me hizo pensar cuando ocurrían problemas a través de la historia, por ejemplo la forma eficiente de hacer las cosas yuna y como ayudaba a los demás sin esperar nada a cambio o como los buenos consejos pueden solucionar muchos problemas. 

Calificación 10/10 completamente recomendada.  Es el mejor juego yuri que he jugado!!!

review: i would love to see this turned into an anime. this was hilarious, and some parts hit home, those feelings tho right? and the soft core was just a bonus. ;D the songs got really repetitive after awhile to the point where i eventually turned off most of the music. yosuga no sora got an anime so this should as well, i hope because the message here is alot better and alot more clear than that one. i know right 137 hrs is alot but i liked going through each storyline and sidestory stuff and yeah of course the choices didn't matter much either but hey i liked each individual outcome. author: {'steamid': '76561198176743546', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3734, 'last_played': 1509309343}
review:
[h1]Okujou no Yurireisan~[/h1]
Kindred Spirit on the Roof is a Yuri VN Game that tells a story about achieving a romance relationship between girls from various perspective. It started when the protagonist, Yuna, discover the "kindred spirits" on the roof despite her lack of spiritual sense and then help them creating a yuritopia in her school by act as a yuri cupid for the other couples. This game also the first uncensored game on steam.

Pros :
+ Really good story
+ Heartwarming and cute
+ 7 couples to ships
+ Great character development and relationship
+ Great soundtrack and art
+ Some major events are fully voiced
+ Uncensored Beewbs (I swear I didn't play for this one)

Cons :
- Not really compatible with steam (No steam overlay, no achievement, can't screenshot, etc.)
- After 10-15 minutes of playing, the text become kinda lag, it doesn't disturb the game itself though, and after sometime It didn't bother me anymore (This issue can be solved by launching the exe directly from the game folder, but I want to save the playing hours)
- Fixed 800x600 resolution, but despite that, it didn't look weird when strectched to 16:9 resolution

Overall it's a really good game and I really enjoyed every second of it. Really recommended for yuri lover out there. I already cleared 100% of the game and now I'm starting to miss playing this game... 

Yuri is the purest form of love~

author: {'steamid': '76561198254523590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1589984585}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof benefits from a rather uncommon (in VNs at least) narrative structure, which positions the protagonist as a facilitator of other couples' relationships rather than one striving for her own. This allows players to get into the character's head as she tries to understand the intricacies and nuances of lesbian romance.

While the VN definitely delivers on feel-good high school yuri, it also reveals the difficulties it poses, especially in a conservative, collectivist society where presenting oneself as normal is paramount. It doesn't do so heavy-handedly, however, allowing the more intimate nature of the different stories to shine throug.

All in all, the different romances are quite engaging, and though some initially left me underwhelmed, I was rooting for all of them by the time the game drew to a close. With the vulnerabilities of first love compounded by what is frowned-upon, if not quite forbidden love, the story comes with emotional weight that can be surprising given its lighthearted mood.

All of this is supported by excellent sprites and a great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060849086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1507434810}
review:
Antes de mais nada: Kindred Spirits é uma kinect novel, o que significa que, ainda mais do que em uma visual novel "normal", durante esse jogo você não vai fazer nada além de clicar para avançar o texto. Não existem "escolhas", nem verdadeiras nem falsas, que te permitam alterar os acontecimentos ou resultados, ou dar mais nuances à sua personagem. Quando o jogo te apresenta decisões, é apenas para que você escolha a próxima "cena" que vai ler - e, mesmo assim, você não tem muito poder de decidir sequer a ordem. Em outras palavras, isso é tão um jogo quanto um Kindle é um console; e tudo bem. Se você gosta desse tipo de material, os reviews positivos provavelmente serão mais úteis. 

Meu problema maior com Kindred Spirits é a falta de sinalização de que esta é uma kinect novel, tanto na sinopse quanto nos trailers, o que pode levar a alguém falsamente acreditar que trata-se de uma visual novel com um pouco mais de sensação de agência. Não tenho certeza se esse é um problema da steam ou de má fé dos desenvolvedores, mas em todo o caso este acabou sendo o primeiro "jogo" que fiz questão de devolver e pedir reembolso. Eu AMO bons games narrativos, visual novels, "walking simulators", text-based games, o problema não é excesso de texto ou falta de mecânicas tradicionais de videogames. O problema é que NÃO EXISTE mecânica, não existe sequer a sensação de agência. Então, a menos que você ame MUITO este tipo de conteúdo, eu recomendaria assistir a gameplays completos no YouTube (você não perde absolutamente nada nesse caso, já que o negócio é feito só pra sentar e ler mesmo) e economizar 60 reais. Melhor ainda, use esse dinheiro pra comprar uma visual novel queer que de fato te dê alguma coisa para fazer, como Black Closet, Ladykiller in a Bind ou Dream Daddy - que não só são mais interessantes mecanicamente e em termos narrativos, como são mais baratas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275001832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6691, 'last_played': 1498607736}
review:
First and foremost; I genuinely enjoyed all aspects of this game. The art is nice and consistent throughout, the music is pleasant and I actually really like some of the songs, the story is nonsense at times but such is the nature of fiction so I think that the story actually culminates very well, and I really like some of the characters and the development of these characters throughout the story. It's a cute, yuri romance that I honestly feel could make a great anime. It has drama CDs and a spin-off manga, so why not?

Full disclosure; I am a fan of anime and I am a guy. A guilty pleasure of mine is Nekopara and I have Steins Gate for the Vita. I am a fan of visual novels because I watch a lot of anime that derives from them and I enjoy video games with a healthy amount of good narrative or visual novel-esque mechanics.

I heard about this game because I saw an article online about it being an "uncensored" visual novel on Steam. So I looked up some promotional images for the game and liked the art style. I'm no expert on visual novels, but I've seen images from visual novels where the art isn't consistent. This game has a very consistent manga-like art style that looks good against the game's backgrounds as well.

I went into the game thinking this would be another guilty pleasure like Nekopara but found that I was actually enjoying it for multiple reasons without the need of "ecchi" distractions. Right from the beginning the game grabs me with its openning song. I'm a sucker for some anime songs and there are a few songs with vocals in this game that I really enjoy. The lyrics are nice too and the vocalized songs are sung by one of the character's voice actors, which I think is nice. It's all a bit romantic in a shoujo-esque way, though I guess the game is yuri.

A major reason I was enjoying the game before the ecchi parts, and all-around regardless of anything ecchi; I really like the main protagonist. The protag's name is Toomi Yuna. She has a bit of a tomboy-ish, kuudere-ish vibe in that she is very self dependent and solemn with a "cool" or "cold" look to her character, which is why I found it adorable when she gets caught off guard occasionally and gets spooked or embarrassed, which shows that she is a complex character capable of feeling/showing natural emotions other than those typical of her apparant character. A fault that I hear about in many visual novels, or anime inspired by visual novels, or just anime in general is that the protagonist is unrelateable because they're a blank slate for you to imagine yourself in their shoes, or that the protag is just a terrible one-dimensional character whose involvement in the story boils down to plot for "PLOT"; as in they have all sorts of plot armor, plot hole inducing nonsense to make them important, and for some reason everyone then likes them or rivals them for some reason or another, so they are justified in all the "ecchi" stuff they get coming their way. But no. Kindred Spirits is way different from that nonsense. Toomi Yuna is a good protagonist. She has her own character which is developed and interesting and is part of a story within the game which is sort of seperate yet ties into her involvement with the other characters. What I mean by separate is that she isn't the focus of the game's ecchi story lines. Her own development stems more from her overcoming her own personal problems to become a stronger character that others rely on. Basically in a bad harem anime the protag gets unexplained plot power so that everyone is drawn to them. But in Yuna's case she isn't a harem protagonist, she's just trying to help other girls fall in love. This is difficult for Yuna because of her personal problems making her a bit of an introvert. But at her core she is a good person so she wants to help people when she knows she can. So she gets out of her comfort zone to help people. This makes her analyze herself and others and she comes to terms with why she was introverted in the first place so that she overcomes her problems. Basically she becomes a better character worthy of being relied on, capable of helping others, and therefore a justified protagonist.

So the focus of the plot is that Yuna helps girls who are lesbian find love. These girls have their own personalities told through their own narrative which explains how they feel about things, mainly their love interests. All the couples have their own quirks to them and whether or not you like the couples probably depends on the type of characters you like to see in a romance. People love shipping but tend to hate couples that don't meet their personal preferences. So obviously there were couples that I liked more than others for various reasons; some were cuter, some were more fun, some made more sense. But I liked the way the characters' narratives explained who they were and how they felt as characters. Regardless of what makes sense in the real world, I feel like all the couples are justified, more or less, by the characters' backstories, inner feelings, and interactions.

So this is an adult game in that it depicts relationships in a sexual way and shows implicit sex scenes that are more explained through narrative and vocals than the art itself. They do show boobs, but by todays anime standards it's fairly innocent. Even though it shows sex, it's not oversexualized. Some, if not most, anime today tends to be oversexualized even when it's not adult. Anime also tends to portray risque relationships. This game only really has one risque relationship. The entire game is "safe" in a vanilla sense. That's probably one of the reasons it wasn't censored by Steam. But I enjoy the art in general. I also just enjoy the development of the characters in the story. The sex scenes were "nice" but they were more like icing on the cake of the couples, sort of like a justification to the "ships" or a culmination of the romances naturally leading to intamacy.

So obviously I didn't explain the story too well as to avoid major spoilers. I just want to add that the voice acting helps define the characters along with the art and the narrative. Not everything is voiced, but you can sort of imagine how a character might say something in their voice as you're reading. The game also presents you with "choices" but they're very superficial and don't affect more than a sentence in the next line of dialogue. There is only one route that you simply read through, but visual novels offer more than manga and books because they have art, music, vocals, etc. The ghosts or "kindred spirits" are sort of a reason for the plot and a source for everything nonsensical that keeps reminding you this game is leading towards an ecchi finish line, but I still think that the writing in the lesbian relationships is done fairly well and keeps the relationships realistic or even relateable in most cases. I'm a guy, but I like romance too, so I don't even consider this a guilty pleasure; it's just a good romance story to me. So in all honesty you probably wont like all the characters but I'd say you should play it for the ones you will. Again, regardless of all the yuri romances that the other characters present you with, my favorite character is the protagonist Toomi Yuna. I'd play a non-ecchi game starring her, or watch a spin-off anime about her cooking (because she  likes to cook). If you're not sure whether you'll like the characters, just go to the game's official website, it has the rough bios on the characters. But if you're an anime fan who likes a bit of ecchi, likes a bit of romance, and likes "ships", this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009129621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1508792792}
review:
Okujou no yurirei-san - or Kindred Spirits on the Roof, as the English-language version is called - is a heart-warming romance novel in video game form, with an exclusive focus on girl-with-girl relationships.

As an long-standing fan of this genre, the characters and the story have quickly grown on to me. I would even go so far as to call this game a shining example of exactly how yuri should be. This also applies to the game's erotic content, which is very tame by most standards. It's not surprising that Valve accepted the game in its current form, despite it being rated '18+' by the publishers.

The price tag may seem a bit high, and I have to admit that I was initially put off by it, but it was absolutely worth it. The voice over was kept from the Japanese version, and the English translation is great.

9/10, with a small deduction for keeping the original game engine. A port to Ren'Py with macOS and Linux support would have been the icing on the cake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009272545', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2937, 'last_played': 1523911617}
review:
Better and bigger than expected, the characters are all likeable and the art and music are great. If you like yuri this game is definitely a must play.

There is also a lot of extra content after you finish the game that expands upon the main story, and if you want more after that there are Drama CDs too that take place a couple of years after the main game and are a lot of fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151570803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1512187855}
review:
Let me just say this. I enjoyed this game, I mean it's your standard issue high school romance story just WAITING to be adapted into a 12 episode anime, but I would recommend it.

The sex scenes don't happen until basically the end (sorry if that's the only reason you bought it.) , and they all happen basically in the same in game week off one another. On top of that, they're all pretty underwhelming, like Mass Effect or Saints Row IV kinda underwhelming. Sorry to disappoint. 

But the real thing I loved is the story to it. Without spoiling it, I fell in love with some of the pairings and almost stopped caring about the main campaign all together and cared almost exclusively for the side stories going on. I especially loved Youka and Aki. 

But aside from that, an overall pretty good game that doesn't completely become your standard issue yuri anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211775285', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1564766688}
review:
我斟酌了一阵子，到底该给推荐还是不推荐呢？还是给个推荐吧。
本格的galgame我也没玩过几部，也不好多做比较。
单从剧情上来说感觉还是挺喜欢的，虽然目前还没通关，但一直都还玩得舒心，基本全程发糖。
但是，
就像不少人说的：立绘变化太少，以及绝大部分对话没有语音
以及音乐偏少，循环得生硬
真的让这部作品大为失色。
当时刚玩到小牧的支线时，发现竟然没有语音，我点了退款，还好G胖动作没那么快，才留住了这游戏。
鸽了一段时间，决定还是继续玩下去。
抛开这些缺点，这部作品还能接受，目前还能继续玩下去。
大家请考虑清楚后再购入。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047454451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1548637669}
review:
28 hours later, and although I have not gone through all of the bonus content the game has to offer... wow.. this VN caught me off guard as to how "real" it is about things.
one would expect an anime visual novel about lesbian ghosts shipping girls at a highschool wouldnt be as serious but a lot of it was how different relationships can be depending on the person, and the kinds of thoughts/feelings that are going through a persons head when it is happening. however, the twist being that there is a gentle push and assistance from two (nearly) omnipresent ghosts, so nearly anything could happen.
I got so attatched to all of the couples in this game and cheered them on the whole way through, and their individual stories nearly outshined the main character's.
The voice acting is excellent, the art is top notch, and the music, while it loops, never seems to get old and fits every situation it is put in pretty well.
I laughed at the shenanigans, I cried at the touching and sad moments of the game, and I almost completely forgot about the fact that this is an 18+ romance novel.
although the game is 18+, its not really focused on the sex. all of the sex scenes are so adorable and touching that you forget it technically qualifies as hentai, and just enjoy the fact that two girls have fallen in love and are showing their affection to eachother.
my point above is one of the many reasons why I say its very "real". the stress leading up to the confession, the worries about who is going to find out/maybe get mad, dealing with relationship issues/roadblocks, and most importantly, the trust and bond between two people is all covered in the game and written in extremely well.
Im giving this VN a 9.9 out of 10, the -.1 being that there isnt a way to forget about the whole story so id be able to read it again with genuine reactions from myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193436781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1701448319}
review:
Of all the games I've played through Steam, this by far, has been one of the best purchases I have made. More content than I could have imagined just to start with. There are many storylines of all kinds of yuri couples that you get to observe in a fashion I quite enjoyed. Even better yet- (possibly spoilerish?) [spoiler] when all is said and done, the game doesn't end at the credits. Finish the ride out and one last 'day' and you'll unlock *more*! [/spoiler]

Hardpressed to find many decent Yuris with realistic stories (and bodies at that) that are all cute. Give it a whirl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046700622', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7443, 'last_played': 1570123101}
review:
This review will be separated into three parts: TECHNICAL, WRITING, and OVERALL.

[h1]TECHNICAL[/h1]
On a surface level, this visual novel is surprisingly well-constructed. The artwork is crisp and well-drawn (artist is peg and you can find more of their work [url=https://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?id=5020]here![/url]), the score is pleasing to the ears and never feels worn out or tiring, and the sound direction is very solid. The dialogue text display is easy on the eyes by default (you can change the opacity of the dialogue text box). I would've chosen a slightly better font, but that's minor and entirely preferential. The voice actors chosen for this game (side note: not all the dialogue is voiced) are very skilled as is apparent by their work here. Not a single character felt like the VA behind them was mismatched, and a few of them absolutely shone out above the rest. The localization of the actual dialogue is also an extreme selling point. The folks at MangaGamer show genuine care for the product they are localizing for stateside release and it shows in the (verified!) high translation quality and stellar editing of the dialogue which helped give the visual novel life.

[h1]WRITING[/h1]
Once you get past the fact that the game revolves around a pair of lesbian ghosts, the visual novel is...surprisingly grounded in reality. The characters, for the most part, are realistic without being uninteresting (a few of the characters, specifically Koba Youka, I've grown to be very fond of and am astonished at how especially good their characterization was), and the interpersonal relationships are plausible without being lackluster. I haven't read the original Japanese text, so I can't verify if it was originally written as such or if it was the (high-grade) localization that makes it seem this way, but engaging with the dialogue in this visual novel was very rewarding throughout. This all being said, there was one relationship in particular that drew some mixed reception; the teacher-student relationship. In all honesty, it was somewhat awkward and felt a bit rushed, but it was nowhere close to a dealbreaker for me.

[h1]OVERALL[/h1]
I don't read many visual novels, but I do engage with plenty of yuri media. And Kindred Spirits on the Roof is one of the finest entries in both of those categories. Do I consider it worth the $34.99? Honestly, I don't know. It does seem to be a bit on the pricier side (especially since STEINS;GATE is the same price and that's longer and more comprehensive), so on the occasional chance that this visual novel goes on sale, please do get it. It's a truly fantastic work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303206901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1499831816}
review:
Highly recommended. Finishing the game 100% (including reading all the extras) took me 23 hours, and I read at a pretty fast pace. There were so many different couples with problems of varying levels of complexity, but all of it felt fresh and fun. I love how closely-acquainted the reader gets to feel with all of the girls through the eyes of Yuna, and I also love how more context and background is provided for characters (in the extras) in relationships that may have felt sudden or contrived in the main story.

There were only two things that really annoyed me:
1) The game slows down drastically every couple of minutes of gameplay--which I'm sure most reviews have already complained about. The solution for me was to save immediately and close the game before it froze completely.
2) Some of the voices for the girls were way too squeaky for my taste. This may not be as much of an issue for someone else, but I'll just put that out there. I got by by clicking and reading quickly, though I suppose it would have been easier to just mute.

Another thing, there IS a relationship that occurs between a student and a teacher if that sort of thing really squicks anyone out. However, the teacher is very considerate and never holds her status as an adult over the student to make her do sexual things.

Anyway, I love ONYS/KSOTR and all of the girls so so much. I'm ridiculously thankful that I got to live vicariously through these complex characters who struggled and overcame to share their love with their friends and girlfriends ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198039206817', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2508962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19643, 'playtime_at_review': 27451, 'last_played': 1712454509}
review:
我把我在贴吧发的修改一下，搬到Steam好了。
我第一次玩是一三年的中旬。好像是六月?当时是在网上看到百合灵的立绘和背景图，一下子就被吸引了，呢时候的我还不适应当时流行的galgame画风，一下子就被这个游戏吸引了。百合灵是我第一部感兴趣，也是主动去玩的一部文字avg。
老实说第一次玩到这种类型的游戏的时候我挺新奇的，也没在意这个游戏的内容是百合。一开始登场的主角结奈和百合灵们发生的事情都是中规中矩，但到了要帮助圣苗的片段时，我一下子就泪目了。当我看到圣苗在美纪前辈的教室门口徘徊数周，只是为了给前辈递上自己的饱含真情的信时，我一下子就泪目了，当时我想，居然真的会有这样的事情，为圣苗那样的情感和坚持打动了。这之后结奈在百合灵的劝诱下伸出了援手，没有结奈，可能圣苗会永远错失向前辈表达谢意的机会吧。当时只有第一天汉化版，只有第一天的游戏内容被汉化了，而我也只能默默的等着完全汉化版，我想过要用机翻来推，但我还是想等到完全汉化再推，感觉这样能更好的体会到剧情。
呢时候我天天来贴吧暗中观察，等着那张汉化进度表，等待着汉化的发布。好像是十月的月底，我在贴吧置顶看到了汉化的发布。呢是我没想过的事情，我一度以为我可能玩不到的汉化，终于出炉了。玩过百合灵后，我虽然玩了君与彼女之恋，也玩了水仙和石头门，但我依旧惦记着百合灵的汉化，惦记着故事的后续，感谢汉化组的各位，没有你们，我也不会有机会能接触这款心目中无可替代的神作
圣苗与美纪是最早登场的cp。我一开始被打动的地方正是圣苗的真挚情感。这对的撮合非常特别，她们情感发展非常有地下党的味道。在远见结奈夫斯基的帮助下开拓据点，进行着只属于她们的地下行动。那间狭窄的杂物间，正是他们远离繁琐现实的避难所。学姐和学妹的性格差让她们的情感路途时有波折，这些波折如果没有结奈，可能一辈子也无法铺成平路。但在百合灵们的策划和结奈的协助下，这一切却又变成了感情的催化剂，使她们不再是朋友，而是心有灵犀的恋人(圣苗:谁敢说美纪前辈的坏话!就砸谁狗头汪!)。其实，我钟情于百合灵这个游戏的地方，不是立绘CG，更多的是游戏里对她们友情的塑造。
一二三三人组可以说是最让我有共鸣感的一组之一。我和羽美一样，小时候没有什么朋友，当我看到羽美的回忆杀的时候，我总会联系到自己可能和她无独有偶的经历。也因此我和羽美一样，格外珍惜着沙莎和音七这样的朋友们。羽美与沙莎在友情与爱情之间的纠结让我为她们着急的不得了，好在是音七在屋顶上推了她们一把，真是长吁一口气了。(要不是有音七你们可是要磨叽到毕业啊！)她们三人都有各自的闪光点，也有各自的缺点，但正是这些优缺点使她们聚在了一起，三个臭皮匠，顶个诸葛亮，说的就是她们三，仔细看看你的身边，是不是也有这样的人？阳香（Rita)唱的没错，ひとりが辛いからふたつの手をつないだ，ふたりじゃ寂しいから輪（わ）になって手をつないだ。一个人是艰辛的 于是两人牵起手，两个人是寂寞的 于是大家围成圈。（说到三个人，我为什么回想起春希，藤井冬弥，还有超时空要塞呢...还有星河战队1）
喜欢可爱的东西可不是桐的专利。教授古文的小月代可真的是相当惹人怜爱的呀(题外话，不知道有没有人想起2010年的秋之回忆7里的星月织姬?)，小月代浑身都是萌属性，外加还有贫血的毛病，让我有时回想起我那同样有着贫血的可爱朋友!在厕所里抱着头用理科脑烦恼的桐和为桐担心的月代，本可能永远无法走在一起，师生恋这样的禁忌，在结奈的暗中协助下已经不是事了，远见结奈夫斯基和她的情报小组成员榎木纱织，永谷惠及时发现了她们的烦恼!结奈夫斯基不畏艰险，在校园内围追堵截，惠为结奈提供UAV支援，侦查敌方动向，精确定位！在好同志(老练的兄弟会刺客)狛野比奈的协助（乱入）下，总算是将不老实的信使桐捉到了老师面前!在主角的撮合下，桐得到了和老师独处的机会，别小看结奈的功劳，正是因为结奈一行人，桐与月代才能明白对方的心意，才能有后续的闪光☆作战计划！教师与学生，本不应该结合的身份，却挡不住双方内心的对彼此的追求，某种程度来说，这一对在旁人看来可是相当的背德……但其实不，一点都不。还记得桐的话吗，即使小月代变成了老婆婆，她也依然会喜欢她。在此再次为真诚的为她们的真心献上祝福!
我想想……哦，体育组的二位。在op里就已经开始执子之手与子偕老的二位，在游戏时间线之前就已是情侣了的二位也非常富有真实感。真实剧情体验和贴近日常的剧本是我认为这个游戏有别于花吻这样的游戏的突出卖点。接吻魔茉莉和理性派的美夕可能是游戏里最有现实意义的一对，因此他们也可能是真正认真考虑过她们未来的一组cp吧。她们决定一同走向人生终点，但正因如此，才会有一同争抢比奈的闪光弹情节，才有双方从产生不信任的裂痕，到之后的相互理解与重归于好。就像一对老夫老妻一样，两个有点合不来老伴为了点小事儿拌拌嘴，看起来满城风雨可最后却总能奇迹般重归于好，如果只将之归咎到结奈的帮助的话，我认为是不够的，最重要的还是她们两人的日积月累的情感。稍微代入下的话，大家应该都不难理解二人的心境了吧(题外话：白色相簿看多了，茉莉的接吻魔属性就总会让我觉得“美夕:你为什么会这么熟练啊!”)
说到鬼门番爱来和摇滚妹阳香(注意哦，阳香的声优是Rita哦！不止是声优还是个真正的歌手也!唱过lb的op和ed哦!Liar社的好朋友！这次居然会配这样的游戏，吃惊!)本来是我觉得这部游戏里最脱线最不和实际的一组。你想，我一个喜欢摇滚的无产阶级（搞事）群众，怎么就喜欢上了这么一个遵纪守法基层干部呢?一个是迷迷糊糊的天然呆，另一个是性格古怪的鬼门番，我怎么想都不知道该怎么让这对在一起呐……然而事实却是，她们成了!在我印象里这对其实不如其他几组印象深刻，只知道爱来是个货真价实的女王，而阳香是个货真价实的摇滚呆!(还有呢个学园祭上演唱的届之……White……AA爱)。前段时间吧，在床上躺着发呆的时候忽然想起了这组cp，感觉很奇妙，想起自己和朋友们也不过是因为一些奇怪的契机而相识的时候，忽然就想起了阳香。可能这就是友情吧。阳香与爱来本来是毫无交集的两人，却阴差阳错的对上了眼，我和呢些朋友们……好像也差不多是这样的经历唉，可能我之前感觉奇怪的不是阳香，是我自己也说不定?简而言之，这组CP也有她们的有趣之处，之前误解了他们，真是对不起！
结奈和比奈作为官配其实挺好的，和阿野比起来，结奈比奈的组合一是有着幼驯染的先天情感在，又好像我们在某伏见老贼笔下见到的兄妹一样，结奈比奈的感情就是那种迷迷的感觉呀!(没有血缘关系的妹妹呀!)为什么大家会不喜欢比奈而喜欢站结野呢!要不是官方没钱做阿野的剧情!这个游戏就会是这样。“比奈:是我，是我先，明明都是我先来的……”“阿野:为什么会这样子呢 第一次有了喜欢的人，有了能做一辈子朋友的人……”，够了，结奈立绘里一只手插着腰的原因你们明白了吗!是胃疼啊!是站着说话胃会痛啊!结奈已经累了，已经不想再变成邪教了，你们关心过结奈吗！你们只关心过你们自己！
结奈的过去是使结奈变成现在这幅冷漠，不亲近的真正原因，曾经的结奈也曾开朗过，但现实中的打击却让结奈产生了心魔，游戏开篇孤独的站在屋顶上，倚着栏杆看着远处淡蓝色的山，在教室里只有阿野一个是真正的老相好。直到结奈在屋顶上遇到那对百合灵，结奈的一成不变的日常才得到了改变。结奈一开始是在惠的威逼利诱（和纱织近乎专业的传销）下帮助了一对又一对陷入窘境的少女们，帮助他们打开了自己的心结，完成他们的恋情。从一开始的极不情愿，到带点小傲娇的为了大家出谋划策(充当幕后黑手)，这之间自然的发生着心灵的转变不仅仅是结奈，玩家们也跟着结奈慢慢的发生改变。当结奈自己为情所困的时候，她帮助过的cp们一个个在她面前出现，结奈封冻的心，在一次次的帮助过程中解冻了。可能结奈也想不到，百合灵不仅掰弯了她，还掰断了过去的束缚。看起来是结奈推进了游戏的发展，其实百合灵们也很重要啊，在背后让结奈成了后宫王(结all)的潜力种子的，正是这两小心机呀!
关于阿野藤和音七这样的特殊人物，我想说，你们玩怪猎的时候加我一个好吗？关于这两人其实我有想写的东西，但是打了删删了打，感觉还是留到以后茅塞顿开了再写吧。
最喜欢的要放到最后说。百合灵组是我最喜欢的一组cp。她们的故事是最动人的，最浪漫的。为了心里默默憧憬的她，纱织用自己的死换回了那个她的生。几十年来为自己的思念所困，她化作了地缚灵，徘徊在校内，孤身一人，茕茕孑立。惠本是体弱多病的孩子，只因人群当中看见了那孤独的纱织，而不断的在校内寻找着她。她怎么会想到，呢不过是个为情而死的幽灵呢，惠不知道，也从未变过她的心，从她第一眼看见纱织以来，就一直拖着自己孱弱的身子，不断的追寻着纱织的身影。讽刺的是，惠在生命的最后一刻，仍一无所获，倒在冰冷的雨中，而化作地缚灵的她，却惊讶是发现自己苦苦寻找的人，就在她身旁。只有惠能看见纱织，只有纱织能和惠交谈。惠和纱织都因为无法实现自己的心愿而被束缚在这小小的校园里。表面两情相悦的纱织和惠，却互相隐藏着各自的不安，纱织一直模仿着她喜欢的人，惠一直担心纱织的爱不是真心。三十年来互相厮守，目送着呢些无法达成心愿的女孩子们带着遗憾离开学院。本应不变的春夏秋冬，却因结奈的出现而带来了转机。结奈给了她们实现心愿的机会，帮助了百合灵实现少女们的愿望，无私的借出了她和比奈的身体给百合灵。百合灵们升天时，我心里有一种说不出的感觉。没有太难受，也没有太忧郁。他们的升天是注定的，既然游戏一开始就给了这样的铺垫，我也只能接受这样的展开了。我一开始对他们没有什么感觉，但随着游戏的推进，我对百合灵组的二位越来越喜欢，尤其是纱织，我虽然是个博爱的人，什么样的角色都喜欢，但只有纱织我不能退让。最喜欢的角色。没有之一。她的好要多少我都能说多少，惠也是，这两位是货真价实的天造地设！这么一对即古典又现代，浪漫而超现实的CP，你说我该上哪找去！(再说个题外话吧！相信大家应该都知道圣母在上吧。来，跟我一起念!纱织(Sachi)!再来念!祥子(Sachiko)!)
之前在翻百合灵的SBEAM聊天版块的时候看到很多有趣的东西，比如百合灵的动画化请愿，还有拿MSG5和百合灵对比的（MSG5剧情没有做完，但是百合灵却是完整剧情！MSG5和百合灵迷之相似！Outer heaven=Yuritopia!Yuna=BIG BOSS!因此百合灵比MSG5高的不知道哪去了！），看到除了我之外，还有人热爱着这个游戏我还是很开心的。
这个游戏让我来打分我可能会打八分，但八分其实也算给高了。BGM对某些人来说可能会显得单调，而没有完全配音也劝退了相当的一部分人（我当时还在设置里找，我到底哪儿弄错了居然没有配音了？），好在全配音制作似乎在进行了，我也只能拭目以待呢时候的百合灵能再活跃了！（Liar社你这套玩法我好像在漆黑的夏尔诺斯上见过啊）记得当他登录steam的时候，大家只知道第一个引进的无修R18，但作为一个玩了一遍又一遍，安利了一次又一次的人来说简直不能忍，为了R18而玩这个游戏的人还是请去他处艹猫吧。
结尾了也不知道说些什么了，这是我第一次写测评，难免有许多不足，我希望有更多人喜欢这个游戏，并从中获得各自的乐趣，正所谓一万个人有一万个哈姆雷特。与其犹豫纠结是否游玩，不如立即尝试，自己尝试来的好。
不管过了多少年，我都不会忘记百合灵

author: {'steamid': '76561197963989951', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3579, 'last_played': 1577330090}
review:
Over the past 2 weeks or so I have read this VN, read all of the extra scenes afterwards and listened to all of the audio dramas...and I still want more. It took me a quite a bit put into words what I love so much about this game, and I'm not going to be comprehensive here. Lets just be clear that this VN touched me deeply and I won't ever forget it. I'm going to just ramble about the things I love about it.

I love the painted art, both the character designs and backgrounds. There are so many great/cute CGs that are perfectly used throughout the game. Aika petting Youka on the head, Umi braiding Sasa's hair, the Kindred Spirits and Yuna drinking coke on the roof...many more. 

I love the frank way the story handles homosexuality, how it doesn't ignore the closeminded people who think this love is just a phase between 2 girlfriends, but it also completely debunks that silliness. Throughout the 30 hours of content, this story is all about legitimizing yuri romance as equal to any other kind of romance. It does this naturally too, through its characters and dialog. The sparse "h-scenes" also do a good job of supporting that, and they aren't explicit or too long. These scenes are used for character development rather than just titilation, and their inclusion is very important to the arc of each couple.

And I love those couples, Youka and Aki are my favorite... all of them are sweet and wonderful though. Throughout the game there's a real sense that these folks love each other from the way they talk and think, it's so heartwarming. The drama is smart and never overblown, and the resolution is always satisfying. Not just the romantic couples, the friend couples are a treat to listen to as well. Yuna and Ano have a wonderful discussion towards the end of the game that is pretty much exactly what I needed to hear in a game like this. Everything regarding the characters and dialog work perfectly.

There are some presentation problems, the music is good but there's too little of it. The art is unfortunately low res and sparse sound effects are sometimes very bad. Even with those misgivings and the rather high price point, this yuritopia is highly recommended. It is worth your money.

UPDATE: I read all of it again after the Full Chorus upgrade, it's pretty much the same game but with full voice, but it just reaffirms that this game is super special and I think everyone should read it~

author: {'steamid': '76561198242658912', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1514951517}
review:
《屋顶上的百合灵》是一款温馨的校园纯百合游戏，主要讲述了女子高中生结奈某日在屋顶上见到两位百合灵少女后，为实现两人的愿望而帮助撮合校园内一对对百合情侣的故事[spoiler]并最终自己也上了套（x [/spoiler] 作为百合控玩家，本人十分喜爱这款游戏，并想简单聊聊这款游戏的个人喜爱之处。

作为一款纯百合游戏，《百合灵》各种意味上都是纯粹的“百合”：从游戏中没有出现一个露脸的男性、学校是女子高中等等的背景设定，到每个主要CP都无男性涉及[spoiler]、H场景中没有用奇怪的道具（x）[/spoiler]等等。百合作品有取悦观者与不取悦观者之分，在游戏、动画漫画等领域都有出现；而《百合灵》可以让人感受到制作方想做一款纯粹的“女孩子与女孩子恋爱”的游戏。游戏选材于最普通的高中校园生活，故事中每个人的性格也和平凡的你我相似，恋爱的动机、恋爱时的犯傻与悸动也让人脸红心跳之余不禁回忆起自己的高中生活，与曾经的爱恋之人。（可惜没经历过合宿与校园祭QAQ）这平凡而充满快乐的校园生活，能或多或少勾起了玩家们心中的共鸣，并让人更加沉浸在这一段段质朴的恋情里。此外，游戏中的选项不影响主要剧情，每一对都是固定的且是好结局；对于这种设计的评价各人有各人的想法[spoiler]（比如本人就好想攻略阿野呜呜呜），[/spoiler]不过从“营造温馨平和的故事氛围”这一点而言，这种设计也不无道理，制作方应该也有自己的考量吧。

画风与剧情方面，Peg朴素而稳健的绘画风格也与这款游戏相配，让人感到舒适并投入更多精力于剧情上。游戏对人物的刻画十分细腻，每一个主要人物都有着独特的性格，每一对情侣也有着各不相同的恋爱故事。可能由于人物与CP太多的缘故，个人感觉一些对于被追求方的心理转变描写可以更细致一些[spoiler]，比如广播组的羽美、师生组的小园生。我自己觉得最“合理”的CP是最先出现的学姐学妹，也可能是个人私心很喜欢这对啦（[/spoiler]。然而对于一个群像描写、主要人物这么多且文本量巨大的一款游戏，这也算不得是缺点，算是自己的小小执念吧。

此外，《百合灵》的日历系统是一个亮点。游戏以每月为单位，玩家将先完成该月某几日女主角或百合灵为视角的剧情事件，再完成本月某几日出现的、与特定情侣相关并以情侣中其中一位为视角的剧情事件。日历界面同时也是存档点。这样的设计很利于玩家理清事件发生的先后顺序，且能很方便地回顾之前的某个剧情（不用去特意存档），十分爽快。日历系统也方便解锁完成一遍游戏后出现的附加剧情（与主线剧情中的选项相关）。

总体而言，《屋顶上的百合灵》是一款非常优秀的百合gal游戏：风格温馨可爱；剧情丰富细腻；百合度非常高。
++丰富温馨的剧情
+独特的日历叙事系统
适宜的音乐（虽然重复度略高了一点儿…
+++百合万岁！YURITOPIA！！！

[h1] 推荐给喜欢百合、喜欢百合、喜欢百合的玩家们。（[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025319103', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1548087182}
review:
大名鼎鼎的百合VN神作。在连续一日的昼夜变换着中，品尝了着甜美的百合能量，最后只能说出百合最高啊。
游戏相当的一本道且流程并不长，但是爱情小品的剧情却非常的有意思不会让人感到厌倦，作为群像剧，每对CP都有自己的特点，都会让人爱不释手，而且少有的没有胃痛情节，基本上都是发糖，却甜而不腻，却能从中感受到每位角色的幸福实在是非常的棒。
但是缺点也是有的的，立绘的变换太少，有时候能看见台词已经变换了好几种心情了，但是角色的立绘却还是没有什么变化。人物的角色塑造虽然合格且各有特色，但是缺乏深度。选项的选择无关紧要可以说变成了单纯的有声小说（其实大部分时候没声）。当然最重要的一点就是对于感情描写太浅尝即止了，流于表面没有对于人物心理变化进行深刻的描写。当然现在这样已经很有意思了。对了，还缺乏阿野线和音七线，阿野实在感觉太路人，完全被剧情拿来当一个好用的人物，只有要用的时候才出现。而对于三人组线，我还以为是《无名的星群》一样的发展，结果音七竟然真的只是友情体现，说实话我觉得这样还要维持三人朋友关系实在是很奇怪啊，虽然剧情里面解释的还是蛮合理的.......
总体来说非常推荐给各位百合控

author: {'steamid': '76561198158309410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1513771994}
review:
I was really excited to play this game, but I don't think I will be able to finish it. It's pretty much a kinectic novel (and nothing in the game's description informs players about it), which means, that if you expect some meaningful choices and branching paths, forget it. You don't have an impact on the plot (you can just unlock some extra scenes), you just read the story from various characters perspective and see how their relationships grow. 

I enjoyed it for the first two hours or so - probably because of unique protagonist, which is the best part of the game for me. She's relatable, normal girl, that isn't overly emotional and cutesy, which is often an issue with visual novels from Asian countries. Sadly, most of other characters were just annoying. To be fair, with such large main cast, it's hard to not find someone you dislike, but when you find so many of those girls to be either cliche, boring or non-sympathetic, you don't really care about their stories. With actual "visual novels", you can find some enjoyment in impacting the story. Here, though, there's nothing to enjoy.

[b]To sum it up[/b]: if you enjoy yuri kinectic novels, you may like it. Writing is fine, although often wonders into "completely ridiculous" territory, premise is silly and relationship between characters are rather sudden and very unrealistic. Still, there are many different characters and you probably will find someone relatable or interesting.
However, if you look for something where your choices matter and you don't particularly like anime tropes, you'll probably get bored really quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220111257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 43037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5467, 'last_played': 1556497197}
review:
This game is my visual novel of the year because of the light-heartedness, comedic, and relaxing atmosphere. Typically in "GL" or Girls' Love stories, you get thrown in a brutal tug of war of drama and fighting. I was hesitant to purchase this because of stories involving the former, but this visual truly proved me wrong. While there is drama in the story, it is never overbearing or dragged out. The story is made for enjoyment and laughter, like an old Jackie Chan film, and sticks to its guns until the very end. 

Then you buy the super expensive and way overpriced drama cds, like a fucking sheep, because they've already hooked you in with this. 

But seriously, give this a try. 10/10 great characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019202729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1645389958}
review:
A really nice game.

If you like yuri, this one is a must!
If you like romance, you should try this one, too.
And even if you only want to relax from fighting or killing whatever enemies other games throw at you, this could be the one for you.

You get some nice yuri-romances without to much drama and happy endings guaranteed. 
The planer system works pretty well. You can work your way through the planer on a day by day base or follow the routes to the next chapter (=month).

Decisions you make don't change the story but unlock extra scenes, that you can view after completing the main story once. Which is not the best solution, because the extra scenes start from the beginning, showing conflicts and thoughts, that already worked out, by the time, you can watch them. They probably work best at a second playthrough since you get a closer view at the development of the characters.

Playtime is about 30 hours. The extra scenes add  some three or fours hours, so I would say, the price is ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058061634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1461933062}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010395496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1487394238}
review:
Length: Medium (10- 30 hrs)
Avg read: 14-16 hrs + 1-2 hrs of extras
Type: Shoujo Ai

Description:
Kokonotsuboshi Girls' Academy of Commerce, a school built on the site of an old castle, nicknamed "Shirojo." One day, the timid Toomi Yuna, who had been living a quiet life at this school, suddenly met two ghosts on the roof during lunch:

Enoki Sachi, who died in an accident before the war, and Nagatani Megumi, who died of illness 30 years ago. The two "kindred spirits" died with unrequited feelings in their hearts, met, and fell in love. They ardently wish to experience their "first time" together before their eternal rest.

...But they don't know how.

The two who are bound to the site of the school enlist Yuna to help them create more "yuri" couples at the school so that they can glean some sexual insight from observing them, and to assist the girls struggling with their hidden feelings.


Overall Thoughts: I enjoyed the ride for what it was. Kindred Spirits was hard for me to get into at first. I say the first 3 hrs are a pain to get through, but afterwards the story is enjoyable as it branches out over the next few months in the VN. The use of the planner makes the game easier to get through imo as its a pacer of sorts. Enjoyed the couples and glad they didn't pair up all the characters.  Good Yuri VN for the price. Drama CDs there if you end up loving one of the pairing and need more afterstory.

Pros: Length to price is good.
Good number of extras after the story is finished.
Best girl ends of Single as she is best girl.
R18+ Scenes added-in
Love the Planner

Cons: Lack of music tracks made me mute the game after 5 - 7 hrs in.
MC background event could have been deeper and more issues for the game length.
Presonally I didn't care for the main pairing. 

Solid 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048404089', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1527229240}
review:
As a fan of pure yuri, this game is great. The main focus is spread among several couples and how they became more than friends (or strangers). The point of view is distributed among the characters and most of the girls get some narration time. There's a good variety of personalities and relationships too.

The choices don't affect anything which was a bit dissapointing. [spoiler] There's a time where you can pick between two girls but always end up with one. [/spoiler]

Side note: If you play the demo, then buy the game, do not import your save from the demo. It will prevent you from making early different dialogue choices, which may provide a couple extra scenes after playing through the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069619221', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1548498854}
review:
After playing through this game for the second time with the Full Chorus DLC, I thought it best to update my previous lukewarm review. If you plan on playing Kindred Spirits on the Roof, I wholeheartedly recommend the DLC that adds full voice acting to the game. That said, Kindred Spirits is a Yuri visual novel that has you playing cupid to 5 female couples struggling to get their feelings across to one another. It is a rather linear game, but it does give you some freedom in choosing which couple's story you want to read first after completing the main story for each month. The chapters are broken down into days on a calandar and make it for some nice light reading if you don't have much time to play. It's very easy to put down and pick up again, which I appreciate given my work schedule. 

I really love the characters in this game. Out of all the couples in this game, I only disliked one, which in my opinion is quite the accomplishment of the writing team. Each couple is unique and has thier own challenges. I think the clearcut winner is the pairing of Ariu Aki and Koba Youka. A A Ai's lyrics made me cry, it was so awesome and romantic. While the OST does have one AMAZING track, I still think the OST is not very good. For a game this long I think the main 10 tracks are just too repetitive. 

Also worth mentioning, the game does have H Scenes towards the end, but they aren't that long and no genitals are shown. It's very tasteful and showcases the appeal of sweet yuri romances. So if you are in it for the sex, I think you will be disappointed. 

While going through the extra scenes a second time is kind of a chore, I still love this game and recommend it to any Girl's Love fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052793754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1460908486}
review:
Ce n'est pas ma VN yuri préférée, mais franchement elle est très bonne et vaut le coup d'oeil.

De la pure romance en veux-tu qu'en voilà  ! C'est pas cucul et en plus c'est drôle. Une VN rafraîchissante en somme.

Points positifs :
- Musiques, chaque couple a sa petite variante sonore si vous tendez bien l'oreille ;)
- Doublage partiel très agréable
- Graphismes, c'est beau, c'est agréable pour les yeux
- Des histoires touchantes (même si clichet faut avouer)
- Des persos tout aussi touchants et attachants
- De l'humour

Points négatifs :
- Kinetic (choix sans influence réelle sur le déroulement de l'histoire), j'aurais aimé avoir de vrais choix avec de vraies conséquences
- Un perso qui me plait beaucoup même si on la voit pas tant que ça et qui n'a pas sa romance dans le jeu, mais bon y a du subtext avec un autre perso (pas de nom pour pas de spoil)
- Vive les clichets (sans que ça soit vraiment gênant)
- Le prix plus de 30€ pour une vingtaine d'heures de jeu (MAIS vu le niveau graphique, le son et en fait le contenu globale et le temps qu'ils ont du passer à faire cette VN, je crois qu'on peut dire que ça les vaut bien).

Potentiellement un classique du VN Yuri dans le pure style manga. Les fans du genre foncez, pour les autres faut voir, Il est quand même question de Yuritopia. 
En espérant que mon évaluation vous sera utile, tchuss ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198121486602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1483574152}
review:
Поиграв почти два часа, могу сказать, что тут куча дико раздражающих вещей.

1. Глупые, глупые-глупые-глупые диалоги.
2. Вещи, которые повторяют по 2-3 раза в одном разговоре, и хочется сказать, "Да остановите эту пластинку, я уже поняла!"
3. Повторяющаяся, приедающаяся музыка.
4. Сюжет, сквозь дыры которого пройдет, как минимум, Солнце, если не Бетельгейзе. Такие они большие. При событиях, прописанных на таком уровне, можно было бы с тем же успехом просто сразу уложить всех в кровать, .
5. Ну и само собой, все вышеуказанное не имело бы никакого значения, если бы мне понравился хотя бы кто-то из 8 героинь, которых я успела увидеть. Но нет, все они раздражают меня не меньше, чем их диалоги.

Озвучка ничего, но из-за дурацкого сюжета и текстов хочется быстрее все прокликать - а озвучка в этом только мешает.
Тексты/мысли/общение/события, которые я в свои школьные годы прописала бы на том же уровне (если не лучше). Возможно, будь мне лет 14-18, эта VN мне бы зашла. Но сейчас она не вызывает у меня ничего, кроме утомленных вздохов.

Если бы я купила ее за 1-2 доллара, то промолчала бы и забила, чего только за доллар не купишь. Но за 14, и то со скидкой? Вот это? Srsly, за что?

Дальше спойлеры, они же замеченные мной (за 2 часа!!!!) сюжетные дыры, которые мне вспомнились.
1. Кто при крике "Ой, в школе собака!" выбежит на всех парах из класса на нее смотреть? Если бы я с друзьями сидела делала уроки/болтала/читала, мне было бы класть на каких-то собак в школе. Даже если бы я жила в Японии и собак видела мало - но блин, не НАСТОЛЬКО же мало?! Вот на "пожар", думаю, побежала бы, да.
2. Откуда она со 100% точностью узнала, за какой партой сидит ее любовь, если боялась за ней долго наблюдать, чтобы ее не застали?
3. Как она ожидала эту любовь "минимум пол-часа" (сказано в первом эпизоде), если боялась, что эта самая любовь ее под дверями застанет, и сбегала, пару минут подождав (сказано позже)?
4. Как познакомились духи на крыше, откуда у них сожаления, как они друг в друга влюбились, если вроде бы умерли с разницей в 50 лет? (это минимальная придирка, возможно, плохо объяснили/я чего-то не поняла)
5. Почему учительница, послав девушку отнести коробку, провожала ее до кладовки, а возле кладовки сказала "Это не та кладовка", и отправила к другой, не объяснив, где находится нужная? Что в голове у этой учительницы? Опилки? Вы вообще представляете себе этого д**ила (не в обиду д**илам будь сказано), который просит отнести вещи, и САМ приводит не в то место?

author: {'steamid': '76561198030701387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 296, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1712286837}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170377973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2249, 'last_played': 1554310786}
review:
I really liked this VN. I enjoyed the progression system in the game, instead of making it completely linear it allows you to look at your planner and select which couples you'd prefer to continue with to a certain extent. So if you're like me and have a prefered couple, then you can complete as much of their story as you'd like until you had to complete the main storyline. I hope more VNs start to use this method. 

Yes, there's nudity, but you can tell that it's not the main focus of this VN. The focus is telling the story of the couples. It's cute as hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082032345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1482729344}
review:
Don't let my play time fool you, I definitely got over 20-30 hours of play time out of this visual novel and that's not counting the extra scenes you unlock after finishing the game. 

Every 15-20 minutes the game would freeze and become unresponsive when I opened it through steam, so I had to use a work around. I had to go to my game library, right click the game, click “properties,” click the “local files” tab, click “browse local files,” and finally open the game directly from the folder. It was only after doing all that the game worked without any problems. The only thing about opening the game like that is that steam won't register it which is why I only have five hours on record even though I played it for far longer than that.

I had this game on my wishlist for a while now waiting to see if it'd get a better sale, but after a while it seemed 25% would be the best sale I'd get so I decided to finally pull the trigger and I wasn't disappointed. I'd say this is probably the ultimate yuri visual novel experience just based on the amount of content you get and the fact that you have five different yuri couples to get that you learn about aside from the main ones each with their own fleshed out storyline that runs parallel to the main one.

In conclusion, if you're a fan of yuri than this is a must buy especially if it's on sale.

review: This game has given me the highest standards as to what to expect in yuri games from now on! The characters are extremely unique and real in their own ways, and each of them develope and mature as the game goes on. The game in itself is very charming and sweet, you can tell the writers actually really care about girl love instead of easy bait (cleavage, etc.) Not to spoil but the ending is very emotional...I'm now sad that i have to find another game to play because this game was so amazing!!! I'm looking forward to purchasing the next cds too. 10/10 would change nothing about this game except make more of them!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995641479', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5646, 'last_played': 1705847851}
review:
Отличный сборник историй про лесбопризраков[spoiler], отчаяние, задротство, кулинарию, совращение несовершеннолетних девочек взрослыми тётями, сожалениях до и после смерти, волонтёрстве, лёгкой атлетике, принятии своей ориентации[/spoiler].
Для любителей поточить копьё скорее посоветую любую Соно Ханабиру, чем эту драму с изрядной долей комедии, написанную самыми разными красками. Да, "это самое" присутствует, но скорее как завершение становления пары.
Много текста на английском, русификацию не завезли. 

На момент выхода новелла считалась "первой без цензуры", но и цензурить можно тут мало чего...

author: {'steamid': '76561198109627682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1490159419}
review:
An extreme level of degeneracy is required to play this game. Honestly, this visual novel is just absolutely horrendous.

Firstly, the entire premise of this garbage is inherently flawed. Lesbian ghosts who try to push real-life lesbians into couples? Really? That is just the worst idea for a story I have ever heard. The guy was probably kicked out of his literature course in University and lives in his mom's basement eating chicken tendies. 

Secondly, the writing is on par with the level of shitty harry potter "Harry x Dumbledore" fanfiction. Who ever the writers were don't understand human beings and how they interact. I imagine their experience with actual people - women specifically - is limited to when they visit those japanese maid cafes. 

Hayao Miyazaki is often misquoted as saying "anime was a mistake." But it's right, it is absolutely right. If you watch anime you are a fundamentally broken human being and you need to see a therapist. Right. Now. You are a disgrace the the billions of years of evolution that allowed for your existance. 

I will never get these hours back, never. Life is short and after playing this life feels massively shorter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314975760', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1616769447}
review:
作为一位[strike]伪[/strike]百合爱好者，我内心中想着一定要为这部作品写一篇评论，但因各种各样的原因，拖了很久。我得承认，我不是一位十分纯粹的百合爱好者，更倾向于那些刷“我好兴奋啊”的萌豚，但这部作品还是十分能感染我的。作品中十分注重对于一对对情侣的心理描写，十分细腻，甚至让我产生一种我在读一篇文学作品的感觉，该搞笑的时候搞笑，该煽情的时候煽情，这种度拿捏的还是不错的。如果一定要说有什么美中不足的话，我想只有情节略显拖沓，主线支线的重合度略高，但如果心平气和的静下心来读，这或许还是可以克服的[spoiler]（可惜我大部分时候做不到，抱歉了）[/spoiler]。总之这是一部十分不错的百合作品，盗版通关后我来入正补款了，顺便锻炼自己的英语水平，我感觉自己四六级更本不虚了，括弧笑。
ps：话说，我曾在steam社区上看到一个黎巴嫩还是叙利亚的国际友人想买这部作品，这是百合开遍全世界的征兆吗，百合赛高！不过哪位仁兄在自己国家里想买这部作品没问题吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198032676010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1600020247}
review: After Finishing Kindred spirits, I felt compelled to post a review, If your looking for a romance visual novel, I highly recommend this game, It has great characters and a great story, and the ending had me tearing up, 10/10 will go through it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034179621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2936, 'last_played': 1711162215}
review:
If you like cute weeboo stuff and actually conclusive yuri, then this is a pretty good game.

Spent way more time in it than I thought I would. Characters are neat and interesting, it has funny moments, sad moments, and its all around pretty great. Like watching a good romance anime with less anime BS but still plenty of anime.

I don't even think you have to be a fan of yuri to enjoy this game. The relationships presented for the most part feel fleshed out and reasonable, so I don't really think its just "yuri for yuri's sake."

Highly recommend. Good entertaining story, characters, and experience.
im terrible at reviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198103606279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1548462751}
review: Sûrement le meilleur visual novel yuri auquel j'ai joué. C'est un jeu très complet, avec une durée de vie très longue (une quarantaine d'heure pour boucler l'histoire principale, une dizaine pour les bonus), un scénario au rythme lent dans lequel on s'implique dès les premières scènes, un chara design hyper travaillé qui nous offre une palette de personnages sympatiques et très attachants, des petits couples qui se forment lentement sous notre regard bienveillant, des scènes de fesses assez soft mais bien présentes (et qui arrivent dès le milieu du jeu ce qui est assez cool)...  BREF un jeu qui vaut bien son prix et qui promet des heures d'émotions, avec en prime une larmichette et un petit pincement au coeur sur le screen de fin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053581714', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1480440818}
review:
I LOVED this game. I actually bought it at almost full-price, because I wanted to play it so much and it didn't disappoint, at all!
The artwork is great, the characters are charming, the storyline is nice and the way all of them interact is so cute and feels real. I thought I was done with the story when I found out that there was even more I could unlock when trying different choices and wow, I just. I love it so much.
It's voice-acted, the translations are good and the soundtrack is pleasing.

So if you're a yuri fan and want a sweet LONG(this didn't count my 12+ offline hours) story, this is the game for you!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146214687', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3469, 'last_played': 1558776580}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a visual novel with an excellent story to it, the writers did a very good job with it. The artwork for the game is equally good, especially the event scenes. As for the music, it fits in really well with the type of mood that is present but there aren't that many different variations in the music leaving it to mostly repeating however it's better than having no music at all. While it is rather expensive for a vn, the quatlity and length of it more than make up for it. The only big downside I could find with it is that from the start vn makes you think that there is voice acting throughout the entire story, but after day 2 it'll stop, it turns out the voice acting only plays during important sceens to the story which won't happen every day. Other then that it's really good.

10/10 would recommend
