author: {'steamid': '76561198008385935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3572, 'last_played': 1459663976}
review: It's really good! And really cute! I like all the characters, and the only romance I have any issues with is the student/teacher one, which is handled relatively tastefully. Yuna is a fantastic main character; she's likeable at the start, but she grows, and I like her even more by the end. Her growth, and really all the characters', is very natural. It doesn't feel like thing happens, -> now a character is different, but rather the characters slowly start reacting differently. This has easily become my favorite VN, and I'll likely be buying the drama CDs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998015876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1858, 'last_played': 1462328239}
review: For how silly the premise is, the store is surprisingly well done.  The characters are well-portrayed, the dialogue has good translation and all the characters overcome their conflicts and become better for it.  As long as you are okay with the not-work safe material I would highly recommend this visual novel, especially if the subject matter interests you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058228631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1626063122}
review:
So hey, first ever review!
-Heard about this game from an article about it being uncensored. I hope Steam allows more of this in the future, regardless of the genders or sex included. 
-Shockingly, lesbian pairings and girl on girl stuff really isn't my "thing", and while the price made me almost reconsider, I jumped in and played it, and only just now reached the ending.
-Don't watch that intro if you don't want spoilers!
Pros-
1. Very good story in visual format, great artwork and settings
2. Well-developed characters, a majority of them being more than one-dimensional and fleshed-out (Phrasing, Boom!)
3. Different perspectives, sometimes with surprising results!
4. Emotionally heavy, but not in a burdensome way
5. Light humor, heavy on the drama, sad when it needs to be, and nothing really unrealistic actually ('cept GHOSTS)
6. Music fits really well with the situations, especialy with the tone of the scenes
7. And featuring unsusual amounts of Japanese cuisine!
Cons-
1. Some perspective scenes are really repetitive, both with dialog and music
2. Some pairings are just going to be more interesting than others
3. You are given dialog choices, but quickly find that they don't have a lot of impact (even if you totally guess correctly)
    ...Yet you need to replay those to choose the other option for unlocks later, D'oh!
4. Weird pacing, not only with certain parts of the plot but with the events as they play out on the calander.

Final verdict: 9/10
Ending was great, the couples are fun, the game is casual yet allows you to become invested in it if you so desire. Reads better than most mangas. I absolutely recommend this game to fans of dating sims and visual novels alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035930071', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2146, 'last_played': 1459290349}
review:
All I have to say is that this is really good, and really well written. I dont play a whole lot of VN's but I did quite enjoy this one. I have about 37 hours total into it and finished the main storyline.
All the charaters are really well done with them all being a little different and dont all share the same things except the fact that they all like girls lol.

My only real CON to this whole thing which really isnt much of one, more of just a personal gripe. I really REALLY wish more of this was voice acted. The voice acting was done really well but only really happened during key important points of certain chapters which gave more feeling to that specific scene. If It was fully voice it would be an 11/10, but as it sits its still a 10/10 would read again!
Would recommend to anyone that enjoys any VN out there. #YURITOPIA

author: {'steamid': '76561198210291224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1548701403}
review:
There are flaws here.
The music is limited and quickly gets boring.
Voice acting is limited to certain important scenes.
There are very few choices and the ones that are there have no impact on the story instead only opening extra scenes.
However for all that there are flaws the good outweights the bad enormously.
The story has an excellent grasp of Yuri tropes and while conforming to many of them it plays with them brilliantly and no character feels like a trope instead all of them feel like fully fleshed out characters.
The challenges and conflicts of these girls never felt arbitary just for the sake of the story but rather arose organicaly from their personality.
I've played through it multiple times already simply because I enjoyed their stories so much and wish to see more of them.
Definetly worth the price^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198006393871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1590984838}
review:
I don't think I can really add much more to what people have already said.  The visual novel is good.  After getting the full clear I suppose I can say this.  It is a very straight forward game.  There are no branching paths and your choices don't particularly have any effect except for unlocking secret scenes throughout the year after the main storyline is complete. 

I suppose my only gripe was that I didn't get a fully animated scene for Youka's show even as extra content.  I guess I can't ding them for not going above and beyond, I'm glad they recorded it at least.  

The story is nice, there's enough variety that you'll have at least one couple to really root for.  It's a very solid game.  The game is not really a mold breaker(except for being on steam) so if you like this sort of visual novel, you'll like Kindred Spirits.  If you want to give visual novels a try, this is a good place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085918525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5008, 'last_played': 1511841432}
review:
Yuritopia is real.

At first, the game might start out a little slow but that's only because it's fleshing out the characters and introductions. Once I got through that small bump, I honestly loved every second of the game.

The protagonist is easily likeable even from the getgo (it doesn't take long before you utterly love her, really) and the girls that are introduced afterwards are all rather unique in their own way and easy to become fond of. Their relationships went in ways I didn't expect but definitely had me grinning as they developed. Nothing about it feels rushed or awkwardly forced. It all seems really genuine even with the realism they seem to add to it (a crush that starts out entirely one sided, age difference, etc.).

In terms of content, it definitely has quite a lot in my opinion. Even after you finish the "main" story line, side stories are unlocked that show the other girl's feelings and their perspective. It's also important to point out that while Yuna (the protag) has a large role in aiding the start of their relationships, you also see how these girls come together from their own perspectives. With the side stories, you see what the other person was thinking at the time and how they were feeling, so in a way you get to see both sides. That was utterly amazing, honestly.

As for the nudity, none of it feels perverted or done in the purpose of trying to get more views/customers. They arrive to that point naturally in their relationship, and not every couple goes as far as some. Even then, everything feels warm and loving. These scenes were made to show their feelings for each other, rather than to just draw naked girls, which is a definite bonus.

Final thoughts: While the price can be a bit... well, pricey... for what they're offering you, I honestly think it's definitely deserved and worth it. If you truly love Yuri, girls love, or just love seeing cute relationships blossom and develop, then this game is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066241195', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7713, 'last_played': 1639491204}
review:
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is charm personified and if you're not careful, it will suck you right into its core and never let you leave the planet known as Yuritopia.   
 
Very few pieces of media with the 'Yuri' tag can admit to being more than just 'fanservice'. If I was asked to describe 'Kindred Spirits on the Roof' in terms of my anime experiences, I would have to say that it reminds me of a cross between " Kuttsukiboshi" and "Sakura Trick" mixed in with a cross between "Maria Sama ga Miteru" and "Strawberry Panic".  
 
The two ghosts - or 'Kindred Spirits' as they prefer to be called, may as well have been drawn from the likeness of Sachiko and Yumi. Not to mention, Matsuri and Miyu - the track and field sempai - look an awful lot like Sei and Yōko. This led me to believe that the design choice may not have been entirely unintentional. Considering how big a part "Maria Sama ga Miteru" has had in the Yuri/Shoujo ai genre it doesn't really surprise me. In fact, it almost felt as if the game was paying homage to these roots, expanding on them and going into an area that was not possible 10 years ago.  
 
I very rarely play a game through more than once – feeling as if once I've done the main story there are too many other games out there to try so no need to do all the "side stuff". Kindred Spirits on the Roof however is a visual novel that made me want to not only experience all the "side stuff", but made me want to re-experience it again and again - in the same manner as one would re-read parts of a favourite  book or rewatch parts of a movie that left an impression.  
 
As flaws are part of any review, I do feel obligated to touch upon them. Although, in my opinion, the main flaw here is simply the lack of voice acting. While all the main scenes have voice acting – it would've been great to see it in the side stories as well. The voice acting in this game is so exceptional that it's truly a shame that there's not more of it.  
 
In conclusion, if you're looking for an experience that will put a smile to your face and make you feel good about life, love and the human race in general – then look no further. Kindred Spirts on the Roof will do just that – and more. In my 100 + hours with the game I got the 'full clear' icon with all the extras unlocked – yet I'm still keeping it in my favourites so that I can come back to it whenever I need a 'pick-me-up'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091223830', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1462085949}
review: This was my first dating sim that I have played and I gotta say I hope that others can measure up this because it was pretty amazing. I identify as lesbian so I don’t know if I will find many more that are of the same subject matter but I hope so. It was so impactful that I feel like I have been in a few relationships these past few weeks. The characters are complex and all the ways the stories intertwine is amazing. In the end I was so happy with ending I went to work today with a big smile on my face. Like I had just spent a few weeks on vacation with a girlfriend. So amazing. I hope they make more games like this in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045432867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1696543569}
review:
I loved this game.  Great characters, storylines that are mostly good and enjoyable. Really cute couples. There are 6 total and there's both a postive and negative to that. It's great to follow each couple's story but parts of the mainstory are seperated by scenes seen through the perspective from the girl's you encounter and/or help through out the game, and it can be a bit much, especially when there is like more of those scenes than main characters scenes for a given part of the game. You can skip through them if you want though. I didn't, since I enjoyed those scenes and didn't want to skip out on any story in them, it just bothered me how much they delayed continuation of the main story. In the end, I would have preferred just going straight through the mainstory and only afterwards, going through all the couple scenes and stuff. Still, it was a great game. I loved the main character in it.
Good stuff, plox more games of this quality. 
Also voice acting was mostly on point.
Not all parts were voice acted but there is plenty of it and most of it was fine to me. I never felt like it was really missing somewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000720944', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3448, 'last_played': 1507919988}
review:
Let me just open by saying that Kindred Spirits is Good.

For some context: I read a lot of visual novels, and I regret that. There's not really any other way to put it. I like the medium in theory, but the vast majority of what you can find is just bad. Pacing in particular is a problem, followed up by tendency to throw in reprehensible content.

Kindred Spirits is novel right off the bat because something actually happens in the first hour. While it's not immune to pacing problems, Kindred Spirits' plot moves along fairly regularly, aided by the device of the planner breaking the story into discrete chunks. Another thing that stops Kindred Spirits from feeling like it's stalling out is the fact that it follows a handful of couples, so someone's story is always advancing meaningfully whatever you're reading.

The couples are what is going to make it for you if you like the game. The characters are all unique and fairly well written, and the game for the most part does a really good job of differentiating the characters' internal monologues when there's a scene from their perspective. Yuna is an interesting character and one who I feel a lot of kinship with, but seeing the antics of the various couples as they fall in love and strive to start a relationship is bulk of the draw.

Well, I guess there's one other potential draw. The elephant in the room.

According to one of the translators, sexual scenes are only roughly 6% of the script. Having read all of it, I'm surprised it's even that high- and if sex scenes are 6% of the script, then things like "nngh" and "ahn" have to be at least 3%. I'm not a huge fan of sex scenes in these kind of games to begin with, but if you're going to have them Kindred Spirits' ones are fairly good. They do a decent job of making the people actually seem like teenagers who have no idea how to bone, and the CGs never get more explicit than a few anime tiddies. Unless you're incredibly morally offended by euphemistic reference to heavy petting you'll probably be fine- it's not like people are breaking out the dildos for a 50 page orgy.

One complaint you can level (aside from the pacing and editing, which, while WAY above VN standard, is still a little long sometimes)  is the "extra scenes". Once you finish the main story, you're only about half way done. Various scenes pop up all over the planner, and the main way they're unlocked is making choices in the main game. This is sort of a hassle, so I'd recommend just going back and choosing the other option every time you see a choice to get it out of the way early. The extra scenes are nice, but they're where the game threatens to outstay its welcome. Personally I was charmed enough to enjoy it right up until the final extra scene, but I suspect a lot of people will be done about halfway through the extras.

Also, the game makes you think it might have alternate routes, but that's a lie, choices only affect the extra scenes. Which is a shame, but there's nothing wrong with there being one story you want to tell.

In summary, Kindred Spirits is a cute little game that's a lot of fun. It lasted me about a month and I enjoyed my time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001149625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2640, 'last_played': 1458555111}
review:
Suivez quelques mois de la vie de Toomi Yuna et de plusieurs autres personnages aussi attachants que peu originaux dans une histoire légère pleine de fantômes, d'uniformes, de courses poursuite dans des couloirs, de rougissements spontanés, de cœurs qui battent la chamade et de premiers baisers.

Vous aimez:
- Les romances lesbiennes (Qui l'eu cru?)
- Les bons gros clichés scénaristiques
- Les histoires au ton léger et à l'humour omniprésent
- Les dessins globalement agréables à l'œil, que ce soit les personnages ou les fonds.
- Les bandes sons qui collent à l'ambiance mais qui finissent par se répéter
- Le 800*600, la HD ce n'est pas votre tasse de thé
- Toomi Yuna
- Payer une trentaine d'euros pour lire pendant 20-40h
- Les scènes longues et qui n'apportent rien au scénario
- Montrer au monde que vous avez bon goût

Vous n'aimez pas:
- Les VN entièrement doublées
- Les histoires tristes
- Avoir réellement le choix dans le déroulement du scénario
- Les histoires qui ne vous demandent pas de repasser quelques scènes pour débloquer des bonus à la fin
- Les personnages aux personnalités complexes
- Les rebondissements imprévus (quoique)
- Les titres censurés sur Steam
- Les histoires qui tombent dans la vulgarité gratuite
- Les titres compatibles avec l'overlay steam

Qu'est ce que vous attendez? « Let's make it a yuritopia! »

author: {'steamid': '76561198248317294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1456245678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138730121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2827, 'last_played': 1456038696}
review:
Saw this game a while ago and was super excited to hear about the English version so I bought it when it was released.
This game is everything I love and more, I think even the mature scenes were not that bad. I enjoyed the plot a lot and even legitamately cried at some parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042100947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1506759220}
review:
Let me preface this by saying that I have a big problem with this game thats soured my entire experience with it. However for the most part I really love it. The couples are a bit hit and miss but they're clealry designed try and tick as many boxes as possible and theres a couple for everyone I think. The game looks and sounds good, though its resolution options (or total lack therof) are a bit annoying and I came across a reoccurring bug where the game wold freeze after about an hour playtime, though I suspect this is more a harware problem and not the real probelm i have with this game.

The problem is that what you want, doesnt matter in this game. This game is about as linear as it gets and any choices you make are at best completely pointless and at worst simply there to give you the illusion you're participating. Now heres the real kicker. The game has a romance involving the player character, which you get to influence in absolulely no way whatsoever. A fact i learned after i made a choice the i thought loigically, would almost certianly cause a different outcome and it having apparenly no effec and never being brought up again.

Honestly finding out that I had no agency in this world was shocking. The game's own presentation and genre had made me think that, of course being able to pick who the protagonist ended up with, that was a given. Instead the game had presented me with a choice that caused me to anticipate that I would get to pick a romance and given me idea who i would get to pick between and I in my enthusiam latched onto it. But I latched onto the wrong character, the one who though i prefered i suddenly wasnt allowed to romance. I was never supposed to romace them but I thought I would be able to and as it seemed more and more like I really wasnt ever going to get to romace the character I had over the course of ten hours set my heart on the more I resented the other character for not being her. 

Now you may be thinking. "That's a bit entitled surely? If the developers want to tell a paticular story they're allowed to." Which I agree with wholeheartedly. But it brings me to my second problem with this aspect of the game, which is that I find this romace to be uncharacterisically uncompelling, In fact I find the inital premise behind the romance slightly offputting being about as close to incest as you can get without it actually being incest and its not like this is a par of the game that can be skipped or skimmed over as its the main storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011015009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1520270793}
review:
It's almost bittersweet that I've reached the end of this so relatively quickly, though that has much more to do with spending the entire week dedicated to finishing through it.

A couple of things to note first off. I think the price-tag is still a bit steep, and I'd highly recommend watching this like a hawk for sales if you're truly interested in experiencing it. The demo will give you about the first 2 hours of story and introduce all of the characters. You can even carry over your save state from the demo since they're all held in simple files.

The other issue I've run into was performance. There's nothing about this VN that should cause stutters or lag, but I found consistently that I'd get about 20 minutes into a session and suddenly text speed would halve and the minimal on-screen movement of sprites would diminish even further than that. This problem might be localized, and it's ultimately a minor gripe, but I figured I'd give the heads up.

That said, I do highly recommend checking this out, especially if you're a fan of romance in any way. There's a lot to get into and there's a surprising amount to digest. The base game covers about 21 hours and the extra content delivers as many or more scenes in a smaller format for 5 hours.

Not a single moment is wasted driving the narrative. There are multiple points of comedy (Ano is an absolute trip), there are chances to cry, and there are points of pure catharsis. This novel is a bit unique in that sex drives the narrative, yet is never solely the focus. It would be unfair to say the erotic scenes don't serve their own purpose in character development, but they are simply moments where everything comes to a head.

I think the thing that impressed me the most in this is how organic the development of the main character is. I won't tell much, but it's very clear from the beginning that Yuna is not living entirely as herself. Her story perhaps more than any of the others is worth being read and appreciated.

Really, the thing that will make you enjoy this game is the sheer realism behind it in spite of its crazy, spirit-driven premise. A wide range of situations reach all of the characters, from the couple that have been in love for years but have had to hide it, to a new, entirely taboo affair between a teacher and student, to a 2 out of 3 couple that overthinks absolutely everything.

If it were any use, I'd write paragraphs on paragraphs about the merits of each individual character, and that's really where the biggest strength of Kindred Spirits on the Roof lies.

In summation, when two ghosts tell you to make girls have sex with each other, you'd best damn listen. Happy hunting, cupid

author: {'steamid': '76561198037449534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4091, 'last_played': 1498938407}

If you are into VNs, it is extremely unlikely for you to dislike this game, as it has almost everything a VN lover wants.
Decent lenght, lovely characters, different perspectives that add depth to the story, slow and realistic growth in the relationships, etc. 
Not a porn game. Dont expect sex every 20 minutes.

If you like VNs, just buy it. I guarantee you wont regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994565624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2580, 'last_played': 1456799997}
review:
I don't think there ever has been or ever will be again this much adorable in one package.

Although the basic premise of the game revolves around sex, the story focuses on friendship and romance and overcoming life's challenges.  The actual sexual content is almost incidental, although I would still recommend for adults only.

While the game is expensive, it is also quite lengthy for a single route with bonus content, between 30 and 40 hours.  Normally I like to read for just a few hours at a time, to let a story marinate and let me immerse in its setting and characters and situations.  Although each scenario is relatively short, there's always something happening or something to look forward to or some reason to read just one more!  After the main route is completed the game opens up bonus scenarios equal to a small fandisk, which is good because no fandisks were made so this is all there is.  I wish there had been more of Hina's "wawawa" moments, but what there is is very good.

The music is suitably cute with a decent variety of tracks.  Early on they got repetitive, and the way they faded out then got loud again when they looped to the beginning was kinda distracting.  Days later though I will sometimes hear them sneak into my consciousness at relevant times.

The characters are central to the experience, and everything about them is spot-on: their basic design, art, poses, expressions, outfits, actions, and voices are all perfectly suited to them.  Sure some of them are a little stereotypical or tropic, but the story at least gives reasons for them to be the way they are.  The characters share moments that are cute, sweet, touching, and occasionally surprisingly hilarious, all while staying in character.  I couldn't help but cheer for all of them.

Two characters deserve special mention:  Hina is the most adorable ever, and Yuna's voice actress nailed it with a sweet-sounding voice I could listen to forever.

When it's all over, you're left with an ending theme by Rita that will keep me nostalgic for a long time to come.

Sachi-san, Megumi, Yuna, every day with you was so much fun.

[spoiler]Yuna, I hope you can meet them again someday.

Sayonara.  Mata ne.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198069074135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1490041918}
review:
Important notice: If you are looking at getting this game for all the hot steamy pics then go somewhere else. Seriously that's what the internet is for so don't waste your money.

I fully expected something like that from this game, just another excuse to ogle at fictional girls. To my surprise it was not like that at all, at least in the time I've played it thus far. No gravity breaking tities, no brain-less bimbos smutting up the place, no (well, almost no) hyper exagerated archtypes. It's almost as if Kindred Spirits wouldn't be a typical anime *gasp*

Joking aside there is an interesting story here to enjoy, unless you don't like visual novels then see the above note, and the characters I feel are well written so that everyone actually becomes a character and not a one note prop to move the story. Best of all this is an actual game with choices. I don't know how the choices affect the later story, but it does give some agency to the audience which I think too many types of these games forget. The story is told different angles so I also didn't feel stuck with the main character through the whole ride. A nice thing also is that I don't think the game makes blanket statements about homosexuality, there are characters who question such pairings, maybe not enough to be more realistic but enough that the audience knows this isn't a completely common thing.

The one problem I have with the game is the voice acting. I am one of those anime fans who prefers anime subbed rather than dubbed which this game is, so if you have a problem with japanese voice acting that is something to note. My problem comes from the voices they chose for some of the characters. Everyone has a VA to them so that's nice, but some of them sound like kids in elementary or middle school. That's my thoughts though.

It's a nice game with a good story and more character than a stereotype anime. If you enjoy these things then this might be up your alley.
Bottom line: Good characters help make a good story, bad characters help it become porn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097433538', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1456718738}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115120642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1558299707}
review: 35 bucks is actually pretty reasonable for the amount of content you're getting in this visual novel. It's at least as long as a season of your typical anime series. It's also very well written. Despite the cast including two ghosts, the story is pretty down-to-earth and it's not as melodramatic as a lot of yuri stories. It also comes closer to the real world of LGBT-land than typical yuri stories; the word "lesbian" (or the Japanese equivalent, anyway) is actually tossed around, some characters worry about coming out of the closet to their families and friends, etc.. If you like visual novels and you like slice-of-life romance stories, Kindred Spirits is about as good as it gets. The only possible dealbreaker I can think of is that there's no male characters--if you suffer withdrawal and lapse into a coma when deprived of boys, then Kindred Spirits isn't for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103572122', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1459010139}
review:
Alright, first of all, fair warning for those who would buy the game because it's the first 18+ uncensored game in Steam, don't buy it. The R18 stuff is not much, with 1-2 CG per pairing with nothing much going on, along with conveniently placed stuff to cover the private part. You can see nipples, but that's about it. So again, don't buy this if you're looking for the R18 content

If you're not just looking for that, then maybe wait for a sale or something. The price is a bit daunting indeed, but for me personally, i did not regret buying at launching discount, at all.

Gameplay:
Nothing much, it's just your usual VN. The kicker here is that everything is already predetermined, so no matter what choice you make, the ending is still the same. The choice however would unlock more extra stuff for you to see after the main game complete, which makes the playtime more than worth it. Unlike usual VN where you go in a straight line, this VN enables you to go parallel, meaning there's one main story, and several side story that you happens at the same time in the timeline. So you'll be playing as several characters, seeing it from their own perspective, which makes the depth of the story really hits home. Of course, this can leads to several moment where some story ended up on some not-so-likeable note and you need to wait for the story to progress to see the continuation. So far it's not a problem to me, but it's definitely not something i'm used to.

Story:
If you're buying this not for the story, then you missed out a hell lot. The story here is well written and nicely paced, and with the unique cast of pairings, well maybe not so unique, but some is, you can't help but like most of the cast. This is not your perfect utopia where everything went smoothly, which means every character have their own conflict to deal with, adding more realism to the story. This game is one of the few games that actually managed to make myself cry, despite being a R18 yuri VN. Overall, i cannot reccomend the story enough. Definitely a must buy if you enjoy School Romance and Yuri genre.

Oh and the supernatural part do comes in and out of the story, but in the end it doesn't really affects the realism.

Graphics:
Your standard VN style CG and sprites. Can't really comment much on this part, but if you like what you see in the screenshots, you won't have any trouble liking the art-style. The R18 CG is pretty well done though, i must admit. Definitely more detailed than the screenshots provided.

Sound:
The VA is great. Every voice fits with the character, and the acting quality is really good. You won't be disappointed with the VA quality. What you might be disappointed with might be with the amount of voiced lines. [b]NOT ALL LINES ARE VOICED[/b]. All the main point of the story is voiced however, so in the end it's not much of a problem. The R18 section is voiced, so yeah.

The soundtrack is nice and all, but there's nothing more to it. It fits the mood well, but i won't go as far as to reccomend it. The OST isn't so bad either, but yeah, just decent. One of the insert song was quite good however, which i would reccomend listening to it.


TL;DR:
You like good storytelling? You like yuri? Buy it, it's worth the money. Don't buy it if you're in it for the R18 stuff.
9/10

P.S. Hina is the best girl in the entire universe

author: {'steamid': '76561198019868216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1467732528}

One of the best yuri VNs available in english.

It's not a short game, so unless you have a free weekend or lots of free time you can expect to spend a few comfy evenings laughing at the antics of japanese lesbians.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078136085', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4129, 'last_played': 1671572292}
review:
[spoiler][h1]IT IS NOT A HENTAI.[/h1][/spoiler]

First off: should you buy the game?
You should definitely play the trial version, and then you will truely understand which direction this VN goes.
Honestly, I have to agree with some people; it's a very niche genre - perhaps never will see another game like this.
Liar Soft, please give us a sequel.

It's a great game overall, with minor setbacks:
Decent Story: Story overall keeps me reading. Some side stories, that I felt, could have been elaborated a little more. 

Decent soundtrack: After going through the story, I'm hoping they make the soundtrack easy for puchase on Steam.

Decent artwork: The creators did a great job on making the scenes feel natural, and the characters are what I like to describe as modern - this VN could probably become an anime/OVA of some sort, and not like some old ecchi from the early 2000s.
[spoiler]They also did a decent job of making the characters look great in the softcore scenes, if you catch my drift (lol). [/spoiler]

Decent performance - When the game is running, but you swtich windows, the game may slow down, and you will see text slow down as it rolls across the screen. The game has worked fine for me, and I don't often see this issue. though other readers may say otherwise.




In short,
Yuri conquers all.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198055526778', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1570406348}
review:
Yuritopia!
But really, this game is great.
Yuritopia- I mean, Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a mainly kinetic visual novel (meaning that choices, if any, have almost no effect on the outcome of the story) in which Toomi Yuna, a 2nd year highschooler encounters a ghostly couple on the roof of her school. She quickly becomes their (slightly unwilling) accomplise in bringing other girls in her school together.
In order of best to worst from my experience:
Art: 10/10
I havent seen a game of any kind in so long where the artist actually took the effort to make different costumes and colors for a whole variety of situations. In particular, I love the style <3. It really helps to bring to mind the feeling of a girl in love.
Music: 9/10
The track isn't very large, but what is there is well made and pleasant to listen to without being too overwhelming or distracting. Only problem I really had was that the tracks didn't loop at all.
Story: 8/10
The premise of the plot is actually...kind of orginal? It definitely wasn't something I'd seen before. Of course, in execution, the story became a little more mundane, but it was still enticing to read from beginning to end, and I loved the ending.
Characters 7/10
Most of the characters are well developed, but they tend towards fairly typical archetypes common in japanese culture, so if you're used to that, you might get bored of their antics quickly.

As for stuff that can't easily be graded:
+ Game length: for me, I cleared the main story in about 20 hours, but there's more for you to do afterwards, and I estimate about atleast another 5-8 hours of gameplay is left. Not bad at all.
- UI: While the UI is not cluttered, It is instead compact and fairly complicated for a VN, including far more visual buttons than is common. On that note, the options is fairly cluttered, even if everything is labeled.

All in all, I think the game is almost worth its full price, which is not something I'd say about most VN's, especially on steam. Even at 10% off, I think this game is worth buying.

TL;DR : 11/10 would yuritopia again

author: {'steamid': '76561198078424269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1502847510}
review:
Mm. It's good. The most adorable thing I've ever seen. Warm, fuzzy feelings consumed most of my free time for a week.

The Drama CDs are good extras for after the game, and I'm waiting for the manga to come out. I'll also probably get the Deluxe Edition of the game because I feel it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029403470', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2649, 'last_played': 1456231999}
review:
[옥상위의 유리영들] 입니다.
뭐 이 바닥(?)은 그 꽃잎에 입맞춤을 시리즈가 꽉 잡고 있긴 합니다만, 게임 특성(?)상 스팀에 들어오기는 힘들죠. 리사미야의 외전이 하나 스팀에 들어와 있긴 하지만 거의 의미없는 수준이고...
그런 아쉬움을 달래줄 농도 진한 백합게임이 드디어 스팀에 진출했네요.

"자신들이 유령이 아니라 유리영이라고 주장하는 골때리는 유령들을 만난 주인공은, 이들이 레즈커플들의 섹스신을 염탐하는 것을 도와주게 되었습니다."
이렇듯 게임 플롯은 섹스신 염탐인데 정작 그 섹스신이 앙꼬없는 찐빵같은 맛이라는게 함정.
물론 섹스신이 앙꼬들어간 찐빵이었으면 스팀에 들어오지도 못했겠지만요. 



스토리 9/10
본편-사이드스토리-후일담의 구조로서 충실한 텍스트 어드벤처 플롯을 보이고 있습니다. 덕분에 플레이타임은 상당히 긴 편입니다. 보이스 구간을 스킵하지 않으며 진행하면 엔딩까지 30~40시간정도 걸리고, 후일담까지 하면 대략 50시간정도 걸리겠군요. 다만 그 보이스가 풀보이스가 아니라는 아쉬움이 있습니다. 주요 이벤트만 보이스가 나와요.
이벤트 진척도나 개방율이 표시가 안돼서 100% 달성을 했는지를 확인하는게 힘들군요. 분기점 시스템마저 있어서 선택에 따라 스토리 개방도 달라지고... 다만 스토리 개방이 어렵진 않아서 이 게임에 적용된 시스템은 신선하다고 봅니다.
플로우차트가 일직선이 아니라는 점도 괜찮게 평가합니다. 다만 플래너에서 클릭하기 전까지는 그 스토리가 누구의 스토리인지 알 수가 없다는게 단점이군요. 단순히 본편(인형)-사이드스토리(체리)-후일담(사과) 의 아이콘으로만 표시하기보다, 각 캐릭터에 맞는 컬러링을 부여해서 좀 더 보기쉽게 해주면 좋았을 것 같군요.

게임 시스템 6/10
게임편의성은 상당히 높습니다만, 플로우차트... 여기서는 Planer라고 나오는 화면에서 세이브로드가 나타나지 않는 것이 단점. 
직접 스토리를 눌러서 진행하기 전까지는 어디에서 분기점이 나오는지 알 수가 없다는 것도 단점.
게임 시스템적으로 플래시 기반 게임이라 랙이 쩝니다. 일본게임들이 근본적으로 피시게임을 잘 못만드는 경향이 있긴 합니다만, 그래도 텍스트어드벤처 전용엔진이나 렌파이 정도면 봐줄만 하게 만드는 편인데 이건 플래시기반이라 얄짤없이 랙겜이군요.
영어 번역 상태는... 음... 좋게말해줘도 좋다고 볼 수는 없습니다. 일본어를 어느정도 아는 영어플레이어를 대상으로 번역한 모양인지, 일본어에 익숙하지 않고 영어만 되는 사람들은 재미가 반감될 것 같습니다. 게임 제목부터가 우리나라만 돼도 유령-유리영의 말장난이 가능한데 영어로는 이 말장난을 할 수가 없으니 원래의 의미가 살아나질 않고 있고.

음악 7/10
게임 음악은 상당히 좋습니다. 게임 분위기를 잘 띄워주는 좋은 곡들입니다. 하지만 그 수가 좀 단점이네요. 이 '음악의 수'은 다른 텍스트어드벤처와 비교해서 평가했습니다. 게임 자체가 음악을 적게 가지고 있는건 아닙니다. 갤러리 상에서 15개의 숫자면 적은건 아니라고 볼 수는 있습니다.(히든트랙이 있어서 실제로는 16개입니다.) 그렇다고 많은것도 아니고, 그나마도 두개는 보컬/논보컬 버전.
화자가 변경될때마다 뜨는 아이캣치의 음악이 뜬금없습니다. 아이캣치는 차라리 무음으로 했으면 좋았을듯.

기타 7/10
갤러리가 스토리 바로 옆에 붙어나와서 상당히 직관적입니다. 대부분 갤러리메뉴가 따로 있어서 게임을 하고나서 보면 이 씬이 어디서 나온거드라? 하고 어리둥절 하게 되는 경우가 많은데, 이 게임은 갤러리가 바로 스토리 옆에 붙어있어서 그 경향이 덜합니다. 다만, 그로인해 갤러리 페이지가 쓸데없이 많아졌다는 단점은 있군요.
갤러리가 단순히 CG갤러리인 것도 약간은 단점... 입니다만 플래시 기반 겜이라 이벤트 갤러리로 했으면 랙 장난 아니긴 했을듯 ;;

총평 (9+6+7+7 / 4) = 7.5 / 10
만약 소프트한 백합게임을 좋아하는 분이라면 8~9점까지도 줄 만한 게임입니다. 그리고 이 말은 에로스적 레즈게임을 좋아하는 분이라면 6~7점 선이라는 말이겠지요.
애초에 게임 플롯부터가 섹스씬을 보자는게 주 목적인 게임에서 섹스씬이 심심하니 말 다했다고 보긴 합니다만 ;;

커플이 
1. 1학년 신입생 - 3학년 상급생
2. 2학년 동갑내기
3. 3학년 동갑내기
4. 문제아 - 선도위원
5. 나이차이 나는 소꿉친구
이렇게 구성되어있습니다. 의외로 친척간(혹은 가족간) 커플이 없군요. 일본 백합의 정석이나 마찬가지인 친인척 커플이 없는건 좀 의아합니다만, 덕분에 스팀에 들어올 수 있지 않았나 합니다. 뭐, 그 비슷한게 5번커플이긴 합니다만...

상당히 잠재력을 가진 게임이라고 생각됩니다. 시리즈화 된다면 말이죠.
시리즈화 된다면 차후엔 플래시가 아니라 텍스트 어드벤처 전용 엔진으로 제작됐으면 좋겠네요.
무엇보다, 플래시면 랙은 둘째치고 한글패치 만들기가 어렵잖아!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165768782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2952, 'last_played': 1642938251}
review:
This game is great. 
This game would like to go with the "but we're both girls" over and over again, but many characters have a really realistic reactions to their romances. Some worry about themself being gay, while others doesnt even care about that untill another character brought up the problem. Before playing the game I had a set mindset of which characters/ couples that I would like over the other, where to my surprise some of the couples really surprised me on how much I love them and while others i could care less for, others really met up to my expectations and went even beyond that. (namly kiri and tsukuyo)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052503676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1512843338}
review:
The whole time I was playing this game, I was thinking of snarky little pros and cons I'd put in this review. But all of that was out the window by the time I finished. If you have a romantic bone in your body and a soft spot for yuri, *get this game*.

I thought I was just getting a simple, pervy little lesbian dating sim to tickle my less mature side. I hadn't played many naughty games that pretended to humor my more innocent, romantic side at the same time, so I didn't stop to even think about how much I was spending ($30) on something I expected to provide just a few cheap thrills. But I did not expect the feelz!!  I finished the game (really more of a story than a game) in the middle of the night last night, and I am still reeling from the melody it played on my heart-strings!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025759870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1533427161}
review:
You may have heard of this as the first uncensored game on Steam, and are probably imagining the most lewd and steamy premise you can considering it got that kind of coverage, and the synopsis is in fact that two lesbian schoolgirl ghosts want to see how to have sex for the first time so they can do so themselves.

While this is an eroge, like most those types of scenes are at the end of the game, and are overwhelmed by the vast majority of content that goes into telling the story of each couple growing together. Add in some great slice-of-life moments that make you laugh, smile, and empathize. It's that type of game. I think I could recommend it to just about anyone who enjoys sweet slice-of-life stories, manga, etc.

For me, this is one of the very few Yuri Visual Novels, and was a must-buy from what I heard. And I have no regrets- it is definitely worth the price-tag as well. Most will scoff at it, but this is very long for a Visual Novel- you have the main story scenes, the side-story scenes(marked by cherries on the planner), and then you also get access to post-main-story scenes which are represented by apples in the planner and are unlocked by making different choices in the main story. I did not expect to get character interaction between certain characters(namely those outside couples), but the apple extra stories have become some of my favorites since those characters that may have not gotten much love in the main and side stories shine here. This Visual Novel is huge, simply put. In terms of time, I have put in roughly 27 hours so far and have not finished all the extra scenes yet.

The bottom line- if you like Visual Novels at all, this is pretty much a must-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057446319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2947, 'last_played': 1456072557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078329875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1456244973}
review:
I bought Yurirei for the #yuritopia, but, surprisingly, that no longer feels adequate. No......not at all.

Granted, #yuritopia is definitely an apt, one-word description for this VN, but....well....it's too substantial. Of course, Liar-soft knows their target audience quite well, so it is ultimately, uh, quite scandalous. So, it is obviously not nearly as philosophical as Utena or as strict as Hourou Musuko or as dramatic as Maria-sama. It's not that deep. But, it's not as fluffy as Yuruyuri or Love Live either. If I had to place it, I suppose it's spiritually not far off from Aoi Hana or maybe, Sasameki Koto? 

I think Yurirei is smarter than both of those though.

To begin with, Yuna is neither ditzy nor particularly shy. Her mature, reliable personality is the freshest possible gasp of autumn air as a female protagonist. Her quiet confidence is intoxicating, her mannerisms are delightful, and I identify with the way she thinks immensely. She does have some of the cold and withdrawn characteristics that I see more often in male protagonists, such as the famous Tomoya Okazaki, but she is about twice as caring, 10 times smarter, and 100 times as responsible as that guy. Hina is also amazing, even more so as seen through Yuna's eyes. Her blunt cuteness is not some ____dere gimmick, but the main pillar of her personality, and she is, in many ways, just as responsible and intelligent as Yuna herself. 

In fact, in general, these writers seem to revel in introducing certain tropes, then annihilating them. In a low quality story, Aki would really just be an uptight prude that gets "broken in" by Youka. Then, their relationship would have no meaning beyond 'opposites attract.' Seina would just be a shy freshman. Tsukuyo would really be an incompetent teacher. Nena would just be a dumb girl that falls asleep all the time. In most stories of this type, I tend to think to myself, "How are these people so thick and clueless?" In Yurirei, I am just as likely to think, "Oh, I didn't realize she'd already thought about it that much." or "Whoa, that was quite perceptive."  

Ah, I fear I may have already spoiled too much. For maximum enjoyment, please go in blind now. 

*ahem*

The focus is on characterization, not panties; this is a story of romance, not sex: the uncertain confession, the embarassed atmosphere, the soft touch on the arm, tension, suspense, and ectasy. Their relationships develop in a way that feels natural, despite the manipulation by Yuna and our resident ghosts. Couples respect each others' boundaries, and they care deeply for each other. They plan their future together. They talk about how their parents or society might perceive them. Unnecessary fanservice is minimal, and even when kinky stuff finally starts happening, the art doesn't zoom in on their boobs, but does a great job of showing their expressions and body language; it is all rather sensual, and, imo, in very very good taste. 

Hence, in case you haven't figured it out yet, if you're buying this just to, uh, yuri your yuri, you're probably going to be extremely disappointed. 

However, if you're a true yuri lover like me (hehe), you will fall in love with this......as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012037547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1456095292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116493602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1588947782}
review:
This has been the second Yuri game I've ever had the pleasure of expeirencing so far, and as I am newbie to visual novels, I can't say much except that I am very impressed.
The storyline is developed slowly and logically; you can see the characters forming bonds over time very clearly. The characters themselves are very likable and the effort that went into creating them is immense. I enjoyed every second I poured into this game.

For those who are looking for choice-based games, I'm afraid this one won't really serve your needs. There is ultimately only one ending and the choices, however rare as it is, does not influence any of the relationships' outcomes nor the ending itself. However, making the correct combinations of choices will unlock 'extra scenes' after you complete the main story, giving an insight to the characters in short snippets of background events. 

10/10 - Highly recommended for anyone who likes Yuri or just want to have a good read in romance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009005963', 'num_games_owned': 3852, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1909, 'last_played': 1607017745}
review: Ciepła i pełna uroku opowieść, w której nawet jeśli przeczuwasz wiele wydarzeń, to i tak usmiechasz się po ich wystąpieniu. Do tego świetne dialogi, galeria nietuzinkowych postaci (w każdej jest coś do odkrycia, każdą prędzej czy później polubiłem) i sliczna - wyrózniająca się na tle innych dostępnych na Steamie przedstawicieli gatunku - kreska.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161971729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1493805961}
review:
This isn't a review, but more of a... how I feel about the game.

In my time I have played A LOT of visual novels... and I mean a lot. Most of them Hentai games (they're not ALL smut...) but certainly the more... "romantic" and interesting ones and, by far, this game is probably the best visual novel game I have ever played and it is barely even ero!

The first hour I found myself not fully invested into the plot, but boy, was I glad I stuck along for the ride. I have never been so invested in a goddamn game involving yuri-couples to the point I have experienced a range of emotions that had me shedding tears, fist pumping the air in an over-dramatic and joyous fashion and demanding for more! I don't think I've ever felt this emotional since the times I watched Maria-Sama Ga Miteru or Strawberry Panic way back when.

10/10 - for yuritopia.
10/10 - for fucking with my emotions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092697663', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1468643143}
review: It's a great visual novel with good artwork and a fantastic story. Perfect for any yuri fans or anyone who wants to see a good love story. The length of the game depends on how fast you can read, but I'd say it took me about thirty hours to go through the story and another 4 or 5 for the bonus scenes. All voice acting is in Japanese, and it only occurs in important scenes. The only bug with the game is that it doesn't mesh well with steam, so you can't open the steam overlay or take screenshots, and if you're playing the game through steam, it will sometimes freeze after 15 minutes. That can be avoided though by just running the program itself instead of playing it through steam. Fantastic visual novel that I will continue to distract me from any homework.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030941804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1456002888}
review:
If you like yuri or VN you may want to support this game for the future of the genre.

First of all, I have played the Japanese version a few years back. The game is fantastic. Probably one of the best takes in VN form on the yuri genre. It's light hearted, often funny and very touching towards the end, "healing", and characters are very cute. The things you may criticize in this game are mostly attributable to the development budget. That said, I can't comment on the translation. I assume it will be fine enough. The original text is plain and simple and I assume it remains as readable translated.

Liar soft is one of the VN companies with a more indie feel. It makes very unique and fun games, though not necessarily with the highest production value. You can say it occupies a niche spot in an already niche market.

Often times this is reflected in the fact that there is limited voice acting. That just means mostly the writer was more ambitious than the budget allowed in terms of full voice acting. I would also point out that although the consensus is fully voiced acted VNs are the way to go, partial voice acting allows writing of longer monologues, which some may enjoy. 

Now I was really surprised this game got released on Steam uncensored. The price is high but it's what you would expect for a limited audience release. If you buy this game it may encourage them to make bigger budget works with western release in schedule. When the volume is higher obviously that allows for different pricing schemes. 

Finally let me reiterate that the game is fantastic, espcially if you are a genre lover of yuri--it's not to be missed. If you can't get it now, wish list it and check it out later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971001967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1455586425}

Not so much an interactive novel as a...novel. I was expecting something in the vein of Winter Wolves games or similar, this is just a story progressed by clicking when you're done reading to move on to the next part...

And the story has the same level of predictability as a 70's porno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045944938', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1552920034}
review:
学園百合ADV
邦題「屋上の百合霊さん」
自分のプロフページに日本語化置きました

[h1]ストーリー[/h1]
商科九ツ星女子学園の2年生である遠見結奈は屋上で2人の幽霊に出会った
自らを百合霊と名乗る2人は、あと一歩のところで秘めた思いを伝えらずにいる女の子たちの後押しを結奈に願い出る
最初は仕方なく恋の手伝いをする結奈だったが、カップル達との交流を経て自らの持つ恋心に気づいていく

[h1]キャラクター[/h1]
遠見結奈(2年)
本作の主人公。
過去のトラウマから人付き合いを避けていが、百合霊達との出会いにより陰っていた日常が変化していく。

狛野比奈(1年)
結奈の幼馴染。妹のような存在

阿野藤(2年)
重度のオタクで結奈の数少ない友人。交友関係が広い

榎木サチ(幽霊)&永谷恵(幽霊)
学園の屋上にすむ幽霊カップル。
魂だけの存在のため、体を重ねられないことが心残りとなり成仏できずにいる
"少しの後押しがあればカップルになれた"そんな女の子たちを多く見てきた歯がゆい思いから、結奈にカップル成立の手伝いを求める

牧聖苗(1年)&相原美紀(3年)
相原先輩の優しさに触れて一目ぼれした牧ちゃん
積極的に愛を伝える牧ちゃんに対して、奥手な先輩はその気持ちを受け止めきれずにいた。

一木羽美(2年)&双野沙紗(2年)&三山音七(2年)
放送部の3人は大親友。
しかし、その中の誰かがもう一人に対して親友を超えた感情を抱いてしまう。
"思いを伝えれば友情が壊れるかもしれない"そんな考えから気持ちを閉じ込めていた。

剣峰桐(2年)&園生月代(教師)
かわいいモノ好きな桐は、教師とは思えないほど見た目の幼い月代に恋をした
だが月代は過去の出来事から"思春期特有の一時の感情"と桐を論する。

古場陽香(2年)&有遊愛来(2年)
遅刻常習者でロック愛好家の陽香は風紀委員の愛来に一目ぼれをする。
そんな陽香は学園祭のステージで告白を目論むが、難題に見舞われることになる。

網島茉莉(3年)&稲本美夕(3年)
ただの倦怠期

[h1]システム[/h1]
・プレイ時間はおよそ20時間
・ルート分岐なし
・選択肢あり、本編終了後のイベント出現条件になっている(後から回収可能)
・CGは差分抜きで68枚
・字幕は英語のみでボイスは日本語(字幕の日本語化は自分のプロフページから)
・イベントシーンだけ声の出るパートボイス方式
・オリジナルの18禁verのままsteamで販売されている(当然Hシーン有で乳首が見えてる)

[h1]その他[/h1]
少女たちの恋をしてから結ばれるまでのプラトニックな恋愛を描く作品。
成人向けだがそれ特有の生臭さはなく、あっさりとした表現をしているためsteamでそのまま発売可能だったことも納得できる
ストーリーはキャラクター毎に視点変更しながら進み、それによって主人公の行動の裏で起きたことや、その時の心情がわかるようになっている
BGMは悪くない印象
最後に、百合霊さんは自分がプレイしてきた多くの百合ゲーの中でも群を抜いて好きな作品
クリアまで長くかかるが、少しでもこの淡い恋を体験してほしい。
さささん可愛い

author: {'steamid': '76561197988569311', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1508815096}
review:
Im not the greatest fan of visual novel as either the story doesn't pick up my interest or the pacing is all wrong. With Kindred Spirits on the Roof i was sucked up into the story from the very start. There was some uninteresting characters, but also very interesting ones. Especially the main character's story felt really lovely and it was written well. 

Went in, expecting yuri and slapstick humour.
Got laughs, feels and tears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027504158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1597624249}
review:
So steam finally approved an "eroge" game on steam...what a time to be alive!
Kindred Spirits on the Roof is a yuri VN that focuses on a teenage girl named Yuna, who is asked to act as a cupid around school and help girls to form romantic relationships with other girls, all with the help of 2 spirits who's sole purpose is to learn how to make love. 
With the lack of good yuri VNs, this is a must to everyone who is into this kind of genre, and I hope this will show companies that there is an audiance for such content .

author: {'steamid': '76561198025649381', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2900, 'last_played': 1455888758}
review:
A fair number of romances, neither too long nor too short and very well written. The stories intervine perfectly and the characters interact naturally with each other. One is able look into each character's head and maybe that's why they are all very likeable, everyone has their own reasonable concerns and worries. In terms of writing and length this may very well be the best visual novel I have read so far in a genre I am quite fond of but end up being disappointed very often.

Sadly the audiovisuals are not on par with the writing and those which other VNs present, I don't mind the mild and pure depiction of what made it unsuitable for all-ages, it's quite fitting actually and just shortly going back to the writing: Those scenes are actually quite meaningful unlike in some many other works.

It's obvious why the audio could be better, way better, while the Voice Actresses are all very good as one might expect, the times there is actually voice acting is very limited.

About the visuals, while not bad at all, it'S just that in comparison the drawing appears crude and the number of sprites is low. I can't really argue about the prior but still I personally prefer it smoother.

Woth mentioning and up to each self to decide is whether they really want a story with real choices and different endings because the choices here are swallow and there is only one ending for all. I really do not mind at all though obviusly it would had been an interesting read if it was possible to end up with other character.

Certainly there is also the point regarding the price but that's again not up to me to decide, all I can is inform you about the fact that I took like 20... or maybe even 30? hours reading it (and like 20h idling, napping or doing something else while Steam was counting an alt-tab'd game) so it seems like a fair value proposition to me at least, as long as it is enjoyable that is and indeed this was the case for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136085375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1464406906}
review:
A pros/cons rundown and some thoughts, for those thinking of buying the game! Sorry it's a little long,,

Pros:
- Very very cute art! A good variety of sprites, expressions, and CGs.
- Catchy and effective OST, with an included “music room” to listen to all the tracks.
- Each character is distinct, has their own background, thoughts, motives, goals, personality, and problems/flaws that are all very relatable, or easy to sympathize with.
- The couples’ stories were all really compelling, and each and every one felt like it had something to offer.
- Some common yuri tropes are addressed and consulted, exposed for their flaws, or given a very human, realistic spin to them.
- While it was nothing mind-blowing, the story was always engaging in some way, and EXTREMELY emotionally investing. I cannot stress enough how invested this game gets you into its interesting and compelling cast of characters, and all their relationships with each other, romantic or otherwise. I cried and burst out laughing and smiled and was on the edge of my seat and relieved and every other emotional a game could make you feel. (well, except for afraid maybe, haha)
- SO. MUCH. EXTRA. CONTENT. AFTER THE MAIN STORY. Hours worth of extra scenes are unlocked based on what choices you pick in the game, so make sure to save at every choice so you can easily unlock them all!
- The sex scenes were all incredibly tender and sweet, with beautiful art in CGs, and none of them felt gross or overly fanservice-y. (though the lack of Super Explicit Content might be a negative for some people)

Cons/stuff to keep in mind:
- Not all the scenes have voice acting. Only major story events, couple events, and scenes that have CGs include voice acting.
- I’m not a fan of a good handful of the voices. Too many of them are shrill and high-pitched, which can be pretty annoying, especially with the characters who are also loud and cheerful on top of that. (I recently found out this might because a LOT of the voice actors are reused for multiple characters)
- Almost ALL the characters have obnoxiously high-pitched and squeaky voice acting during sex scenes.Doesn't ruin it, but it IS off-putting for me.
- The background music doesn't loop; it fades out and then restarts, which can break immersion for some people.
- No agency, and therefore no routes. The main character, Yuna, is entirely her own character, with her own goals and wishes and feelings. So, you can’t change the outcome of situations or the story. YOU the player don’t really have a say, and are only along for the ride. I know that tons of people will be disappointed to know that there are no routes and no agency on their part.
- There’s a couple that’s a teacher and a student. Their relationship lacks the manipulation and toxic power-imbalance that plagues teacher-student sort of relationships, and so I personally was able to find enjoyment in their story, but I know that others might not, so I’m putting this out there now. (note: it is possible to speed through their scenes and arc by selecting the "Skip unread text" option in the options menu and then using the skip button)
- Unlocking all the extras can be kind of confusing. Not too hard, but a bit of a pain
- Some of the sex scenes felt out of nowhere, or like they weren't properly lead up to
- The sex scenes are also WAY TOO SHORT. Could've used some more detail in the text and, like… fumbling and exploring and learning.
- Some of the dialogue in the sex scenes was so over-the-top or weirdly put that it was unintentionally funny
- And finally, there's a glitch that me and a friend of mine have, though I haven't heard of anyone else dealing with this yet. About every 15-20 minutes, the game will dramatically slow down and stop progressing, and nothing but closing will fix it. I found a way to slowly save the game and then close from the menu, but it's a bit irritating to pull off. Didn't bother me too bad, but I know it'd be a huge pain for some people. Hopefully this glitch is extremely uncommon.

And finally, some tips:

- SAVE AT EVERY CHOICE. You will need to go back to them to unlock all the extras, and they are WORTH IT.
- NEVER. FORCE CLOSE. THE. GAME. EVER. It'll insist that you haven't completed scenes that you have, and make you redo them just to move on in the story, every time you force close. Always close from the menu.
- If you live with other people, wear headphones. Trust me.

Final thoughts? This game was an absolutely joy to play, especially for its great cast of characters and compelling stories. Absolutely worth the price and more, for me, and I hope others will enjoy the game as much as I did! 

If you want a more indepth version of this overview though (plus some extra tips), I posted one here: http://systemrestart.tumblr.com/post/139577888536/with-less-than-a-day-until-the-initial-sale-for

author: {'steamid': '76561197983849480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1551820900}
review:
If you're a fan of yuri in any media, Kindred Spirits is definitely a must play. The game clocks in at around 30 hours or so counting the extra scenes and is well worth the money at full price.

The story is very sweet and the relationships very well developed, especially after the extra scenes. I ended up reading most of it in 3 sittings because I got so into it.

Also theres a ~2 hour demo available on the MangaGamer website that introduces most of the characters, so if you're on the fence consider checking that out first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005854427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2121, 'last_played': 1496764225}
review:
This will be my first review so bear with me and to avoid spoilers I will mention no names or events from in game.

All in all, this game has been so much fun (I'd have preferred an all ages version instead but hey whatever, beggars cant be choosers).

Before I start with the good though I thought it might be easier to list the problems with it, because sadly its not perfect.
1. The Voice Acting (VA) - For the most part the casting was spot on, the majority of characters fit well with their VA's however there were at least two cases were the VA's were horribly miss cast. They absolutely don't fit their respective characters. One especially more glaring than the other, and if you've watched as many anime and played as many VN as I have this can be  quite a major sore point.

2. R+18 bits - Considering the premise it had to be done, otherwise the kindred spirits (or yuri-re as they want to be called) wouldn't be able to pass on. That said I believe that the game has massive potential to be a all ages love story that transcends gender boundaries. Simple and sweet. So I genuinely believe its R+18 portions actually hold it back.

And with that over lets move on to the pros.

Story - It's simple, it really is, there is no great drama, no dark mystery, no epic adventure, no grand revenge quest, nothing of that sort. But it works well for pieces like this. As an avid player of visual novels (VN) I've seen quite a myriad genres so, sometimes a nice fun and simple story like this is really just the best. 9/10

Art - As with the story its fairly simple but well drawn, the art is crisp and nice, the character design was well thought out, each character having their own distincts faces and quirks. It's nothing impressive but theres nothing to complain about either. 8/10

Music/BGM - Same with the story it is failry simple, however they fit the mood of each respective story arc really well. Nothing on the level of Two Steps from Hell but then again this isn't that type of game. 8/10

Characters - Easily the best part of the game, I love the characters, ALL of THEM, they've all got their own personalities and quirks as well as distinct visual differences. Can't say much about them without bringing in spoilers but the attention to detail to each one is very pleasing espeically since they have a large cast of characters. And the character design is also well done, each individual is distinct from the other. This is actually impressive as even some highly praised VN's out there fall victim to their characters essentially being hair or skin color swapped versions of each other. 10/10

Gameplay - The format this VN uses is actually quite uniqe and refreshing and it also gets rid of the annoying repetitve nature of most other VN's when your chasing diffrent character arcs. It however means that replayability will sadly be non-existent save for reminesence. So it remains to be seen wether this is a good or bad idea. 8/10

Enjoyment - I love Yuri VN's and its a damn shame more aren't in the english market. This was a nice change of pace however so it comes highly recomended. 10/10

Overall - The Pros heavily , HEAVILY, outwiegh the cons so... 8.83/10

TL;DR: I highly recommend this game to anyone who isn't averse to the genre (VN's or Yuri). And to those who are you, may want to try it anyway, they do have moments where it makes you think twice about the issues whichare often associated with same sex relationships.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199684694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1457461195}
review:
If you're a true fan of the yuri genre, stop wasting time reading this review. Just go and get this game [b]now[/b]!

If you're just curious and think that the price is too high(it isn't, the price is very average for a standard medium-long VN, but people who don't usually buy them are still not used to this), then wait until the price drops a little and get it ASAP.

Why am I saying this? Because the story and the characters are all very endearing, and it doesn't feel like you're reading something boring and dull, mostly thanks to characters that aren't your average cookie cutter archetypes, and this also reflects on their relationships. 
Reading it all the way to the end(don't skip the extra scenes!) will finally make you exclaim "yes, now [i]this[/i] was a good yuri VN!"

[i]About the sex scenes:[/i] they're few and they're all very tame(also no genitalia, only breasts and nipples are shown in CGs), so don't go in expecting to watch the lesbian kamasutra or anything. My heartboner was still very satisfied, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042947374', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1547222808}
review:
音效确实不算好，bgm比较少部分场景硬塞不太适合的bgm感觉上也有点违和。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971734476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1455534734}
review:
Thr only reason im not recomending this title is becuase I dont think its worth the price tag of 35$. Though I do have alot of issues with the game. This game is far from bad.

Pros;
-The game has a very nice art style good voice acting.
-The game does have a good story to tell as well.
-Soundtrack is nice but gets annoying after awhile

Cons
-There is only one ending to this game.
-The very few choices you make only unlock extra dialoge after you beat the game.
-It is only partial voice acting
-Genrous amount of save slots when only one is reqruied
-For all the 18+ uncensord and uncut hype this game got it is extremly mild.
-Very little variety in terms of art.( 90% of the art assets are the same cut outs of a characters placed in front of a few differnt backrounds.

Overall if you like a good story about about lesbian highschool girls then this game is for you.  For those looking for a move foraward in uncencered and uncut content on steam, this games is not it.( The  short sex scenes in Wolfinstien New Order are more graphic than this).

author: {'steamid': '76561198014983834', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1456042277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198282876842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1456500795}
review:
首先这是百合游戏。
我galgame玩过一些，但是百合作品除了这个只玩过花吻系列。
这个游戏号称是18禁无删减登录steam，但是其实其中的那些画面属于比较唯美的那种，裸露的不多，足以让人血脉喷张但是xx不起来，实用性不高，真要xx不如去e绅士或者玩花吻系列，虽然我个人不太喜欢花吻那种没事来一发的感觉。
游戏剧情很清水，沉重的压抑的内容比较少，有一种淡淡的感觉，蛮有生活感，跟游戏软软的立绘画风以及调皮欢快的BGM很搭。是一款非常棒的轻松向百合galgame。
日呆百合控10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198169169714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2817, 'last_played': 1463832220}
review:
This game is an amazing work. Not only is it a beautiful piece of romance (or pieces of romance) but it is also a stimulating one at that.

You get roped in to help two yuri ghosts and become some sort of yuri love cupid. From her point of view, experience giving couples a push to get together THEN later on, experience it from the couple's point of view too. This game deals with all sort of questions or problems that may came up from having a relationship of the same sex. Would your friends mind? Is your family going to agree? Does your target of affection have the same feelings as you and much more. 

"May I kiss you again? But this time I might put my tongue in and may not be able to stop." -10/10

review: Finally! Yuri that isn't mindless fluff or melodrama! Even if the premise is a bit ridiculous, Kindred Spirits is suprisingly down to earth with it's treatment of the various relationships. The main complaint I have is the small soundtrack, and if you binge read like I do, it can get a bit repetetive. Still a very solid VN though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203925485', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1457858046}
review:
以前我曾今在网上找到并下载过这款游戏，，这也算是我人生第一款GAL吧，看到steam出了以后直接买下，也算弥补一下当年没有支持正版的事情吧。
       言归正传，这款游戏画面清新，相对于其他大多数同类游戏来说，我比较中意这款游戏清新的画风。剧情方面也扣人心弦，多对CP层层推进，基本上只要是能想到的各种类型的CP都能找到。最后的H部分也很自然，不会让人感到有不舒服或者是有什么奇怪的感觉，玩的时候总感觉这是一对恋人感情深入以后很正常的事情，也算中规中矩。（PS：steam版的应该是无码，嗯……）音乐方面，虽然几首BGM都有各自不同的风格，但总体来说清新的风格还是很令人喜欢的。
      特别值得一提的是这款游戏的模式设定成了日记或者说按时间排列的方式，把一整段剧情以一个个小故事的形式排列在一起，这是和大多数同类游戏不同的地方。当然还有一个地方也值得一说，那就是这款游戏的选择项并不会影响游戏的结局，游戏的结局是固定的。选择项只会影响最后100%通关的CG收集，多的 就不说了，以免剧透。
       总体来说，是一款风格清新的百合向GALGAME ，好评10/10，喜欢这类游戏的朋友千万不要错过。
       主角组赛高！！阿野X结奈是邪教！！！（不要打我0.0）

author: {'steamid': '76561197998344663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3334, 'last_played': 1548202996}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084275598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1908, 'last_played': 1455681987}
review:
Почти 32 часа на полное прохождение. Чистого "геймплея", конечно,  без экстра сценариев и оставлений игры включённой пока отходишь делать кофе 25-30 часов всё же найдётся.

Что ж, не так часто мне хочется написать компликейтед обзор на штуки, но я постараюсь это сделать.

Kindred Spirits on the Roof - неплохая новеллка с простеньким сюжетом, интересной манерой повествования и годной главной героиней.
Пускай где-то и навели шуму про 18+ анкат и прочее - тут это не играет особой роли, разве что придаёт момент завершённости каждой паре.

Читается интересно, ибо с местной манерой повествование наблюдение за событиями приобретает немного больший смысл, чем просто "слежка". Сюжет, правда, чисто линейный и местный выбор лишь меняет пару диалогов да бывает открывает экстра сценарий по прохождению игры, однако каждый сюжетный день всегда можно переиграть и выбрать другой вариант ответа.

Если вы очень в вещи аля девичья любовь и прочие штуки - стоит взять. Тут в этом плане всё жутко милотно и отлично подано.
Если вам просто хочется почитать более-менее интересноты ради убить время - тоже можно взять.

Шутки про гомофобов в сторону.

Лично мне не понравилось лишь типичные анимешные оверхайпнутые стоны в время постельных сцен, ну да это типично. Сами сцены весьма забавны и проходят аля "первый опыт" или "я нифига не понимаю, что я делаю, но я делаю".
Также незалупленая музыка. Даа, это немного раздражает. И каждая мелодия вместо того, чтобы крутиться на заднике когда надо, затихает, а потом начинается заного.
Ну и ещё одна пара всё же не шибко интересна мне была.

По сути 8/10, если стараться быть объективным с моим небольшим опытом в плане ВН и моему большому интересу к юри-подобным вещам.

600р - дороговато, но оно того стоит. Ну и скидок в будущем никто не отменял.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040359947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1466784969}

author: {'steamid': '76561198193339889', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1457095441}
review:
作为一名百合爱好者这款游戏闻名已久，特别是这回无删减版直接登录steam也是开创了一个	[spoiler]R18[/spoiler]galgame的新纪元。但可能由于期望太高，试玩了以后感觉失望大于惊喜。下面是具体感受：

画面：作为visual novel，精致的立绘,各式各样或纯情或风骚或坚强或傲娇的美丽妹子（汉子）一直是最大的卖点，多少宅男宅女为了自己喜欢的角色的一个cg就能耗费一个晚上，在无尽的想象中挥洒着自己的青春与体力。而百合灵的画面在如今已发展的相当成熟的galgame里并不算出众，也许是作为一款百合向作品，百合灵的画面清新有余但总给人一种有些简陋的感觉，尤其在人物细节上，我认为还有很大提升空间。

音效：作为一款售价打折后仍高达85元的作品，我认为百合灵的音效做的可以说很糟糕，乐曲单调不说，很多时候连基本的烘托氛围的效果都没有起到，过场衔接效果有时也很不到位，我知道制作人很喜欢主题曲以及听妹子啦啦啦，但也请考虑玩家的游戏体验。。。

操作：不多说了，galgame你懂得

剧情：虽然开场有些老套，但剧情往后发展渐入佳境，人物设定一开始感觉有些失败但后来感觉也饱满了起来，[spoiler]总的来说就是一对幽灵百合帮助女校妹子们恋爱的故事[/spoiler]，总之一句话，有百合还不够吗？

总的来说，我认为百合灵的画面有待提高，音效也对不起它85的价格以及高达800m+的容量。喜欢这种题材的朋友建议等更大幅度的折扣入手。一直喜欢百合，一方面感觉很唯美，另外一方面百合相对来说少了一些荷尔蒙与性激素的相对纯真的感情也十分引人。也希望制作人能够再接再厉，继续推出优良的作品，展现出百合的唯美真挚。虽然本作我认为还存在种种不足，但我还是给出好评，毕竟百合无限好，虽然生不了。
